loans.name: Girasoles Del Centro Group

texts.en: Rosa is 43 years old and a widow with 8 children who range in age from 12 years to 27 years.  She is a member of the group and is very excited to begin a second loan cycle through Friendship Bridge.  Rosa sells natural fruit juices and other healthy foods for daily needs.  Her business income is able only to pay for the costs of maintaining her home.   She is requesting a new loan in order to buy more product to cover all of her customer demands because she feels that her own income is not sufficient without more investment capital.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits and necessary ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Hosion

texts.en:
Hosion is a 33-year-old, married man from Hebron city. He is a father and has one son and six daughters. He works as a construction worker, for which he earns a low, unstable income. Hosion also has a barn for raising sheep. His wife helps him with the barn work. 

Hosion took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. This will increase his productivity and his income. Hosion appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr: Kouma est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayant quatre enfants à charge, Kouma est une revendeuse de sacs qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des sacs, Kouma sollicite ce crédit pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari à la réussite scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Kouma is fifty-three years old, married and lives in Adidogomé. She is responsible for four children and earns a living by selling bags. Once a month she buys supplies and sells them in the surrounding neighbourhoods.

Kouma has requested this loan to buy more bags and make a good profit. This will be used to help her husband provide for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 60 bags for her business.

loans.name: Korina

texts.en:
Korina is just 19 years old and lives in the city of Medellín. Since she was a little girl she always has loved cooking. She used to cook with her mother who always cooks with her so she can learn all about it. Now she wants to go further with the cooking, trying to accomplish the dream she has. 

This young woman wants to start studying advanced cooking but right now she doesn’t have the money to pay for it.  She asked for a loan so she can pay for her studies in advanced cooking. Her whole family supports her and wants to see her triumph in life because she is a dedicated and very talented woman.  

Korina dreams of having her own restaurant where she can be the chef and decide the menu.  She expects someday this dream can come true but right now she’s focused on studying a lot to be a professional. You can help Korina with her goals with just a loan.

loans.use: pay for her studies in advanced cooking

loans.name: Jose Eulises

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, no estudio, actualmente está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene tres hijos, de los cuales ninguno vive junto a ellos.

José, desde hace 35 años se dedica a la albañilería, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a su padre, pero además de eso también se dedica a la siembra de maíz.

José, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como abonos y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra en donde sembrará.

José, sueña con tener un excelente cultivo y con la ayuda del crédito lo logrará.
texts.en:
José, 55, does not study. He is currently married, and his wife takes care of the housework. They have three children, none of whom live with them. José has worked in construction for 35 years. He learned this work thanks to his father, and he also grows corn.

José needs this loan in order to buy agricultural supplies such as compost, and to pay the lease on the land where he will sow his corn. José's dream is to have an excellent crop and with the help of a loan he will manage this.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay the lease on the land.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man he has a barber shop which has been opened for the past of one year. He has now a good experience and he is well known in his city, Rafah.

Muhammad loves his job and always thinks how to improve it. Muhammad took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Muhammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal deals in growing and selling cocoa which he has practiced for many years. He lives in Bundibugyo Uganda with his 4 children who all attend school. He works hard to meet his family's basic needs and dreams of educating his children to University level. He is however challenged by inadequate capital to buy more land and expand his cocoa growing business.

Micheal is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children ahead of the third term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is hardworking and therefore takes the sole responsibility of looking after her two children who are in school. She has dealt in buying and selling charcoal, mainly to local people, for 10 years now for her family up-keep. She hopes to expand her charcoal business and construct rentals for generating additional income.

Joyce intends to use the loan to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Everine

texts.en:
Everine is 23 years old and married with 3 children; two attending of them attend school. She currently deals in cocoa farming and gets additional income from selling rice on her market stall.

She lives in Bundibugyo Uganda with her family, and hopes to educate her children and provide the basic needs for them. She faces the challenge of limited capital. Everine has requested a loan to add capital by buying cocoa and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to add capital by buying cocoa and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma lives in Talibon, Bohol with her husband. He is engaged in fishing and she also learned to assist him in his needs for their livelihood. Alma also sells his catch in the neighborhood and in the market. Alma requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fishing materials like fish nets, hooks and fuel.

In the future, Alma would like to invest in another business opportunity to increase her profitability.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, hooks and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.pt:
Senhor David tem 63 anos de idade, casado e pai de 8 filhos dos quais 7 são independentes e uma filha estuda frequentando o ensino secundário, é pensionista, vive em casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um neto.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, pedra, varões para a colocação da placa da varanda da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e construir estaleiro de venda de blocos.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
David is 63 years old, married, and father of eight children of whom seven are independent and one daughter is studying. She is attending secondary school. He is a pensioner, lives in his own house with his family, and supports a grandson.

The financed amount will be used to buy cement, sand, stone, and rods to put up the boards for his home's varanda.

In the future, he wants to finish the construction of his house and construct a builders yard to sell bricks. Repaying the loan without delinquency is his biggest challenge as a way to guarantee that there will be more loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, and rods to put up the boards for his home's varanda.

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 3 Group

texts.en:
Crucita is one of the coordinators of her group, which is called Fe y Accion (Faith and action) 1. She is from the city of Hato Mayor, which is one the most rural cities in the country and whose economy is dependent on agriculture. She is a dedicated entrepreneur who sells from her home clothes to women, men and kids. She is the mother of 3 children and she lives together with her long term partner. 

Crucita is very excited to receive her 4th loan from Esperanza International after having satisfactorily repaid her previous loans and, with each one, taken steps towards growing her business. For more than three years, she has had loans with Esperanza. She is planning to invest her latest loan in the purchase of a variety of clothes. She plans to reinvest in her business and improve it in the short term to have a sustainable future. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
For the past 5 months, Nenita has operated a sari-sari (variety) store. She sold items ranging from bread, eggs, and sugar to chocolate drinks, noodles, seasonings, cooking oil and toiletries.

She is a married woman with seven children. Two of her children are still attending school. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Tubigon, Bohol.

Nenita has requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy 2 sacks of rice, liquor, soft drinks and assorted dry goods. These resources are essentials that could improve her daily income. With these, more customers will come and purchase. As a result, Nenita could afford to buy healthy diets for the whole family and be able to handle her finances.

She is hopeful that her sari-sari (variety) store business will become successful to be able to continue support the schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice, liquor, soft drinks and assorted dry goods.

loans.name: Ma. Leny

texts.en:
Maria Leny is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this for 30 years. Aside from fishing, they also engaged in other businesses like raising pigs and chickens, while her husband is running a tailoring business.

They work together to raise their eight children. Four of these children are still needing to attend school. So, Ma. Leny is asking for a loan for boat maintenance and for additional capital for her livestock business such as piglets and chickens. She also buys feed for them as well.

loans.use: to do boat maintenance and to buy piglets, chickens and feed.

loans.name: Pabitra

texts.en:
Mrs.Pabitra resident of Badikhel, Lalitpur, lives with her husband and has one child aged 5 years. Mrs. Pabitra is engaged in making furniture and other useful items out of bamboo. Her own business started 3 years ago. She sells her products in a local market.

She wants to buy more raw materials for preparation of furniture from bamboo. As she has a good experience in this business, the market is good and she keeps the same business, which is very popular among the people. It is her first loan from BPW patan.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and other useful tools to make furniture and other different items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells basic commodities like  sugar, spices, shampoo, coffee, powdered soap, fabric conditioner and chips. She is married woman with two children ages 9 and 7 year old respectively.
Her husband has an income that would help cater the family's daily needs.

 She  is asking for a loan  to buy assorted stocks like beverages, assorted canned goods and  toiletries .
These are essentials in keeping her store full of stocks. Thus, her income will improve and she could pay her obligations. And in addition to that, she could provide the needs of her children.

 She is hoping that her small business will improve and become successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks like beverages, assorted canned goods and  toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an inventory to resell it in his rickshaw

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 27 años de edad,conviviente vive con su coyuge y su hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Mocupe que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Rosa espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is twenty-seven years old, and she is common-law-married. She lives with her spouse and son in a rural zone in the district of Mocupe. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque Region on Peru's northern coastal plain. The residents of this district primarily work in agriculture, livestock-raising, and commerce.

Rosa works raising and selling small animals, such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others, and her business is located at her own home. She has one year of experience in the business, with very good personal and work references in the zone.

The loan that she is requesting will be used for the purchase of more animals, such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, as well as for feed. With this, Rosa expects to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate more income. Therefore, she will increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
She is Mary Jane, 47 years old, married to Nueva, a 50-year-old government employee. They have two children who are studying in college. The cost of college education is usually pocket draining, hence Mary Jane raises hogs in their backyard to add income for her family. It is a promising enterprise but the return of investment takes several months. She has to advance considerable amount of capital before she earns her profit. As of now, her capital starts to drain and she still has small pigs to raise.

She appeals for PhP 13,000 additional capital to buy more feeds, medicines and vitamins. In two to three weeks, she can already sell one fattened hog and she can surely restore her capital. Slowly, she expands her small pigpen hoping that someday it can grow into a big piggery that can supply more consumers in their community and nearby areas. She dreams of completing her children’s education that will pave the way to their brighter future. She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more feeds, medicines and vitamins

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a native bags making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her native bags making business.

Teresita has been in this business for 6 years. Teresita earns more income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her native bags making business

loans.name: Ciruela Group 3

texts.en:
Marta is 50 years old. She has lived with her father since she was 8 months old because her mother died. Her father left her and her brother 3 years later to live with another woman, so Marta lived with her grandmother. Her brother died a few months after her father left. At the age of 13, Marta got married. Due to the war, she and her husband had to run away to the mountains, where 5 of her children died. Since returning, she has been weaving, and her husband has been working with wood.   

Now, she makes wicker baskets. She first contacted the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life approximately 5 years ago. With the help of the association, she formed a group with fifteen women, the Ciruela Group, which now has 26 members. Marta leads Ciruela Group 3, a group of 9 women who invest their loans to make wicker baskets, raise livestock, and undertake other activities. All of the women in the group are of the Maya Ixil ethnicity. The average group member has 6 children, and the average loan amount is 2,025 GTQ.  Additionally, the average group member is 35 years old, and 78% of the group members are illiterate.  

Marta's first loan was to buy wicker.  She has also invested loan proceeds in cattle, but both of her cows died.  Since then, she has invested in wicker baskets and weaving.  She will invest this loan in wicker to make baskets and to knit yarns.

loans.use: to purchase wicker to manufacture baskets.

loans.name: Dilmaya

texts.en:
Dilmaya is 38 years old married woman. Making furniture out of bamboo is her family business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.

She took loan from Patan BPW for the first time and used her most recent one to buy raw materials for her business that is bamboo.

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bamboo

loans.name: El Milagro 1 Group

texts.en:
Lorenza is the group coordinator for El Milagro (The Miracle) 1. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor. Her home is a compound for her two children. She is taking care of them alone since she is a single mother. The other members run different businesses selling miscellaneous products, clothes, food, etc.

This is Lorenza's 18th loan. She sells shoes, clothes and accessories from her home and by walking around her community and others. She would like to continue expanding her business by increasing her inventory to access more clients and sell more products. She will use this loan to buy many pairs of shoes, sandals, sneakers, and other types of shoes, as well as clothes and women's accessories. Lorenza says she enjoys doing business and her most important dream is to finish building her house, which she started by saving her profits after she started her business almost seven years ago with her first Esperanza loan. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en: Abir is a 44-year-old, married woman of three children, all of whom are still studying.  Her husband is the main income source for the family.  He has worked in the construction field for many years.  Abir works from home as a private teacher, where she welcomes students from all neighborhoods.  Currently, she is requesting a loan from Vitas s.a.l., a Kiva partner, to buy a photocopy machine.  She states that she is thankful for Kiva that allowed her to ease her work flow.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine

loans.name: Kumri

texts.en: Kumri is a bright and generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1961. She is living in a busy big city with her family. She is divorced and has two daughters. She has worked at the philharmonic institution for more than one year. She was a singer with national instruments. She became older and lost her voice and left the stage. She is satisfied to work at the institute and teach students things that she learned years ago. Her daughter is feeling bad. Kumri decided to show her daughter to doctors. She is planning to provide her with a diagnostic analysis. She appealed to IMON and Kiva asking for financial support to pay for medical services for her daughter. She awaits your compassion and believes she will be supported.

loans.use: to pay for medical services for her daughter in the hospital.

loans.name: Hussam

texts.en: Hussam is a young man he has a barber shop which has been opened for the past four years. He has now a good experience and he is well known in his city, Jabalia. Hussam loves his job and always thinks how to improve it. Hussam took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Hussam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new tools and make some decoration for his barber shop.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes catches and sells fish and crabs to the locals in the community. She is a 44-year-old, married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and her youngest is 5 years old. She has been fishing for more than 20 years now. She needs additional capital to sustain her livelihood. 

She is asking for a loan to buy plastic screens. These will help improve her catch. With these, she will be able to sell more crabs and to provide her family with nutritious meals. Mercedes could also continue to send her children to school in preparation for a brighter future.

She would like to properly manage her fishing business to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy plastic screens for fishing.

loans.name: Walter Amador

texts.es:
WALTER TIENE 69 AÑOS, CASADO. VIVE CON SU ESPOSA VIVEN EN CASA PROPIA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 30 AÑOS, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, CONOCIDA COMO EX COOPERATIVA CAYALTI, PROVINCIA CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

WALTER SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO COMO PEON EN CONSTRUCCION. DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR DE PEON EN CONSTRUCCION. BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARA HERRAMIENTAS PARA SU ACTIVIDAD, Y PRESTAR UN MEJOR SERVICIO ASÍ AUMENTAR SU NIVEL DE INGRESOS Y MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Walter, 69, is married. He lives with his wife in their own home. For more than 30 years he has lived in a community dedicated to business, agriculture and livestock. It is known as a former cooperative; Cayalti, Chiclayo Province, in the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru.

Walter works offering his services as a construction labourer for several years. He is known in the area for his work, and has good personal and professional references. With this loan he will buy tools for his work so he can offer a better service and so increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools for carrying out his work.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Sos is a singer. He lives in Eghegnadzor town with his wife and three grown children.

Sos works at local and nearby regions' restaurants as a singer. He sings during wedding ceremonies and parties and is well known among locals.

To be able to purchase professional microphone and loudspeakers needed for his work, Sos has applied for this loan.

Sos has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Sos will be very grateful to lenders for their support and faith in his work. Sos is sure to have successful cooperation with Kiva and SEF.

loans.use: to buy a professional microphone and loudspeakers.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
This is Eva, 51 years old, from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. Her husband, Hernando, is an overseas Filipino worker who has been away from her and their three children for several years already. He had to leave them to seek for a more decent wage abroad. It’s difficult for Eva to accompany and guide their growing up children alone but she keeps on. She has to endure the situation and pursue the completion of her children’s schooling so as to pay off the sacrifices of her husband abroad. 

Eva doesn’t focus on loneliness, instead she concentrates on her variety store business. She wants to develop it into a grocery store with wide selection and complete supplies someday. In a grocery store, customers instantly pay in cash or through credit card. Hence, she can lessen the debts of her customers and she can manage her capital wisely. For now, she would like to ask for PHP 30,000 additional capital to buy more stock of dry goods and bottles of beverages. She’s really working hard hoping that her income would be enough to support all their needs, so that her husband need not work abroad anymore. Praying that you could be God’s instrument to grant her request and contribute few steps to make her family whole someday. 

Eva draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods and bottles of beverages

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
After Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013, variety stores located in devastated areas like Iloilo had a significant decline in terms of profit. It is of course expected because almost all businesses in those areas dwindled. Entrepreneurs worked hard in the past several months to “build back better” their enterprises. Jasmin, 61, is one of those who was able to rise above the situation and regained her variety store operation. She is single who extends financial support to her relatives once in a while. And because she has no children who she can depend on in times of emergency, she needs to save enough for her retirement.
 
As of now, she plans to purchase more canned goods, grocery items, and cases of beverages. She implores your generous assistance to enable her to buy all these through a loan worth PhP 15,000. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business. 
 
Jasmin is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, grocery items, and cases of beverages

loans.name: Bouangpatao Group

texts.en:
Bounsoo is excited that the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Bounsoo and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Bounsoo and her group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years, but is known to function for up to 5 years. Bounsoo and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Bounsoo and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her barn.

loans.name: Laveai

texts.en: Laveai is a 28-year-old woman with 2 children who has been unmarried for 4 years. She runs a business of designing clothes in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. Laveai has requested a loan to buy materials, needles, threads, a paint brush, color paints, elei design etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint colours, materials, needles, threads, paint brush, elei board (elei design), etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-years-old single young man from Khan Younis city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.

Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies psychology. He wants to take his B.Sc. degree and find a job in the future to support his family.
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to write the reports and home works easily.
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies for a B.Sc. in Psychology.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge owns and operates a tricycle (motorcycle with side car). He is a married man with four children. Two of his children are still attending school. He earns a living by transporting passengers from one place to another. He has been operating a tricycle transportation service for eight years.

Jorge is asking for a loan to pay for changing the oil and overhauling his vehicle. This will provide safety since he transports his passengers. Thus, he will be able to continue to earn his livelihood and provide his family with good food and be able to support his children's studies.

In the future, Jorge would like to improve his source of income, to save money to purchase another tricycle for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to pay for changing the oil and overhauling his vehicle.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 68 years old, married and has five children of adult age. He is a farmer from Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

He is a retired government employee. He is also a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC where he enjoys the perks of membership.

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers and insecticides. Cesar wants to cultivate his agricultural area and earn extra income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Sherry

texts.en: Sherry is a 38-year-old woman from Conceccion, Iloilo. She is married with three children ages 14, 11 and eight years old. Her husband is a businessman while she is engaged in buying and selling dry goods such as RTW (ready to wear) products and plastic ware. She has been doing this business for three years. Sherry wants to have sustainable livelihood for the future of her children. With this, she wishes to lend money for additional capital to buy assorted RTW such as dresses, pants, shirts, under wares, slippers, sandal and bags. She also buys assorted plastic ware such as containers and bowls.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, shirts, under wares, slippers, sandals, bags containers and bowls.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Fe has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like nipa leaves, etc..

Fe has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like nipa leaves, etc.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en: Emine is requesting your financial help and kindness to pay for a scheduled surgery on herself this time."I was recently scheduled for a surgery and I'm panicked of the process and also for the money I don't have at the moment," said Emine to the branch assistant.

loans.use: to pay for a scheduled surgery of herself

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Solar Solution panel for lighting her business.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 19-years-old single young man from Jabalia city. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.

Nader is a student in the university where he studies Elementary Education. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Nader took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Nader will be able to write the reports and home works easily.
Nader appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his BA from university in Elementary Education

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en: Jelyn is a 43-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with four teenage children ages 18, 16, 14 and nine years old. Jelyn works hard to raise her four children. To support them, she sells food such as boiled egg, fried chicken and rice. She has been doing this for 18 years. Jelyn wants to have better means of living. With this, she needs additional capital to improve her livelihood. She asks a loan of PHP6000 for additional capital for her food selling business such as eggs, chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices and rice

loans.use: to buy eggs, chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices and rice

loans.name: Queenie

texts.en:
Thirty-eight year old Queenie hails in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. A mother of four children. Her oldest child is 22 and the youngest is 3. 
She runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells commodities like powdered milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, matches, eggs, edible oil, soft drinks and avon products like whitening soap, lotion, cologne and ladies apparel. It has been more than years now that she has been operating a sari-sari store.

She  is asking for a loan to buy supplies like soft drinks, toiletries and Avon items like body spray, lotion and beauty products. These resources are tools for progress of her livelihood. It could maintain the stocks of her store and attract buyers to come.
Queenie would be able to settle her obligation and continue support her children's needs. She is also hoping for business improvement in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy supplies like softdrinks, toiletries and Avon items like body spray, lotion and beauty products.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lenita has a food vending business in the Philippines and has requested a 10500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business like sugar, oil, etc..

Lenita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business like sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Kimlab's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three children from Kampong Cham province, Kimlab is 48 years old. Two of her children are in school. 

She earn incomes via farming rice and she is a craftswoman who sews sugar palm leaf to make sugar-palm-hat(Khmer traditional hat). She has also been involved in her rice farm for 30 years. She can save about 34,700 KHR per day. The drought on her rice farm is the main challenge that she faces this year. 

This is her second cycle for Kimlab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); she fully repaid her past loan. She earned income from her past loan to help improve her family’s living situation. In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her new loan portion to buy more sugar palm leaf use for sewing to make more Khmer-traditional-hat (sugar-palm-hat) for sale in market.She hopes that she can get more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more sugar palm leaf use for sewing to make more Khmer-traditional-hat (sugar-palm-hat) for sale in market.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution lighting system for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution electricity  panel for her business place

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro is a 18-years-old single young man from Nablus city. His father works in a sewing workshop where he gets a low and unstable income. Thus income is barely covers all the family needs.

Amro is a student in the university where he studies Internal Design . He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.
Amro took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Amro will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.
Amro appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester for a BA in Internal Design

loans.name: Claudia Ivette

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 34 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, actividad que ya lleva realizando 2 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Claudia vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos un varón de 18 años y una niña de 5 años de edad. Claudia desea invertir en su pupusería, ya que no logra suplir los pedidos que le son solicitados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz, harina de arroz, entre otros para aumentar sus ventas y no quedar mal con los pedidos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hardworking woman, who at age 34, works making and selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. She has been engaged in this occupation for two years, so she has a lot of customers who request her products.

Claudia wants to invest in her pupusa shop, as she cannot manage to fill the orders, so she is requesting a loan with FUSAI. She will invest it in pork rinds, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, and other items, in order to increase her sales and not fall behind on the orders.

loans.use: to invest in pork rinds, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, and other items, in order to increase her sales and not fall behind on her orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university degree B.Sc. in I T

loans.name: Restita

texts.en:
She is a vendor living in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. Her name is Restita, a 45 year old married woman with four dependents. Her oldest child is 17 and the youngest is 7. She engages in selling bananas. She has been selling bananas for 3 years now.

 Restita has requested aloan in the amount of 6,000 PHP  to buy more stocks of banana to re sell. With the additional capital, she could purchase variety of bananas to be sold to the local in her place. Thus, her income will augment and enables her to provide the basic necessities of her family. Thus, she could able to roll- out her capital and start to expand her business.

In the future, she hopes that there is great improvement as she handles it properly for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of banana to re sell

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en: Trinidad, is a town in Bohol. This place has been known for farming businesses.  24 years old Maricor is no different. She hails from this place and farming has been her way of generating income for her family. She also raise hogs.  She is married with a three-year-old son. She requested for a loan so she can buy piglets, fertilizer for her farm and marine plywood for some house repair. Business profitability is her main goal so she can support her child’s schooling. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily needs and future savings.

loans.use: to buy buy piglets,  fertilizer for her farm and marine plywood for some house repair

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en: Apolinaria is into farming to support her family. She and her family lives in San Miguel, a town in Bohol. She and her husband helped each other in tilling the land hoping for a good harvest. This is to support their two children ages 3 and 5. She applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be use to acquire fertilizers, rice seedlings and pesticides. They are expecting a better yield on their crops for having the means now to buy the needed farming maintenance. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and future business investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, rice seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Since 2005, Cesar is into farming rice and vegetables to support his family. He is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is 62 years old, married and has two adult children.   
With the money from the loan, he plans to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. The additional income will go to his family's daily consumption and savings. In the future, he plans to grow different type of root crops for more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: 51 year old Dionesio is from San Miguel, Bohol. He earns a living through rice farming and growing vegetables.  With the money that he will get from the loan, he plans to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and seeds of different type of vegetables. From this loan, he  expect a good harvest and an increase in business profitability. The additional income will go to his family's daily consumption and possible new business opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and seeds of different type of vegetables

loans.name: Jlg-001(A)-Mudhaligowndanur Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. This group of 3, led by Kalaiyarasi, living in Kulithalai, in the state of Tamil Nadu, has understood the importance of having a toilet at home. 

Kalaiyarasi is 31 years old and has a family size of 3. Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites. 

Seeking to improve their situation, the group members seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help their families access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities in her home by installing a toilet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair supplies: gel, shampoo, razor blades, and more

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 48-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband has been running his cosmetic store for the past five years, and is responsible for supporting the entire family.

Khadija's husband has to purchase personal care products like creams, brushes, bands, and other cosmetics, but due to insufficient funds her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for his business.

Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase these items. This loan will enable him to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Khadija is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband's personal care business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MINIBANK.
La socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de artesanía, la  socia se siente agradecida  con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia sigue realizando bordados para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the MINIBANK communal bank.

The member continues dedicating herself to the artisan business. The member feels thankful for the loan and commits to fulfilling the installment payments. The member continues making emroideries for her customers that order them from her. The member wishes to be able to continue working so that, in this manner, she can continue supporting her family. The member is applying for the loan to buy sweaters, among others.

loans.use: to buy sweaters among other things.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is 60 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eduarda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as charcoal, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Eduarda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as charcoal, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Supreme Family Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Aminata who is 34 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She is married with four children. Her children are all school going children. Aminata belongs to a solidarity group of four women and one man, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams. “Supreme Family” is the name of Aminata’s solidarity group. “Aminata” group needs a total loan of 7,500,000SLL of which Aminata will receive 2,000,000SLL in order to purchase more 5 cartons bulb, 3 carton suckers, 6 rolls electrical cables for her business.

Aminata trades in Electrical appliancies in one of the main market in the city centre of Freetown. Her business which has been in existence for over fifteen years is the main source of her livelihood and that of her family and supports her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 am to 6 pm. Aminata is a hardworking woman, See Aminata (in the middle of the group picture).
In the future, Aminata plans to support her children to acquire University education. She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman. She will be very appreciative to anyone that can help. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase 5 cartons bulbs, 3 carton suckers, 6 rolls electrical cables  for her electrical supplies business

loans.name: Salaad Ground Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the leader of Salaad Ground Solidarity Group which is made up of five members. All five members including Isatu are engaged in small scale trading but selling different products.

Isatu who is 42 years old was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people. She sells ready-made clothing. Isatu has been selling clothing for the past 15 years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay fees for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family.
Isatu and other group members of Salaad solidarity are requesting for their first loan with a total of 5,000,000SLL of this amount, Isatu will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase dozens of ready-made clothes for her business. See Isatu stands on the right of the picture with white dress .

Isatu is married and has a cheerful family of three children with the ages of 16, 9 and 9 months old.
Isatu hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a dwelling house and also prepare for her old age. Isatu hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Isatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase dozens more of ready-made clothing for her business.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en: Shanti is 35 years old. She is married and has two children aged 13 and 12. In 1998 she established her bamboo craft business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She takes loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy raw materials and bamboo for her business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bamboo for making different items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university fees for her first semester leading to a degree in Social Sciences

loans.name: Hiperbanco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HIPERBANCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Violeta, la socia sigue  dedicándose a ejercer su carrera de docente del nivel primario, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando como dicente el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua trabajando en uno de los colegios de la ciudad,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales didácticos.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Hiperbanco" communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco.

The member Violeta continues making a living pursuing her career as an elementary school teacher. She has been working for some time as a teacher, which is going well for her thanks to her daily determination at work. She works in one of the colleges in the city and she hopes to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family.

Violeta appreciates those who are part of this dream by means of the loan and she promises to comply with the repayment agreement within the specified time frame.

She is asking for the loan to buy teaching supplies.

The members who appear in the adjoining photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy teaching supplies.

loans.name: Manuel Sacramento

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 18 años de edad, conviviente, sin hijos vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, de la provincia de Chiclayo, Region Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.

Manuel se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería, contando con herramientas propia, palana, pico y oz; con más de 3 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas de trabajo, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 18 years old and in a common law relationship with no children. He lives with his family in the district of Oyotún, in a rural zone in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.

Manuel makes his living providing services as a day laborer. He has his own tools, such as a shovel, a pick and a sickle. He has over 3 years in this business, which is based in his home. He seeks a loan to make improvements to his home and to maintain his tools and equipment. The investment will allow him to keep his tools and equipment in better condition, which will have a big impact on his business. He wants to increase the productivity of his services, to be able to meet the diverse needs of the customers in his area, and to increase his income in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: with the maintenance of his tools and equipment.

loans.name: Ciruela Group 1

texts.en:
Isabela is nineteen years old, she was the fourth child of her parents. She did not study because the school was far away from her home and her family did not allow her to go to school. Since she was a child she help her parents to make wicker baskets.

She married at the age of fourteen because of her needs, she worked a lot for her parents.
Her husband had an essential goods store, she has have two credits, with the first credit they invested in replenishing the store, now with the third credit they expect to expand their business, they will invest in buying chicken meat, eggs, beans, vegetables, fruit, bread, dairy products and groceries.

Isabela is the leader of Ciruela Group 1, the group is integrated by eight women, 38% will invest their loans in manufacturing activities, 25% in agricultural activities, 25% in tissue, and 12% in retail. Seven women are from the ethnicity Maya Ixil, and one form the ethnicity Quiche Maya. On average each member of the group has four children. The average amount of their loans is Q 2,025. Their average age is 31 years old.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat, eggs, beans, vegetables, fruit, bread, dairy products and groceries

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene un hijo  pequeño. Actualmente trabaja en un colegio como profesora de educación inicial. 
Estudió  siete años la carrera de educación inicial, eligió ésta profesión por el gusto que tiene por los niños, es muy paciente con ellos y le gusta mucho la idea de ayudarlos en su formación y educación.
Para poder terminar la carrera ella pasó por muchos inconvenientes sobretodo económicos ya que no es fácil poder costear una educación, por lo que ella se siente muy agradecida de recibir el apoyo de personas que no ha tenido la oportunidad de conocer.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago del trámite para su titulación.
texts.en:
Liz, 30, is married and she has a young son. She currently works in a school as an early childhood educator.

She studied early childhood education for seven years and she chose this profession, because she enjoys being around kids. She is very patient with them and she really likes helping them learn. In order to finish her degree, she experienced many difficulties, especially financially since it is not easy paying for an education.

She is very grateful for the support she has received from people she has not had the opportunity of meeting. The loan she received will be used to pay for the formalities of her degree.

loans.use: to pay for the formalities of her degree.

loans.name: Edwin Adali

texts.es:
Edwin, de 40 años de edad, no posee ningún nivel educativo, actualmente está soltero, a su lado vive su hija de 16 años de edad que está estudiando.

Edwin, cuando tenía 20 años de edad, empezó a trabajar en un taller pintando vehículos, de esta manera trabajó 12 años; luego decidió colocar su propio taller de enderezado y pintura de vehículos.- Edwin, no pude movilizar sus piernas y eso le impide realizar otra actividad donde tenga que movilizarse, pero con sus manos puede hacer cualquier actividad.

Edwin, necesita el crédito para comprar herramientas de trabajo como pulidoras, taladro y un compresor de aire, teniendo estas herramientas, podrá hacer su trabajo más rápido.

El sueño de Edwin, es poder ayudarle a su hija para que estudie en la universidad.
texts.en:
Edwin is 40 years old and does not have any level of education. He is currently single and his 16 year old daughter who goes to school lives with him. 

When Edwin was 20 years old, he started to work in a garage painting cars. He did this work for 12 years and then decided to open his own vehicle repair and painting garage. Edwin cannot move his legs and this prevents him from doing other work where he has to move, but he can do any work with his hands
 
Edwin needs the loan to buy work tools like polishing machines, a drill, and an air compressor. Having these tools can make his work faster.

Edwin's dream is to be able to help his daughter so that she can study at the university.

loans.use: to buy work tools like polishing machines, a drill, and an air compressor.

loans.name: Leocadio

texts.es:
Leocadio es un hombre de 58 años de edad, soltero, tiene una hija de 20 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de papas fritas.
Él es constante, emprendedor y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la urbanización ‘san pedro de laja’ ubicada al sur a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad, donde los habitantes no cuentan con servicios básicos, sólo energía eléctrica. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-8 grados centígrados.
Leocadio raza de bronce, de cabello negro corto y ojos cansados. Su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general. Su vida la comparte con su hija que se dedica al mismo negocio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua potable ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de papas fritas; él se encarga de comprar grandes cantidades de papa para cortarla en rodajas y freírlas en aceite, “inicie mi negocio por mi propia iniciativa, solo tuve la buena voluntad de independizarme…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su hija colabora, la desventaja es el transporte de las bolsas de papa. Su sueño es construir su casa, él desea realizar la ampliación de la cocina para la producción de papas fritas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Leocadio solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de la cocina para la producción de papas fritas.
texts.en:
Leocadio is a 58-year-old man. He is single and has a 20-year-old daughter. His business is producing fried potatoes.

He is dependable, enterprising and very responsible. He operates his business in the "San Pedro de Laja" settlement, located 20 kilometers south of the city. The inhabitants do not have basic services, only electrical power. The area has a cold and dry climate, with daytime temperatures varying between 0 and 8 degrees Centigrade.

Leocadio has bronze skin, short black hair and tired eyes. His mother tongue is Aymará, which he speaks in his neighborhood. He also speaks Spanish due to the general culture. He shares his life with his daughter, who works in the same business. They live in a house of their own built of brick and cement with a metal roof and wooden floor. The house has electricity but does not have running water or sewer connections.

His business is making fried potatoes. He buys large quantities of potatoes, cuts them into slices, and fries them in oil. "I started my business on my own initiative; all I had was the strong wish to become independent," he comments. The advantage of his business is that his daughter works with him, and the disadvantage is the transportation of the sacks of potatoes. His dream is to build a house. He wants to expand his kitchen for the production of fried potatoes. This is his first loan sequence with the institution during the 12 years he has dedicated to this work.

For these reasons, Leocadio is requesting a loan to expand his kitchen for the production of fried potatoes.

loans.use: to expand his kitchen for the production of fried potatoes.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita farms to support her family. She and her family live in Trinidad, a town in the province of Bohol. She is married with three grown children. She works hard tilling the land, hoping for a good harvest.

Florita has applied for a loan, knowing that this could help her in her business. The money that she will get will be use to acquire fertilizer. She is anticipating a better yield on her rice fields once the fertilizer becomes available. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily needs and on future business investments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Andrita

texts.en:
Andrita is 54 years old and has six children. She is married and has two children who are still in school. Andrita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Andrita has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Dexie

texts.en:
Dexie is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dexie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries like bread, cooking oil, dried fish, coffee, etc. to sell.

Dexie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, cooking oil, dried fish, coffee, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like bread, cooking oil, dried fish, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 52 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Elsie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Elsie has been pig fattening for eight years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is single and has a banana farming business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Evangeline has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 43 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dioscora has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years. Dioscora requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Dioscora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Topisitar

texts.en:
Topisitar is the mother of six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in buying and selling foodstuffs like beans, Irish potatoes, and ground nuts. She earns additional income from selling cocoa, having started the business to raise school fees for her children.

Topisitar works hard and plans to expand the business, but she lacks enough capital. She is requesting a loan to buy foodstuffs like cassava, rice and others for selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like cassava, rice and others for selling to her customers.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 59-year-old widow from San Miguel, Bohol. She has run a rice farming business for 20 years now. She mostly devotes her time to farming, as this has been her source of income.

Narcisa is requesting for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use it to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and groceries for consumption. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm to cultivate so she can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings and groceries.

loans.name: Mingueras Solidarias Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Mingueras Solidarias” está en su 3er ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, un medio que les permitirá medir su situación de vida, y conforme a ello poder trabajar por mejorarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Estelvina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas y después sale a vender por su barrio, ya que tiene una muy buena clientela que se formó gracias a que sus comidas son muy ricas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos para seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, hortalizas, panificados y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The "Mingueras Solidarias" Group is in its 3rd cycle of the Women's Communal Bank Program. They are in the Elimination of Poverty Program, a process that will enable them to assess their living situations, and accordingly, work to improve them.

One of the members, Señora Estelvina, sells food. She makes it herself, starting in the very early hours, and afterwards, she goes out into her neighborhood to sell it. She has very good customers because her food is so tasty.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in purchasing products to continue making her dishes, such as green vegetables, meat, chicken, vegetables, bakery products, and other items. She appreciates the opportunity that she is receiving to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase products for making her dishes, such as vegetables, meat, chicken, green vegetables, bakery products, and other items.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
From the town of San Miguel, Bohol, Efrena is a 54-year-old married mother of eight children. For many years now, Efrena has been farming rice for a living. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy an engine for the hand tractor. This way, she will not spend money on the rental fee.

She is confident that with additional capital, she can maximize her profit while supporting the needs of her children. In the future, Efrena hopes to maintain her business and be open to other opportunities to improve her family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the hand tractor

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
Jena is 46 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Jena is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Jena has been farming bananas for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Blesilda is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Blesilda has a food and fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of pork chicharon and fruit to sell.

Blesilda has been in this business for eight years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of pork chicharon and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her rug making business. Judith has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda works hard to support her family. Melinda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years now.

Melinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. Evangeline is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Evangeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Norjane

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Norjane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and direct selling personal collection products. Norjane is borrowing PHP 14, 000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers for her business.

Norjane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Corason

texts.en:
Corason is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corason is 48 years old and her three children are in school.

Corason has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years. Corason requested a 35,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more beauty products for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Corason would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sanitary pads, detergent soap, rice, biscuits, snack foods, beer, etc. to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, detergent soap, rice, biscuits, snack foods, beer, etc.

Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sanitary pads, detergent soap, rice, biscuits, snack foods, beer, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is 41 years old, is married to an electrician and has three children. She previously requested a 10,000 EGP loan from Kiva and successfully repaid it. She has a small clothing business and she is requesting a 15,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to expand her business, help her husband with the family income and afford education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is 38, married and has two daughters and three sons. He is a farmer and this is the only source of income for the family. He decided to start a small fattening project and is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to expand his project and guarantee better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the raw materials necessary for production: flour, eggs, milk, cheese, sandwiches, and a variety of beverages to make adjustments to the store.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie of San Miguel, Bohol has had a rice farming business for 13 years now. She also runs a sari-sari store business. She is 45 years old and married with three children ages 15, 19 and 20.

Elvie is inspired to work hard so she can help her husband who works as habal-habal driver (motorcycle for transport). She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy merchandise such as noodles, canned food, coffee, milk, sugar, bath soap and detergent.

In the future, she hopes to manage her business well so she can have a better return on investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy merchandise such as noodles, canned food, coffee, milk, sugar, bath soap and detergent

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina, a married 58-year-old mother of a 20-year-old son, lives in Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries to sell such as chips, canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, toiletries, gasoline, soft drinks and other items. With these purchases, she will be able to improve her store and augment her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell such as chips, canned goods, candies, snack foods, soap, toiletries, gasoline, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr: Mariée et  mère de trois enfants, Abravi est une femme âgée de 41 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Abravi est une couturière qui expose des pagnes dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile et les revendent à ses clients. Pour s’approvisionner, Abravi se rend au marché quatre fois par mois. Abravi  demande ce prêt pour commander des pagnes en vue de gagner un gain et pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et prendre bien soins d’eux.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Abravi is a woman of 41 who lives in Tokoin. She is a seamstress and has a sewing workshop located in her home where she displays her pagnes and sells them to clients.

To buy her supplies, Abravi goes to the market four times a month. She is requesting this loan to order some pagnes so as to make a profit and be able to help her husband to support their children and take good care of them.

loans.use: to buy five pairs of pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth)

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Florida is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Florida has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Florida requested a 35,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional beauty products for her business.

In the future, Florida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products for her business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Julieta has been in this business for 15 years now.

Julieta requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like fish, spices, seasonings, noodles, vegetables, etc. for her business. Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like fish, spices, seasonings, noodles, vegetables, etc. for her business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marjorie has been in this business for 1 year now.

Marjorie requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old, married and has two children, both are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening, in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Nenita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
A resident of Trinidad, Boho, 65-year-old Marina is married with six adult children. For 10 years now she has operated a sari-sari (variety) store selling basic household goods such as sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, rice, seasoning and toiletries.

Marina is requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise such as chips, biscuits, beverages, toiletries, rice and canned goods. By increasing her inventory, she will attract more customers and definitely increase her sales. Marina hopes that with additional capital, she can expand her sari-sari store into a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy chips, biscuits, beverages, toiletries, rice, and canned goods

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Kayi  est une veuve  femme  et mère de deux enfants vivant ensemble à Baguida.  Pour soutenir sa famille, Kayi vend des mèches et tissages dans son salon de coiffure en s’approvisionnant deux fois par mois au marché. Kayi réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Kayi  désire ce prêt pour commander des mèches et  tissages afin d’agrandir son stock et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à couvrir les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 42, Kayi is a widow and the mother of two children; they live together in Baguida. In order to support her family, Kayi sells hair extensions and braids in her beauty salon. She stocks up twice a month in the market.

Kayi's business is profitable, but in order to satisfy the needs of her clients appropriately, she would like to have this loan to order hair extensions and braids to expand her stock. She can then help her children with their schooling and cover the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy 90 hair extensions and 100 braids

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
