Ramón es un pequeño productor de café que vive junto a su compañera, en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Para él, cada día es una oportunidad para salir adelante, y trabajar duro para superar los obstáculos a los que se enfrenta en las labores agrícolas.

Para este año, Ramón está solicitando un crédito para comprar insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal y lograr una mejor cosecha este año, y con ello mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.

Su sueño es que los precios del café sean cada vez mejores para los productores y poder seguir invirtiendo para aumentar sus áreas de café.
texts.en:
Ramón is a small producer of coffee, who lives with his partner in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. For him, each day is an opportunity to move forward, and to work hard to overcome the obstacles encountered in agricultural work.

Ramón is seeking a loan to buy supplies and fertilizers needed in his coffee planting, to achieve a better crop this year, and thereby increase his income and the well being of his family

His dream is that coffee prices keep improving for the producers, and to be able to continue investing to increase his planting areas.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers needed for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol, a 32-year-old woman from the community of Trinidad, Bohol, is married with four children ranging in age from five to 14. She is a hardworking woman who has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for six years now. 

Mirasol is requesting a loan of  PHP 6000 to buy additional stocks of merchandise for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, snack foods, vegetables, spices, fish, condiments and feed.  She will continue to work hard so she can provide for her family and meet their basic needs including food and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, snack foods, vegetables, spices, fish, condiments and feed

loans.name: Rogaciano

texts.en:
Rogaciano is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He has four children who are still dependents, with ages between 13 and 19. His wife stays at home to look after their children.

Rogaciano drives his motorcycle for passengers. This business of transporting passengers is common in remote places and villages. The motorcycle is called habal-habal. He also owns a farm where he grows rice for an income.

Rogaciano is asking for a loan to buy school supplies for his children, pay for motor maintenance, and buy fertilizer for his farm.

For eight years, Rogaciano has earned only PHP 2,500 per month. With a loan, he hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his children, pay for motor maintenance, and buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Benjamen

texts.en:
Benjamen, a 33-year-old married father of four children ranging in age from one to 14, works hard to provide for his children. He has been selling gasoline in unused soft drink bottles for four years now.

Benjamen is requesting a loan to buy more gasoline in order to grow his business. His income will be used for his children's schooling and to meet the family's daily needs..

loans.use: to buy more gasoline

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is a hardworking mother of four children. Two of her children are still attending school, age 13 and 17 years old respectively. She is a 45-year-old married woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like coffee, powdered milk, toothpaste, pouch vinegar, soy sauce, soap, shampoo, and rice. She has been running a sari-sari store for eight years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy three sacks of rice, grocery items and soft drinks. These will enhance the content of her store and also prevent her from running out of supplies. More customers will come and eventually generate a higher income. Thus she could pay her obligations and handle her finances.

She is determined is expand her business to be able to support the education of her children for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of rice, grocery items and soft drinks.

loans.name: Santos Julio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 50 años, es un productor de café de una comunidad rural de Jinotega, donde vive con su compañera y sus 6 hijos. Parte de su tiempo la dedica a la producción de café que ha establecido en aproximadamente 5 hectáreas de café de su finca, la cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

En los últimos tres años la producción de café de este pequeño productor ha pasado de 200 a 350 quintales de café.   Para este año, él está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal y garantizar su implementación de manera oportuna. Su meta es incrementar los rendimientos de su café y tener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 50 years old. He is a coffee producer in a rural community in Jinotega, where he lives with his partner and their 6 children. Part of his time is spent in coffee production on approximately five hectares of his farm that he has set aside for this, and which he operates in accordance with fair-trade certification standards.

Over the past three years this small producer's yield has gone from 200 to 350 quintals of coffee.This year he is requesting a loan to buy the supplies that his coffee plantation needs and ensure their appropriate use.

His goal is to increase his coffee production and have greater income in order to improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies which he will use on his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution for his business and uplift his income.

loans.name: Señor De Los Nevados Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS NEVADOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina, la socia tiene 35 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo  dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Señor de los Nevados." This bank is located in the district of Paucartambo, in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco.

Vicentina is 35 years old. She has one child and is in a common law marriage. She is responsible and diligent. She has been at this business for a good while, and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wishes to keep working in order to keep supporting her family.

She seeks a loan to purchase rice and sugar, among other things. The other members work in the following areas: animal sales, vegetable sales, grocery store, and food sales. Vicentina thanks all who take part in her dream through this loan, and promises to comply with the required payments in accordance with the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Roselito

texts.en:
Roselito owns and operates a tricycle (motorcycle with side car). He earns a living by transporting passengers from one area to another for a particular fee. He is a married man with two dependents ages 13 and 17 years old respectively.

He has been engaged in tricycle transportation services for 10 years now. He decided to take a loan to improve his main source of livelihood. He is asking for a loan to buy tires, fuel and a pig for a hog raising start-up. These will keep his trip safe and also maintain the condition of his vehicle. He would also able to raise pigs and this will help augment his income. With this, Roselito could provide his family with good food and better living conditions.

He is hoping that both his sources of income will become productive and be the source of a sustainable livelihood in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel and a pig for a hog raising start-up.

loans.name: Ana Lorenza

texts.es:
Ana, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor.


Ana, desde hace cinco años decidió colocar una pequeña tienda, también tiene venta de gas propano, en la zona rural de la comunidad.

Ana, necesita el dinero del crédito para comprar productos agrícolas y para ampliar su negocio, ya que está vendiendo más de lo normal.

Ana, sueña con ampliar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos para que tengan una buena educación y que estudien en la universidad.
texts.en:
Ana, 39 years old, was in school until the ninth grade. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She decided to operate a small store over the last five years. She also sells propane gas in the rural areas of the community.

Ana needs the loan to buy agricultural products and to expand her business, since her sales are greater than usual.

She dreams of growing her business and helping her children to obtain a good education and go to university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products and to grow her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy solution kit for his business so that he can increase his productive hours as well as his income.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 22-year-old single woman from Nablus city. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Aya is a student in the university, where she studies health management. She wants to get a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Aya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Aya will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Aya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 23-year-old single lady from Nablus city. Her father works as a taxi driver, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Sabreen is a student in the university where she studies engineering. She wants to get a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Sabreen took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Sabreen will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Sabreen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita of Trinidad, Bohol has had a rice farming business for seven years now. She is 44 years old and has three children ages 11-18. Aside from farming, she also helps manage her family's transportation business using their motorcycle, called habal-habal.

She would like for her farming business to be successful. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for hired help, and make a motorcycle installment payment. She hopes that in the future she can continue to sustain her business, send her children to school, and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for hired help, and make a motorcycle installment payment

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es:
Ana, de 64 años de edad, está casada, vive solamente con su esposo. 

Ana, junto a su esposo tiene una pequeña panaderia ubicada en su casa, tienen varios años de tener su negocio, el cual es un medio de sustento para ella y su esposo.

Gladis, necsesita el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para hacer pan dulce, azúcar y levadura.
 
Gladis, desea seguir siempre haciendo pan, porque es un medio de subsistencia y es algo que le gusta hacer.
texts.en:
Ana is 64 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She and her husband have a small bakery located in their house. They have run this business for a number of years. It is how she and her husband make a living.

Ana needs a loan to buy ingredients to make pastries, such as sugar and yeast. Ana wants to continue baking bread, because it is how she makes her living and is something she likes to do.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastries, such as sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job was born in Kisii, Kenya and currently resides in Eldoret with his wife and new daughter. He is currently studying for a degree in Human Resource Management, while simultaneously working at a social enterprise. He has been employed as a sales officer for the last six months, selling clean energy products to households to reduce household costs, improve health, and reduce impacts on the environment. One of the main products Job sells is the Burn Jikokoa cookstove, which is a life saving stove that reduces charcoal use by 50%, reduces charcoal costs, and reduces smoke by 60%. He has been able to sell over 300 stoves to Kenyan households, and enabled many households to have extra cash to pay off loans, start small businesses, pay school fees, and purchase more quantities of healthier food.

Job plans to use the Kiva loan to purchase more Jikokoa cookstoves to sell within the North Rift region, and to reach an additional 500 households before the end of the year. The loan will help Job to raise business capital he would have been otherwise unable to raise, grow his business, and reach thousands of Kenyans. Not only will the loan benefit Job’s business and the welfare of his own small growing family, but it will also improve the health of thousands of Kenyans, reduce impacts on the environment, and allow families to save over $200 a year.

loans.use: To sell life saving stoves to households across Kenya

loans.name: Rose Judith

texts.en:
Judy was born in Kisumu County, Kenya, and is now a resident of Mombasa County, where she lives with her husband and two children. She began her current position in September 2015 as a sales officer at a social enterprise, where she has excelled in sales, management, and after sales monitoring. Judy has enabled over 600 households in the coastal region of Kenya to become clean energy households.

One of the main products Judy sells is the Burn Jikokoa cookstove, which is a life saving stove that reduces charcoal use by 50% and creates 60% less smoke, thus helping households to save money and creating a healthier environment. The households that Judy has sold cookstoves to have benefitted from extra cash flow to pay school fees, pay off loans and invest more in their businesses.

Judy plans to use the Kiva loan to purchase more Jikokoa cookstoves to sell within the coastal region, and to reach an additional 500 households before the end of the year. The loan will help Judy to raise business capital she would have been otherwise unable to raise, grow her business, and reach thousands of Kenyans. Not only will the loan benefit Judy’s business, but it will also improve the health of thousands of Kenyans, reduce impacts on the environment, and allow families to save over $200 a year.

loans.use: To sell life saving stoves to households across Kenya

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five pigs and 12 sacks of livestock feed

loans.name: Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MICAELA BASTIDAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Necy ella es soltera y tiene 38 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes , la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio agricultura, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Micaela Bastidas." This bank is in the district of Santa Ana, in the province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Necy is single. She is 28 years old and has two children. She works in her own grocery store. She sells basic necessities such as rice, milk and oil. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She has worked for 5 years in this business and does well at it. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She seeks a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members work in agriculture, clothing sales, a grocery store and a restaurant.

Necy thanks those who take part in her dream through this loan, and promises to comply with the payments within the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en: Gerardo is a 56-year-old man from Trinidad, Bohol. He earns a living through his hog raising business and rice farming. Gerardo is asking to take a loan to buy feed and fertilizer. With a loan, Gerardo will be able to improve his hog raising business and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for future reinvestment in the same business, make expansion, and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Rita

texts.en:
Ma. Rita owns and operates a fishing boat. She is the one who sells fish, crabs and sea shells that were caught by the men in her place to the market. She has been managing her fishing livelihood for more than 10 years now. She is a 52 year old married woman with no dependents. She lives in the town of Tubigon, Bohol.

She has decided to take a loan to have additional funds to purchase materials that are need to prosper in her ongoing business. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, floaters and weights. These will boost her catch and allow her to sell more fresh fish and crabs, which she can sell to the locals in her community. In this way, she could pay her obligations and start to handle her earnings wisely.

Ma. Rita is hoping that she will be successful in running her business and that it will be sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like a fishing net, floaters and weights.

loans.name: Vigilina

texts.en:
Vigilina is a married woman and the mother of seven children, ages 2-19. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Vigilina and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for several years now. They also focus on catching crabs which has a really high demand in the mainland and in the Talibon areas.

Vigilina is asking for a loan to buy new crab traps and pay for boat repair. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Vigilina hopes to expand her business. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy new crab traps and pay for boat repair.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a resident of Bien Unido in Bohol. She earns a living through producing dried fish and selling it to the market. She also farms seaweeds. This is the source of her income.

Herminia is asking for a loan to buy straw, a new engine, fuel for the boat, and fishing nets for her son, who does fishing. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy straw, a new engine, fuel for the boat, and fishing nets

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano  is a 49-year-old married man with three children from Trinidad, Bohol. He has been raising hogs for five years. Marciano lacks the financial resources to improve his hog-raising business so he is seeking a loan to buy piglets and feed. 

Marciano dreams of expanding his business to generate more income so that he will be able to continue sending his children to school. Moreover, he wants to his family to experience the fullness of life. In the future, he plans to build a bigger and better concrete barn that can house several pigs. Any additional revenue will be used for reinvestment in his business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 50 years old and comes from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married and has one dependent. She is engaged in selling fresh fish and making and selling dried fish. Dried fish when fried and served with rice is a favorite breakfast of Filipino people. Mila is asking for a loan to buy more fresh  and dried fish to sell. She is determined to make sure that her child gets a good education to make her life better.

loans.use: to buy fresh and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Sadame

texts.en:
Sadame is a fisherman from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in fishing to provide for his family’s needs. Sadame finds it difficult to fish when the weather is not good. For him, there are a lot of challenges to beat in this kind of livelihood.

Sadame is asking for more funds through a loan to buy fuel and a new fish net that he can use. This will allow him to be more productive in his fishing activities.

In the future, he dreams of having another business so he can be more sustainable

loans.use: to buy fuel and fishing nets

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a married woman and a mother of three children, ages nine to fifteen, who are still attending school. She and her family live in San Miguel, Bohol..

Susana has been earning a living through her sari-sari (retail) store for more than 15 years now. She also raise hogs and farms rice for additional income. Her income pays for the family's daily consumables and other household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and feed.

Susana is determined to work hard so that her children can continue their schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Rene

texts.en: Rene is a married man with a four-year-old son. He sells fish for a living. With his motorcycle, he goes to different houses to sell. He works hard for his family. He is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Rene plans to really save money so he can build a concrete house for his family. He is from the community of San Miguel, in Bohol.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Abla est une revendeuse de sacs qui s’approvisionne et revend deux  fois par mois au marché. Abla  sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de sacs à main. Abla désire avec le bénéfice rehausser son niveau de commerce pour permettre un bon épanouissement à ses  enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman and mother of three children. She is 32 years old and lives in Adidogomé.

She resells bags which she obtains twice a month from the local market.

Abla is requesting this loan so she can buy handbags. With the benefits, she hopes to heighten her business level to give her children a good upbringing.

loans.use: to buy 26 handbags

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Abra est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Abra travaille activement pour gagner sa vie. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et celui de ses enfants, Abra vend du charbon de bois à la devanture de son domicile et s’approvisionne au marché une fois par mois. Abra demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue d’en  tirer profit pour l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abra is a married woman and is a mother of four children. She is 40 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She actively works to earn a living. In order to meet the needs of her and her children, Abra sells charcoal from her doorstep and obtains the goods from the market once a month.

Abra is requesting this loan so that she can buy some bags of charcoal to take a profit and allow her family to survive.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a broom business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more brooms to sell to her customers.

Felisa has been in this business for 17 years. Felisa earns additional income from farming bananas.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sagrada Familia 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sagrada Familia 2, está en su ciclo número 9 Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, son mujeres luchadoras que se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Cada una de las que integra este comité participa de manera activa de las capacitaciones, pero entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Nilda por ser una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, comenta que tiene un copetín en el que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano y hasta muy tarde en la noche, tiene de todo y por medio de su pequeño trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertir en su humilde negocio, y poder tener una mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes, como ser gaseosas, jugos, yogurt, golosinas y otros más. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y crecer.
texts.en:
The "Sagrada Familia 2" Group is in its ninth cycle of the Women's Communal Bank Program, in which all are working and helping each other to make progress. They are participating in the elimination of poverty survey. They are courageous women who are working hard to make progress and to help their loved ones

Every one of the members of this communal bank is actively participating in training courses, but among them, Señora Nilda stand out for being very unselfish and courageous. She says that she has a snack bar where she works from very early until very late at night, that she has everything, and that through her business, she earns a living in a way that is decent and honest.

She is requesting this loan so that she can invest in her humble business, and be able to have a greater variety to offer to her customers, such as soft drinks, juice, yogurt, snacks, and additional items. She is grateful for receiving the opportunity to be able to improve and grow.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, juice, yogurt, snacks, and additional items to add to her supply.

loans.name: Jorgia

texts.en:
Jorgia is a 47-year-old married woman with two grown children.  She is from Trinidad, Bohol.  She runs a Sari-sari store business and also farms rice for an income. 

Jorgia is asking a loan to buy fertilizer, soft drinks, beer, canned food, chips and toiletries.  Her greatest dream is to build a decent concrete house for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, soft drinks, beer, canned food, chips and toiletries.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells merchandise like biscuits, candies, seasonings, shampoo, cooking oil, sugar, fabric conditioner, canned goods and noodles. She has been running a store for more than 10 years now. She is a 36 year old married woman with two children ages 9 and 11 years.

She has requested a loan to buy additional stocks like toiletries, beverages, and dry goods. It will fill her store and prevent her running out of stock. She will be able to cater to her customers' orders and improve her daily earnings. Thus, she could handle her finances and provide her family with good food and continue support her children's schooling.

Estrella hopes that she could continue to improve and expand her existing sari-sari (variety) store to become sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like toiletries, beverages, and dry goods

loans.name: Frieda

texts.en:
This is the tricycle that Frieda bought from the retirement pay of her husband, Rogelio, five years ago. She rents it out to her neighbors and it provides for her and her husband’s daily necessities. However, if the tricycle suddenly encounters mechanical problem, she would not have enough spare parts and tools necessary for troubleshooting. As a result, the damaged tricycle could be idle for days, affecting her income and the income of the driver who rents it. Frieda would like to obtain a loan worth PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts and tools for troubleshooting.

If God permits, she wants to acquire additional units of tricycles that she can rent them out to her neighbors. Somehow, it can help her neighbors and she can continue to help with the educational expenses of her grandchildren.

Frieda meets with her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for troubleshooting

loans.name: Jo-An

texts.en:
Jo-an is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jo-an is 27 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Jo-an has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

She has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Jimmy Javier

texts.es:
Jimmy es un joven muy trabajador, tiene 22 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos, a su corta edad ya cuenta con su propio negocio, y le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza. Él vive con su hermana en una casa en la que no paga arriendo, el propietario le deja vivir en su domicilio a cambio de que Jimmy cuide la casa.
Su domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Carabuela, en este lugar las personas  de dedican a la confección de artesanías como gorras, bufandas, mochilas, ponchos, guantes de lana y también a la crianza de animales para luego ponerlos a la venta en las ferias de la localidad. En Carabuela todavía existen las tradiciones ancestrales tales como los baños rituales vistos principalmente en el Inti Raymi y el “Ñavi maillai” que es la purificación de los matrimonios.
Se dedica a la elaboración de puertas, ventanas y otros productos realizados en hierro, desde hace 5 años aproximadamente, trabaja de lunes a sábado, el negocio lo aprendió cuando trabajaba en un taller de metálicas. Jimmy tiene el negocio en su domicilio por lo que no paga arriendo.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de herramientas de trabajo que le hacen falta para poder brindar un mejor servicio, agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Jimmy is a young, hardworking man. He is 22 years old, is single, and does not have children. At his young age, he already has his own business and really likes the work that he does. He lives with his sister in a home on which he does not pay rent. The owner allows him to live in the home in exchange for Jimmy caring for the home.

The home is located in Carabuela, where people make a living making artisan goods like hats, scarves, backpacks, sweaters, and wool gloves, and also raise animals to sell in the local markets. Ancestral traditions still exist in Carabuela, like the ritual baths seen primarily in the Inti Raymi and the Ñavi maillai, which is a wedding purification.

Jimmy has made a living for the past 5 years by making doors, windows, and other products with iron. He works from Monday through Saturday. He learned the business when he worked in a metal shop. Jimmy has the business in his home so that he doesn't have to pay rent.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of work tools that he is lacking so that he can provide better service. He thanks Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of tools that he is lacking that will help him provide better service.

loans.name: Lala

texts.fr:
Lala est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 43 ans, elle est divorcée et mère de quatre filles âgées de 18 à 24 ans. L'ainée et la seconde l'aident dans l'exercice de son activité et les deux autres suivent actuellement des formations professionnelles.
En ce moment, Lala exerce une activité de vente de viande de poulet de chair, elle a démarré en 2010. Auparavant, elle effectuait une vente ambulante de friperie. Puisque cette activité devenait de plus en plus populaire, pratiquée par beaucoup de gens, alors elle décidait d'en changer et elle est devenue marchande de viande de poulet de chair.
L'objectif de lala est d'ouvrir petit à petit quatre autres points de vente que ses quatre filles puissent diriger plus tard.
texts.en:
Lala is a brave and hard-working woman of 43. She is divorced and is the mother of four daughters from 18 to 24 years of age. Her oldest and her second daughter help her in running her business and the two others are presently in professional training.

Right now, Lala has a business selling chicken meat; she began it in 2010. Before that she sold used clothing door-to-door. Since that business was becoming more and more popular and a lot of people were doing it, Lala decided to change and become a butcher, selling chicken meat. Lala's goal is, little by little, to open up four other sales points that her four daughters can run later on.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat to sell.

loans.name: Nahaly

texts.en:
Your help can improve the lives of others!

Here is Nahaly, 52 years old, a resident of Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She is currently running a store which offers the usual commodities that are needed in an individual’s daily life. Her income from the business helps sustain her everyday necessities. She is a single parent and has managed to support her child who is already working as of now.

Running a store like hers is not as easy as others usually think. Income varies every day depending on how many customers will avail themselves of the products. Her profit each day seems to be insufficient because it’s unstable. With that being the case, Nahaly wants to ask for help from you. She is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy more groceries, toiletries and canned goods for her store. She is truly hopeful that this amount will help her attract more customers and will then lead to a higher profit.

She dreams of growing her business and have better living conditions in the near future. She prays for good health and a happy life together with her child. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, toiletries and canned goods for her store

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo, 32, lives in Trinidad, Bohol with his family. He is married and has two children, ages 9 and 4.

Leo has been driving his motorcycle for an income for the last three years. He is asking to take a loan to buy a sprocket and a spare tire. This loan will help him improve his income if he can drive without delays.

In the future, Leo dreams of living in a decent house and owning a car for his family.

loans.use: to buy a sprocket and a spare tire

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Mariée, Adama est femme de 43 ans qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge à Adidogomé . Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Adama prépare et vend de la boisson locale à son domicile et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Adama  réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce et désire ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de mil et du bois de chauffage afin de tirer profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi donc leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Adama is a 43 year old married lady who lives with her four children in Adidogomé. Adama buys local fish from the market twice a week which she prepares and sells from her home.

She has a good profit margin thanks to this business. Adama hopes the loan will help her to buy some bags of millet and firewood for a further profit to help her husband take care of the children and provide them with a school education.

loans.use: to buy one bag of millet and one lot of firewood

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Maribeth requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in the business of pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sr. De Coyllority De Arin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY DE ARIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabriela ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su al negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maiz,papa y quinua,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papa, maíz y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Senor de Coyllority de Arin" communal bank. The bank is located in the Calca district in the Calca province, part of the Cusco department.

Gabriela is a member. She is single, is 40 years old, and has 3 children. She has a business selling grains. She sells corn, potatoes, and quinoa. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She has had this business for 4 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her products. She requests a loan to purchase potatoes, corn, and quinoa.

The other members have businesses like animal sales, vegetable sales, grocery stores, and restaurants.

The member thanks those who have been part of her dream in this way and she promises to make the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, corn, and quinoa.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a 48-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has seven children; the oldest child is 17, while the youngest is 4. She is engaged in the fishing business. She catches fish, crab, and sea shells.

Angelita requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy galvanized iron, bamboo matting, hardwood, cement and nails for her house renovation. As much as she always hopes to expand her business, she also dreams of a decent house for her family.

Her income from fishing goes towards her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy galvanized iron, bamboo matting, hardwood, cement and nails for her house renovation.

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr: Mariée  et mère de quatre enfants, Dado est une femme habitant à Adidogomé  et âgée de 43 ans. Dado  est une revendeuse de quartier en quartier  qui prépare et vend de la bouillie. Dado  achète ses marchandises au marché une fois par mois. Dado  voudrait de ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs, de riz et de sucre. Avec la marge bénéficiaire réalisée, Dado  souhaite bien organiser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dado is a 43 year old married lady and a mother of four children. They live in Adidogomé. She prepares and sells porridge in different neighbourhoods.

She buys her goods once a month from the market. She would like the loan to buy bowls of maize, rice and sugar.

With the profits she hopes to organise an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy 50 bowls of maize, five bowls of rice and three bowls of sugar

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Nenita requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like woods, nails, paints, etc. for her business

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Shirley is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 11 years and also earns additional income from direct selling avon and natasha products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 55 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Anecita has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed from NWTF nine times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Tatiana Daniela

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Tatiana, una madre de 19 años; habita junto con su esposo y su pequeño hijo en casa de familiares. 
Tatiana junto con su esposo se apoyan mucho, ambos trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio que comenzó hace más de un año, con los ahorros que contaba pudo comprarse computadoras donde montó su cyber, en vista que le iba muy bien pudo adquirir otra máquina más ya que en el sector es el único negocio de servicio de internet. Así ha podido incrementar activos; su esposo también la ha ayudado y ahora también cuenta con una tienda de víveres y confites.
A pesar de ser jóvenes tienen una muy buena cultura de ahorros, por eso se sienten satisfechos de poder contar con los negocios fruto de su esfuerzo. Acude como cliente nuevo, con este crédito Tatiana podrá ampliar y adecuar su negocio ya que desea incrementar otra máquina más y así seguir creciendo poco a poco como microempresaria. Se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado por KIVA, seguro podrá tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Tatiana lives in the city of Santo Domingo. She is a 19-year-old mother and lives with her husband and young son in their relatives' home. Tatiana and her husband support each other a lot and both work very hard to move their family forward.

She has a small business that she started about a year ago. She used her savings to purchase computers and started her cyber cafe. Upon seeing that it was going well, she was able to purchase another machine. She is the only Internet provider in the area. This is how she has been able to grow her business.

Her husband has helped with her business and he also has a grocery and candy store. Despite being young, they have a good amount of savings, so they feel happy to be able to count on their businesses, which are the fruits of their labor.

As a new client, Tatiana would like to grow and expand her business by purchasing another computer with this loan so that she can keep her small business growing. She is happy to have Kiva's support and is sure that she will be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business, and to purchase a new computer to continue growing her business.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анара, 44 года, замужем, многодетная мама 4 сыновей. У Анары средне-специальное образование, она ответственная, честная, трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она на протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Анары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 коров, 38 овец. Для содержания скота есть все условия, зимой содержат скот в сараях, летом отправляют на пастбище для откорма. Также Анара на земельной доле мерою 1,04 Га занимается полеводством. Цикл выращивания экологически -чистых овощей и фруктов таков: сначала Анара выращивает рассаду в теплице, затем пересаживает в землю на полях. Однако, в этом году случилось непредвиденное - выпавший в марте снег, разрушил теплицу и погубил половину рассады (она попросту замерзла), Анара высадила на 1,0 Га земли остаток рассады капусты, дыни и помидоров, но летом на урожай напали черви, пострадала вся уже почти спелая продукция. Анара, узнав о возможности получить льготный кредит "Форс Мажор" в Банке "Бай-Тушум", решила обратиться за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на восстановление урожая, закупив ядохимикаты для обработки. Доходы от восстановленного бизнеса Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и посев лука.
texts.en:
Anara is 44 years old, married, and the mother of many children, with 4 sons. Anara has a specialist secondary education. She is responsible, honest, and hard-working. Anara has been practicing field and animal husbandry as the main source of income for her family for the last 20 years. Thanks to Anara's very hard work, her farm now has 5 cows and 38 sheep. She has all that is required for keeping animals: in winter the livestock are kept in barns, and in summer they are sent out to pasture to fatten up.

In addition, Anara practices field husbandry on a plot of land measuring 1.04 hectares. The cycle of growing organic fruits and vegetables is like this: first Anara grows seedlings in a greenhouse, then transplants them into the field. However, this year the unexpected happened -- snow fell in March, destroying the greenhouse, and half of the seedlings died (they simply froze). Anara planted the rest of the cabbage, melon, and tomato seedlings on 1.0 hectares of land, but worms attacked the harvest in summer, and the entire already-nearly-ripe harvest was affected.

Anara, knowing she could receive a discounted "Force Majeure" loan from Bai Tushum Bank CJSC, decided to apply for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) for the recovery of her harvest, buying chemical pesticides to work the soil. Anara plans to use the proceeds from the recovery of her business to continue developing her business, and to plant onions.

loans.use: to restore her business by purchasing pesticide to save her land and harvest from worms.

loans.name: Maria Armandina

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años, es viuda, vive con 1 hijo independiente, en casa propia en sector denominado Santa Sofia, la comunidad donde vive es una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

María se dedica a crianza y venta de chivos, carneros, patos y pollos, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, su es familia unida. Ella necesita del crédito para la inversión en la compra de más animales menores y alimento para los mismos para su engorde y posterior venta . Con ello mejorará su calidad de vida y así podrá habitar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old, and she is a widow. She lives with one independent son in her own house in a neighborhood named Santa Sofia. The community in which she lives is devoted to commerce, agriculture, and livestock-raising. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region of Peru's northern coast.

María raises and sells goats, rams, ducks, and chickens. She has very good personal and work references, and a united family.

She needs the loan for the purchase of more small animals and feed for them, in order to fatten and sell them later. With this, she will improve her quality of life, and will thus be able to live under better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more small animals, and feed for them.

loans.name: Zoudéya

texts.fr: Zoudeya  est une veuve femme  âgée de 32 ans habitant à adidogomé. Commerçante des objets en plastiques, Zoudeya achète ses marchandises au marché et les revendent dans les quartiers environnant. Zoudeya  achète ses marchandises deux fois par le mois. Zoudeya  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de bassines et de tonneaux afin de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable. Zoudeya profitera de  ce gain pour soutenir les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Zoudeya is a 32 year old widow who live in Adidogomé. She is a plastics retailer.

She buys her goods from the market twice a month and resells them in the surrounding neighbourhoods.

Zoudeya needs this loan to buy dozens of basins and baskets so she can easily meet her customers' needs and have considerable financial autonomy. She will benefit from this and be able to support her family's daily expenditure.

loans.use: to buy two dozen basins and two dozen baskets

loans.name: Zheenbu

texts.ru: Жеенбу, 59 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 15 лет она занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Жеенбу есть земельный участок мерою 0,5 Га, где она выращивает картофель и есть 3 коровы. Ежемесячный доход Жеенбу составляет в среднем 12,000 сомов (KGS). Жеенбу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Жеенбу увеличить ее хозяйство.
texts.en:
Zheenbu is 59 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a secondary-level education, and she has been raising crops and animals for 15 years now. Today, Zheenbu's farm has a plot of land measuring 0.5 hectares, where she grows potatoes, and has 3 cows. Zheenbu's monthly income averages 12,000 som (KGS).

Zheenbu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS), with which she will buy a calf to increase her headcount of livestock. The proceeds from the loan will allow Zheenbu to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy one calf in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз, 36 лет, замужем, образование - среднее. С 2004 года, занимается сельским хозяйством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кундуз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Kunduz is 36 years old, married, and has a secondary education. She has been doing agricultural work since 2004, and she now has 3 cows, 10 sheep, and 3 horses on her farm. Her monthly income is about 19,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Kunduz has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the headcount of her herd. Kunduz plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue adding to her number of livestock, and wants to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Adama est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec son mari et ses deux enfants à charge. Adama est une revendeuse des amuse- gueules qu’elle transforme  elle-même  à base de l’arachide. Adama s’approvisionne du nécessaire deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en se baladant dans les quartiers. Adama demande ce prêt pour commander des  sacs d’arachides en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin d’aider son mari à subvenir aux  charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Adama is a married woman of 42 who lives in Agoè with her husband and their two children. The children are still in their parents' care. Adama sells snacks that she makes herself using peanuts. She goes twice a month to the market to buy the necessary supplies and sells her snacks by going on foot through the neighborhoods.

Adama is requesting this loan to order some sacks of peanuts so as to make a profit and help her husband to cover the daily expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of peanuts.

loans.name: Inn

texts.en:
Inn is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a 31-year-old woman, married, with three children, ages 12, 10, and seven years old.

They raise their children through fishing. They have been doing this business for their children. Because of that, Inn wants to uplift their livelihood.

Perhaps, we can help her by lending the amount she requested to buy fishing net and pay for boat repairs. She wants to buy a new machine and plywood.

In addition, Inn dreams of improving their means of living, to send all her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and to pay for boat repairs.

loans.name: Bossa

texts.fr: Bossa est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans ayant trois enfants à charge. Résidante à Agoè, Bossa prépare et  vend de la pâte et du foufou faite à base du maïs et des ignames dans un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Bossa  achète ses denrées alimentaires trois  fois par mois. Bossa sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de maïs et de calebasse d’ignames. Avec le bénéfice  qui en résultera, Bossa compte investir cela dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bossa is a married woman aged 48, raising three children. Living in Agoè, Bossa prepares and sells maize dough and foufou (a staple dish made from yams) in a shed at her front door.

Bossa buys her foodstuffs three times a month. She is asking for this loan in order to buy some sacks of maize and a calabash of yams. With the profit that will result from the loan, Bossa intends to invest in schooling for her children.

loans.use: to buy one calabash full of yams and three sacks of maize.

loans.name: Hanta Claire

texts.fr:
43 ans, mariée, Hanta Claire est une mère de trois enfants de 14 à 24 ans dont l'ainé travaille, le second déjà marié et  le dernier encore à sa charge et scolarisé dans une école privée.
Hanta Claire exerce actuellement deux sortes d'activité génératrice de revenu pour gagner sa vie. Il s'agit de la broderie d'une part et de l'élevage de poulet de chair d'autre part. Elle demande un crédit pour développer et étendre la deuxième activité. C'est la plus récente, démarrée en mois d'août 2014. Depuis lors, elle avait déjà pu produire 7 fois de 50 têtes jusqu'au 14 juillet 2015. Elle avait décidé ainsi pour pouvoir améliorer le revenu familial ainsi que la condition de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Hanta Claire is 43 years old and a mother of three children aged between 14 and 24. The eldest works, the middle child is married and the youngest is still being educated in a private school.

Hanta Claire has two businesses so she can earn a living. Embroidery is one and breeding chickens is the other. She is requesting a loan to develop and stretch her second business. It was recently set up, in August 2014. Since then she has already been able to produce 7x50 heads up until July 2015.

She has therefore decided that this could improve the family's income as well as their living standards.

loans.use: to buy 225kg of bird-feed

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin es un emprendedor hombre de 42 años de edad que reside en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, en donde funciona su venta de Sopas y Sancochos típicos de la Región Caribe, actividad que inició luego de que en su vecindad vendieran comidas y con el dinero recaudado, adornaban con luces navideñas; con el pasar del tiempo los moradores del sector perdieron la tradición y Edwin adecuó un espacio frente su vivienda y colocó su venta de comidas.  Cuando inició el proyecto de negocio, solamente lo atendía él, sin embargo la gran demanda de clientes, permitió que su madre,  su cónyuge e hijas le ayudaran en esta actividad que desarrolla de domingo a viernes, los sábados descansan.  Sus compras las realiza de contado a graneros y expendios de la ciudad, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar víveres, mesas, sillas y una estufa industrial.  Edwin considera que esta inversión mejorará sus ventas y podrá abastecer a la demanda de clientes  que hasta el momento no había podido atender.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir un local donde pueda instalar su restaurante. Su meta familiar es velar por la educación de sus tres hijas para que sean unas buenas profesionales.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 42-year-old entrepreneur who lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Barranquillla. He has a business selling soups and sancochos typical to the Caribbean region, which he began after selling food in his neighborhood. With the money he earned, he decorated with Christmas lights. As time went on, the inhabitants of the area left the tradition and Edwin acquired a space in front of his home and started selling his food.

When he began the business, he worked alone. Nevertheless, due the his customers' demands, he allowed his mother, his partner, and his daughters to help him with his business, which is open from Sunday through Friday. On Saturdays, they rest. He purchases items in small quantities from granaries and small shops in the city.

He has applied for a Kiva loan, which is the first loan that he has received, through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. He will use the loan to purchase supplies, tables, chairs, and an industrial stove. Edwin believes that this investment will improve his sales and allow him to meet his customers' demands that, to this moment, he has not been able to meet.

His goal for the future is to acquire a location where he can open a restaurant. His goal for his family is to support the education of his three daughters so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, tables, chairs, and an industrial stove.

loans.name: Mercy Mie

texts.en:
Mercy Mie sells fish and crabs to the locals in her area. Her husband is a fisherman. She is 26 years old and married with three children ages eight, seven and two. She hails from Tubigon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing hooks, fishing net, rope and plastic screen. With the availability of these tools, she can help boost her income by generating more yield. In that way, she can sell a higher volume of catch. Thus, she will be able to settle her obligations and start to handle her finances.

She is grateful for access to the funds, and she is doing her best to improve her fishing business to someday improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing hooks,  fishing net, rope and plastic screen.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with six children. Her oldest child is 13 years old while her youngest child is one year old.

Rose and her husband earn a living by fishing. They have been doing this for almost 10 years. They work hard to provide for the needs of their children.

Rose is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net and plywood which will be used to repair their boat. Thus, she wishes to improve their earnings to uplift their livelihood. She also wishes to send all her children to school to have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and plywood.

loans.name: Jissela Judith

texts.es:
Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas es caracterizada por ser una ciudad muy comercial y productiva, conocida en el país por ser el puente que une a la sierra de la costa. En esta ciudad vive Jissela una joven de 23 años que aún no tienen hijos ya que comenta que es una gran responsabilidad traer un bebé al mundo. Por ello ella trabaja mucho para primero tener un futuro más estable, actualmente cuenta con un local donde vende ropa, negocio único por el sector, muy concurrido ya que siempre tienen ofertas para atraer a la clientela. Jissela trabaja junto a una joven que le ayuda en la atención, ha podido dar trabajo a una chica que es madre soltera para que pueda superarse poco a poco. 
Este es su segundo crédito con la institución, es una clienta muy responsable y fiel, gracias al primer crédito pudo adquirir más mercadería y surtió el negocio, ahora necesita nuevamente para capital de trabajo, para seguir creciendo y fortaleciendo su negocio que la ha ayudado tanto en gastos del hogar como en sus estudios superiores.
Está muy agradecida con KIVA por la ayuda que brindan a los microempresariao y además por las capacitaciones que la institución ofrece para un buen manejo de los negocios.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas is a commercial, productive city and is known throughout the country as the bridge that connects the mountains to the coast. Jissela lives in this city. She is 23 years old and she does not yet have children because she says that it is a great responsibility to bring a child into the world. She works a lot so that she can first have a stable future. She currently has a store where she sells clothing. It is the only one in the sector and she always offers sales to attract customers.

Jissela works with a young person who helps her tend to customers. She has provided a job to a single mother so that she can improve herself bit by bit.

This is her second loan with the institution. She is a responsible and loyal client. Thanks to the first loan, she was able to purchase more merchandise and stock her business. Now, she needs more capital to continue to grow and strengthen her business, which has helped her so much to pay for household and education expenses.

She is very grateful to Kiva for the support that they have provided to small businesses and for the business trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to invest in her business with merchandise and to continue growing and strengthening her business, which provides for her home and her higher education.

loans.name: Jesa

texts.en:
Jesa is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo, were most of the community is engaged in fishing. To earn a living, Jesa and her husband also engage in this business. They have been doing this for 25 years.

Jesa is 39 years old and a mother of five children ages 20, 18, 15, 14, and nine years old. She and her husband work hard to raise them and to provide their needs. Perhaps, she wants to increase their livelihood as well. Jessa is askingfor a loan for boat repair.

In the future, she wants to buy a new boat for fishing.

loans.use: to repair her boat .

loans.name: Elisajoria

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Elisajoria is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has three children, ages nine, 18 and 20.

Elisajoria has a sari-sari (variety store), where she sells basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings, toiletries and rice. This business has existed for many years now. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, chips, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasonings, fertilizer and gasoline.

Elisajoria hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business, and aims to increase her business profitability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, seasonings, fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: María Oneida

texts.es:
María, de 50 años de edad, e madre de 3 hijos, pero ninguno vive con ella, pues ya formaron su propio hogar.

María, se dedica hoy en día a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad de la canasta básica, este negocio le genera ingresos para su subsistencia.

El crédito que María, está solicitando es para surtir más su negocio y comprar frijoles, arroz, maiz, entre otros productos.

María, desea ver su pequeña tienda muy fuerte y tener variedad de productos.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years and is the mother of 3 children. Her children no longer live with her, as they have their own homes. Maria now works selling basic grocery products. This business provides income to support her. The loan that Maria is requesting is to supply her business more, and to buy beans, rice, corn and other products. Maria would like to see her small store grow stronger and have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to supply her business more, and to buy beans, rice, corn and other products.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo  est une femme mariée âgée de 53 ans qui vit à Baguida. Ayant six enfants à charge, Améyo   s’efforce  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des produits d’alimentations générales. Pour s’approvisionner Améyo se rend huit fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des  sacs de riz, de sucre et des bidons d’huile, Améyo  nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Améyo  va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Améyo is a married woman aged 53 who lives in Baguida. Raising six children, Améyo tries hard to earn her living by selling foodstuffs. In order to restock, Améyo goes to the market eight times a month.

So as to be able to order some sacks of rice and sugar and some jerrycans of oil, Améyo needs this loan to finance her restocking. With the profit she will make from the loan, Améyo will be able to help her husband with the daily expenditures for the family and ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, two sacks of sugar, and two jerrycans of oil.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère de trois enfants, Adjovi est une femme vivant à Baguida. Agée de 52 ans, Adjovi est une marchande de produits alimentaires et des pagnes qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner des revenus. Adjovi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs d’oignons, de charbon de bois et de panier de tomates fraîches en vue d’épargner et de pouvoir payer les frais scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adjovi is 52 years old, divorced and a mother of three children. They live in Baguida. She sells foodstuffs and loincloths. She buys the goods in the market and resells them from her doorstep to gain a profit.

She is requesting a loan to buy bags of onions, charcoal and baskets of fresh tomatoes so she can save up and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy one bag of onions, ten bags of charcoal and one basket of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Max Victor

texts.fr:
Max Victor est un brave père de famille de 31 ans. Il est marié et a deux enfants de 3 et 5 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. La femme de Max Victor ne travaille pas pour le moment, elle s'occupe avec attention son foyer et leurs enfants, quant à lui, il est chauffeur de taxi-ville d'une part et petit fermier d'autre part.
Il demande un crédit de 400000 ariary pour renforcer et développer l’élevage de cochons. Celle-ci va lui permettre d'acheter 2 têtes de porcelets et 1 sac de provendes supplémentaires.
L'objectif de Max Victor consiste à acheter un jour une voiture qui va lui servir de taxi, car actuellement, il loue le taxi qu'il conduit. Max est un homme ambitieux et passionné de son activité.
texts.en:
Max Victor is a brave 31 year-old father of a family. He is married and has two children who are 3 and 5 years old. These children are enrolled in a private school. For the moment, Max Victor's wife is not working as she is busy with the household and their children. Meanwhile, he is a part-time driver of a city taxi and also has a small farm.
He is requesting a loan of 400,000 ariary to strengthen and develop his raising of pigs. This will allow him to buy 2 small pigs and 1 sack of additional feed grain.
Max Victor's goal is to one day buy a car which will serve as a taxi, because currently he is renting the taxi he drives. Max is an ambitious man who is passionate about his activity.

loans.use: to buy 2 pigs and feed grains

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is engaged in selling home cooked meals and snacks. She also farms rice and raises hogs for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and also dried fish that she can resell to increase her revenue.

Flora is optimistic that with her hard work and perseverance, she can make a difference in the lives of her family, specially those of her children. She wants them to finish their studies for a better future.

Her profit will pay for a healthy diet for her family and for reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and also to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Geraldin

texts.en:
Geraldin is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She married and is blessed with two lovely daughters aged 15 and nine years.

Geraldin is a 32-year-old woman and is running a boarding house and catering services. She has been doing this for seven years.

In the future, she wants to be successful in her business and to have a better life.

Geraldin is asking for a loan for house maintenance, and to buy utensils for their catering services such as chairs and tables, table cloths, glasses, plates, forks and spoons.

loans.use: to pay for house maintenance, and to buy utensils for their catering services such as chairs and tables, table cloths, glasses, plates, forks and spoons.

loans.name: Amono

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 62 ans, Amono vit à Baguida avec ses trois enfants à charge. Amono est une revendeuse de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne au marché et les revendent au bord de la route sous un parasol. Amono désire ce fonds pour commander des bols de farine de manioc, d’arachide et des sachets de pure water. Avec la marge de bénéfice qui en résultera, Amono permettra un bon épanouissement à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Amono is a 62 year old widow who lives in Baguida with her three children. She retails general foodstuffs which she buys from the market and resells under a parasol at the side of the road.

Amono hopes that the loan will pay for bowls of manioc flour, peanuts and pure water packets. With the profits she will be able to give her children a good upbringing.

loans.use: to buy 75 bowls of manioc flour, 24 bowls of peanuts and 30 pure water packets.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
A “Sari-sari” store is a usual enterprise in the Philippines. Sari-sari (a Filipino term for variety) stores sell different products like biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and many other items that are needed in an individual’s daily life. The proliferation of this business makes the competition stiff. Store owners try many techniques to make it stable and competitive.

Edna, 57, from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo tries combining her variety store with direct selling of Natasha, MSE and Personal Collection products such as lotions, perfumes, powders, ready-to-wears, shoes and bags. Somehow her income provides for their daily expenditures. She is married to Roberto, a 60-year-old government employee. They have grown up children but they still strive to support their grandson.

She wants to improve her store by obtaining more supplies of grocery items and beverages. She will also buy additional personal and home care products for her direct selling business. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes that her business will progress and will give her a more comfortable life.

Edna regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more supplies of grocery items and beverages

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 56 years old, is a fish vendor while her husband, Rogelio, is a fisherman from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. They both work diligently to support their five children, some of whom are already studying in college.

It’s hard to imagine how they sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of their children, especially during this rainy season when it’s difficult for them to earn enough money. It’s dangerous for her husband to go fishing during this season. Also the price of fish gets higher and fish vendors like Linda can hardly afford it. This is the reason why she wants to avail herself of additional capital worth PHP 20,000 to augment her buying power for different varieties of fish at volume. It can keep her business running even during the rainy days. Her income from this will continuously sustain their daily needs and cover the children’s education.

Eventually her goal is to make her business prosper, acquire sturdy fishing boats and nets for her husband, complete her children’s education, and enjoy better living conditions someday.

Linda is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish in volume.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
53-year-old Herminigilda is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married, with four children.

She has engaged in a sari-sari store business for many years now.

Herminigilda is asking for a loan to buy a variety of merchandise, such as detergent, bleaching agents, sachet items, coffee, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap, canned food, and sugar. An addition to her inventory will help augment her income, thus helping her family to have abundant food and good living conditions.

Herminigilda hopes that with an additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bleaching agents, sachet items, coffee, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap, canned food, and sugar.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years old and a resident in Concepcion, Iloilo. Leonora and her husband are engaged in the fishing business to earn a living. They have been engaged in this business for 20 years.

Leonora is a mother of five children. One of these five children is still attending school and is 19 years old. Leonora wants to have a better means of living in the future. With this in mind, she is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and fishing weights, which will be used in her fishing business. She wants to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing weights.

loans.name: Ameyo E,

texts.fr: Mère de trois  enfants, Ameyo est une femme mariée âgée de 52 ans vivant à Baguida. Ameyo est une commerçante de charbon de bois et des ignames qui s’approvisionne au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour commander  des sacs de charbon de bois, Ameyo nécessite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de venir en aide à son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants dès la rentrée.
texts.en: Ameyo is a 52 year old married woman who is the mother of three children and lives in Baguida.  Ameyo is a seller of charcoal and yams who gets her supplies at the market and resells them at home.  To finance her order of bags of charcoal and earn a good profit margin, Ameyo needs this loan so that she can help her husband to pay the school costs of their children who are going back to school.

loans.use: to buy 11 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a sari-sari store owner from Iloilo, Philippines. She is a 29-year-old woman, and is blessed with a seven-year-old daughter. Her husband works hard as a fisherman.

Mary Grace wants to sustain their livelihood. With this in mind, she is asking for a loan to buy assorted grocery store items such as canned goods, spices, toiletries, eggs, noodles, chips, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and powdered chocolate drinks.

In the future, she wishes to expand her business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, spices, toiletries, eggs, noodles, chips, biscuits, candies, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, and powdered chocolate drinks

loans.name: Ma. Rosalie

texts.en:
From the town of Trinidad, Bohol, Ma. Rosalie is a 37-year-old married mother of three children ranging in age from four to 17. Her husband works as a driver, while she has farmed rice for the past four years to help meet her family’s needs. She also raises hogs for additional income.

Ma. Rosalie is requesting a PHP 2000 loan through CEVI to buy fertilizer and piglets. The loan will help her continue her farming while also supporting the basic needs of her family. She will use all her farming income to pay for healthy food for her family and school fees for her children.

In the future, Ma. Rosalie hopes to be successful by continuing to improve and expand her farm. She also wants to set up a bigger piggery.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for 22 years. She is a 44-year-old woman, and she has two children. Her older child is 19 years old, while her younger child is 16 years old.

Ligaya works hard to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. Ligaya wants the best for her children. She dreams of sending all her children to college in the future for them to get a degree.
