She needs to increase their livelihood to have enough money for her children’s school fees. With this in mind, Ligaya is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, a fishing rod and fishing weights.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, a fishing rod and fishing weigths.

loans.name: Nancy Marleny

texts.es: Nancy de 21 años de edad, vive muy feliz junto a su compañero de vida. Nancy es una mujer joven que es muy trabajadora y que busca tener un futuro mejor. Nancy labora en una empresa como auxiliar de ventas, actividad que realiza todos los días, es así como Nancy solventa las necesidades de su hogar, además su compañero de vida labora en una institución como asistente de bodega, así aporta a la economía de su hogar. La vivienda de Nancy aun no está terminada, ya que ella la empezó a construir con sus ahorros pero no logro instalar el techo, las puertas y ventanas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, puertas y ventanas para instalar en su vivienda y cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Nancy, age twenty-one, lives very happily with her life companion. Nancy is a very hardworking young woman who is seeking a better future.

Nancy works as a saleslady for a company every day, and this is how she covers their household expenses. In addition, her life companion contributes to their household finances by working in an establishment as an assistant.

Nancy's house is not finished yet, as she started building it with her savings, but was not able to install the roof, doors, and windows. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, doors, and windows. She will install them in her house and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, wood, doors, and windows, in order to install them in her house and achieve her dream.

loans.name: Corazon De Satipo Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Corazón de Satipo” está conformado por seis socias responsables con distintas actividades una de las socias es la  Sra. Martha de 32 años de edad conviviente, con dos pequeñas hijas. Hace siete años decide abrir su propio negocio de ventas de abarrotes, y así poder estar pendientes de sus pequeñas ya que su negocio se encuentra en un pequeño espacio donde viven. Con los ingresos de sus ventas apoya con los gastos de su hogar y también para pagar la pensión de la Universidad ya que decidió seguir estudiando. Una de las metas de Martha es ampliar su negocio y culminar sus estudios. Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería de abarrotes como arroz, menestras, leche y otros alimentos de primera necesidad. Martha es la primera persona que esta al lado derecho de la foto viste polo color rojo.
Martha está muy contenta de haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en:
The group Corazón de Satipo is composed of six responsible members with various activities.

One of the members is Martha, 32 years old. She lives with her partner and has two small daughters. 7 years ago she decided to open her own business selling groceries, which allowed her to be closer to her children because her business is located in the small space that they live in.

She is able to use her profits to help with household expenses and to pay tuition at the university where she decided to study. One of Martha's goals is to expand her business and finish school.

She is requesting this loan to buy grocery merchandise like rice, ingredients for vegetable stew, milk and other food items. Martha is the first person on the right side of the picture in the red shirt.

Martha is very happy to have received the support of Kiva's investors.

loans.use: to buy rice, ingredients for vegetable stew and other staples.

loans.name: Patron San Sebastian De Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN DE CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maribel ella es soltera y tiene 31 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidierom permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Patron San Sebastian de Cusco” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Maribel. She is 31 years old, single, and has two children. Maribel works at her grocery and restaurant businesses. She sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. Maribel wants to get ahead as a result of her business. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman. Her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other members engage in businesses such as selling construction materials, selling clothes, operating a grocery store, and managing a restaurant. The members who are shown in the bottom left-hand corner of the photo were not able to attend the meeting for work-related reasons.

Maribel is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a small photovoltaic system for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in body cream, lotions,soaps, nail polish, etc., to improve her product variety and be able to have a higher income.

loans.name: Dúo Piedad De Dios Group

texts.es:
Duo Piedad de Dios
Este duo esta integrado por Ana es originaria de Sumpango Sac, ella es madres de familia y tiene su propio negocio, Ana tiene un puesto de comida en la terminal de la ciudad, todos los días prepara diferentes desayunos ya que las personas que tiene como clientes son los que venden verduras desde muy temprano, a Ana le ha ido muy bien vendiendo, pero ha tenido algunas dificultades ya que no tiene un espacio muy amplio para cocinar, ellas necesita de un crédito para poder ampliar su cocina ya que con los dos créditos que ha tenido ha trabajado muy bien y a prosperado en su negocio, agradece a kiva la oportunidad que le ha brindado ya que su condición de vida ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Piedad de Dios" Duo

One member of this duo is Ana, who is originally from Sumpango Sac. She is a mother and has her own business.

Ana has a stall selling meals at the city terminal where every day she prepares different breakfasts. Many of Ana's customers are people who sell vegetables from very early.

Her business has gone very well but she has difficulties as she does not have a very large space to cook.

Ana needs this loan in order to expand her kitchen. Her two previous loans have been successful and helped her business to prosper.

Ana is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity that she has been given; it has helped her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To expand the kitchen in order to start a food production business.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Matilde ella es soltera y tiene 39 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes,  la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Virgen del Rosario" loan group. This loan group is located in the Paucartambo district, belonging to the Paucartambo district and department of Cuzco.

Maria Matilde is 39 years old and single. She works in her restaurant and prepares different dishes like chicken with potatoes, soups, and sautéed meats. She has many years experience in this business and it is going very well for her. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who, through this business, wants to support her family. Her dream is to broaden the business of the restaurant.

She is asking for a loan to buy products to cook with such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

Maria Matilde thanks those who form part of this dream through Kiva, and she promises to comply with the payments of her dues by the deadline.

(The members that are attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they had work obligations. The other members make a living selling animals, in livestock, having a grocery store, and a restaurant.)

loans.use: to buy products to cook with such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Edith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Edith, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, sus padres no le pudieron ayudar para seguir estudiando, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al comercio, tienen una hija pequeño que vive con ellos.

Edith, actualmente se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote, el trabajo lo aprendió con su mamá desde que era muy pequeña; antes trabajaba con otra persona que hacia tamales y tambien vendia frutas y verduras, ahora trabaja de manera propia desde su casa y su madre le ayuda a preparar los tamales.

El crédito sera invertido para comprar elote para la elaboración de tamales para vender.

Su sueño es poder construir su propia casa, porque actualmente viven en casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Edith is 22 years old. She studied up to Grade 9 then her parents couldn't help her continue to study. She is in a realtionship and her partner works in commerce. She has a young son that lives with them.

Edith has worked selling corn tamales for more than ten years. She learned this work from her mother when she was very young. She worked with another person making tamales before. Now she works on her own from her house and her mother helps her prepare the tamales.

The loan will be invested to buy corn to make her tamales to sell.

Herr dream is to build her own house as currently she lives in her parent's house.

loans.use: to buy corn to prepare her tamales to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Fishing is one of the sources of income in most communities in Concepcion, Iloilo. Rolando, a 44-year-old man, has been engaged in this business for more than 30 years. This livelihood helps him raise his nine children who are already grown up. 

As of now, he only has two children who still depend on him. With that, he wants to increase his fishing business in the future. He is asking for a loan for his boat maintenance and to buy gasoline for his boat that is used in fishing. Additionally, Rolando is planning to have other business that will help him increase his livelihood.

loans.use: to maintain his boat and buy gasoline

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es de la ciudad de Concepción, ella está estudiando para poder ser una buena abogada,  y quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Aida está esforzándose para poder dar a sus seres queridos una ayuda de la misma manera que a ella la han estado ayudando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Aida is from the city of Concepción. She is studying to become a good lawyer, and she wants to be able to use her knowledge to help other people.

Aida is working hard to be able to help her loved ones, just as they have been helping her. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her tuition and fees, so that she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees and tuition.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es: José tiene 49 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde junto con su compañera de vida y su hijo de 15 años de edad al que apoya para que estudie ya que desea que pueda optar a una mejor calidad de vida. José se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor que quiere sacar adelante a su hijo. José labora en una institución en la semana y también tiene una librería, negocio que tiene establecido en su hogar desde hace un tiempo, el cual José junto a su esposa atienden, es así como José y su esposa cubren las necesidades básicas de su hijo. José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en: papel bond, cartulinas, colores, borradores, lapiceros entre otros productos para surtir su librería.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old.  He lives happily in his own humble home with his partner and his fifteen-year-old son.  He supports his son so that he can go to school, because he wants him to choose a better quality of life.  José is known to be a very hardworking and enterprising man who wants to get his son ahead.  

José works in an institution during the week and also has a bookstore.  He set up this business in his home a while ago.  Along with his wife, José mans the store, and in this way José and his wife can buy their son’s basic necessities.  José is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in copy paper, card stock, crayons, erasers, and pencil cases, among other products to stock his bookstore.

loans.use: to invest in copier paper, cardstock, crayons, erasers, and pencil cases, among other products to stock his bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: metal sheeting, wood, nails, cement, sand, and gravel to build a room that will become a bathroom.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza  es una mujer nicaragüense de 49 años, persona esforzada y trabajadora; tiene 6 hijos, 2 menores de edad que viven con ella actualmente, y su esposo. Desde hace 5 años inició su propio negocio para poder atenderlos y además apoyar económicamente al hogar, su esposo trabaja como peón agrícola en una finca cercana. Con su carácter emprendedor se ha capacitado y establecido una  parcela de Pimienta, actualmente cuenta con cerca de 800 plantas, las que financió por medio de un crédito con Fundación Mujer;  otra actividad que desarrolla es la  venta de queso,  que le compra a una proveedora de un poblado vecino. Ella ha logrado diversificar su negocio y ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio.

Actualmente su parcela ya está en  producción y ante el embate del clima requiere de insumos para prevenir plagas y enfermedades que traigan al traste su producción. La clienta ha tenido 2 préstamos que le han permitido desarrollar su actividad, la microempresa cuenta con un negocio consolidado, que le generan ingresos para reinvertir y además cubrir ciertas obligaciones del hogar 

La actividad productiva de Doña Esperanza cuenta con un mercado fijo para la compra de su  pimienta, la empresa Propica, para lo cual está en la elaboración de un contrato. Tiene un total de 800 plantas iniciando en producción. La temporada de cosecha es durante todo el año; al menos se dan 3 cosechas. Cuenta con la ventaja de un comprador fijo, el cual ofrece un precio estable durante toda la temporada y compra toda la cantidad de pimienta que la clienta produzca. Existe la probabilidad de una afectación por plagas y enfermedades, para esto se actúa de manera preventiva,  Propica ofrece asistencia técnica, la clienta debe aplicar los productos recomendados, con el objetivo de mantener una plantación sana y con buena producción. Las labores de campo son apoyadas por el esposo y un peón agrícola contratado para actividades específicas. Se trata de dar un manejo mixto de la plantación, incorporando productos orgánicos en lo que respecta al control de plagas y enfermedades y labores culturales, como la corta manual de la hierba.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 49 year old Nicaraguan woman, a strong and hard-working person. She has 6 children, two of them are minors in age and still live with her and her husband. Five years ago she started her own business to be able to take care of them and also support the household economically. Her husband works as agricultural labor on a nearby farm.

With her enterprising character she has been trained and opened a plot growing pepper. Currently she has about 800 plants which she financed with a loan from Fundación Mujer. The other business she does is the sale of cheese which she buys from a supplier in a neighboring community. She has manged to diversify her business and help her children with their studies.

Currently her plot is in production and due to the attacks from the climate, she needs to buy inputs to prevent infestations and disease that would ruin her production. She has had two loan that have allowed her to develop her business. This micro entrepreneur has a strong business which generates income to reinvest and also cover some of the household obligations.

Esperanza's business has a fixed market to buy her pepper, the Propica company, with whom she has a contract. She has a total of 800 plants in production. The growing season is year round with three harvests per year. She has the advantage of a fixed buyer which provides a stable price during the season and buys all that she produces.

There is the possibility of infestation and disease and for this reason she is taking preventative measures. Propica offers technical assistance and the client has to apply the recommended products with the aim of keeping the plantation healthy and having good production. Her field work is supported by her husband and a hired agricultural laborer to do specific tasks. She tries to provide a mixed management of the plantation, incorporating organic products in respect to pest control and infestations and work practices such as cutting the grass by hand.

loans.use: to buy inputs to maintain her pepper plantation.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia has been engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with two children, ages 24 and 20 years old. Her husband works hard as a fisherman. 

Ma. Cecelia has been doing a sari-sari store business for five years. She is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as toiletries, spices, biscuits, candies, chips, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, soft drinks and drinking liquor. In the future, Ma. Cecelia dreams to have better means of living. She wants to sustain their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, spices, biscuits, candies, chips, coffee, sugar, powdered milk and chocolate drink, soft drinks and drinking liquor

loans.name: Kiara

texts.es:
Kiara tiene 19 años de edad, soltera, vive con su madre en el distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Kiara se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Kiara espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Kiara is 19 years old, single and living with her mother in the Zaña district, in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region of northern Peru.  The villagers of this area mostly make a living through agriculture, rearing livestock or owning shops.

Kiara makes a living raising and selling small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys among others.  Her business is based in her home.  She has two years of experience with this business and has very good business and personal references in the area.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys and chickens, among others, as well as to buy good quality feed for them.  With this, Kiara hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to increase her income and as a result she will improve her own and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a higher quantity of animals, as well as a good quality feed for them.

loans.name: Dorys

texts.en:
Dorys is a 30-year-old woman who is mother of two beautiful girls; they are 17 and 14 years old and they are the main reason for her hard work. She has owned a business of jewelry selling since 2008. She sells all kinds of jewelry like earrings, necklaces, rings, etc. And she does it because she loves her job, and how people fall in love with her products.

This woman not only wants to see her business improve, but wants to see it last over time. She also wants it to be more competitive so her clients prefer her store. Like any business, it is important that it grows, so it provides a good profit, and if possible the number of clients increase.

The reason why she’s asking for a loan is so she can buy more jewelry and a showcase to show her products (because she doesn’t have one).

Dorys has big dreams, but the most important one involves her daughters. She wants them to grow up in a nice environment with good opportunities. That’s why she wishes she can give them the best education.

You can help this devoted mother to accomplish all her dreams - a loan can change her business and her life. There's a sister in the photo who sometimes helps Dorys with the business.

loans.use: buy more jewelry and a showcase to show her products.

loans.name: Dilia Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmin es una mujer soltera con 28 años de edad, con esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda de la cual obtiene los ingresos suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual surtir su tienda de productos como arroz, frijol, panela, verduras, frutas y otros.
Su mayor sueño es dejar el negocio a sus hijos, pero principalmente pagarle la educación.

Sus deseos de salir adelante y sus ganas de superarse son admirables, amerita una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Yasmin is a single woman, 28 years old. With effort and dedication she managed to open her own business, a small store from which she gets the income sufficient to cover her needs.

She works every day for 8 hours daily.

She is asking for a loan with which to stock her store with products such as rice, beans, raw cane sugar, vegetables, fruits, and more.

Her greatest dream is to leave the business to her children, but primarily to pay for their education.

Her wish to get ahead and her desire to improve herself are admirable, and deserve a favorable response to her request.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, beans, raw cane sugar, vegetables, fruits and more.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a 56-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married with five adult children.

To earn a living, Dolores and her husband are engaged in fishing. They raised their children by doing this business. For almost 30 years, it has been their main source of income.

Dolores wishes to borrow money to buy a new engine for their boat, and a fishing net to catch more fish.

In the future, she wishes to uplift their livelihood to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and a new engine for their boat.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en: Melona of Trinidad, Bohol has had a farming business for 28 years. She has two dependents, ages 14 and 16. At the age of 49, she continues to work hard for her children’s future. The money from the loan will be used to buy three bags of hybrid seeds, three sacks of  fertilizer, and pesticides. Her income will go to her savings and school expenses, such as allowance and tuition of her children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of hybrid seeds, three sacks of fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 50 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in her community, which she has done for three years.  She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice and chips. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Dominga is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use her profits for the school fees of her youngest child who is 19 years old.

loans.use: to buy  coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, insect repellent, rice and chips

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 48 years old. She and her family is from Trinidad, Bohol. She managed a fish pond where she supply fingerlings and prawn to different parts of Bohol, Leyte and Negros provinces. Her business is thriving and she is asking a loan to continue expanding her business. She will use it to buy more fingerlings. Gloria’s income will pay for the school fees of her children ages 13 and 17. In the future, she plans to have another fish pond for stocking.

loans.use: to buy more fingerlings

loans.name: Gresel

texts.en: Gresel is married and works hard to support her family by running a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this line of work for the last five years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anna Lee

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anna Lee works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Anna Lee is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Anna Lee has sustained her business through 7 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Arnanie

texts.en:
Arnanie is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a raising pigs business in the Philippines. Arnanie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Arnanie has been raising pigs for 1 year and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda is a 54-year-old married woman with seven children. Her youngest child is still a dependent, aged 12. She and her family live in Trinidad, Bohol. She has depended on her income from rice farming for more than sixteen years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. These will help so that she can get a better return on her investment. 

She hopes that through this loan, she can further expand her business, making more profit and providing for her family's daily consumption and income out of her harvest. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm to cultivate so that she and her family can live in comfort.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a  39-year-old married man with five  dependent children ranging in  age from 6-19. To support his family, he sells fresh fish and seashells.  He earn 3,000 PHP per month. He requests a loan to buy more fresh fish and seashells since there is a high demand for seashells at the moment. With this, Gerald would like to grab the opportunity. His income will keep his children in school. In the future, Gerald hopes to have a more stable business.

loans.use: to  buy  fresh fish and seashells

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a fruit vending business for 10 years.

Anacorita requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell.

Anacorita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar solution for his mobile shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cement, sand, gravel and workers to repair the veranda of her house.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is a married man and is 61 years old. He lives in Trinidad, Bohol with his wife. Aurelio is a farmer and a hog-raiser. He works hard to improve his business and support himself and his wife. He requested this loan to purchase piglets and feed.  

Aurelio plans to increase his hogs and expand his farm for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en: Jenilyn is 26 years old and lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her two children, who are three and four years old, and earns a living by running a sari-sari or convenience store. She is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell such as detergents, bath soaps, seasonings, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and fish. She will also buy materials to use to renovate her house. She will use the additional income she expects to earn to pay day-to-day expenses and tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy detergent, bath soap, seasonings, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and fish.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 55 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with a 15-year-old dependent.  She is engaged in a sari-sari store business and she also sells fish.  

Celia would like to improve her inventory level and include buying items in bulk for a better profit. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy items like detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies, and seasoning.  She hopes that with the help of the loan she will be able to increase her income for her family.

loans.use: to buy detergent, shampoo, canned goods, bath soap, chips, candies, and seasoning

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is from Baybay, Leyte. He is a 52-year-old father of 2 children.

Ernesto is starting a new business in order to enhance their livelihood. He buys and sells scrap materials.

Thus, Ernesto dreams to have better means of earning his living. He works hard to reach his goal of becoming a successful businessman in the future.

With this in mind, Ernesto is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital. With this, he will buy more scrap to sell.

loans.use: to buy scrap.

loans.name: Gloria Cecibel

texts.es:
Cecibel es madre soltera de 20 años, vive junto a su hijo y su madre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo. A pesar de lo duro que es tener un hijo sin el apoyo del padre ella ha hecho todo lo posible por salir adelante; desde hace dos años ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, recorre todas las tardes ya que por la mañana trabaja como ama de casa; está muy agradecida por las personas que le apoyan ya que puede llevar a su pequeño hijito de 8 meses a su lugar de trabajo, por él se dedicó al comercio ambulante ya que puede estar más pendiente de él.
Cecibel se dedica mucho a su trabajo y a su pequeño; ahora gracias a este crédito va a comprar más ropa y variedad de cosméticos para poder fortalecer su negocio, así podrá seguir creciendo, ahorrando e invirtiendo para empezar a visitar otras zonas
Agradece a Kiva y a la institución por permitir adquirir un crédito ya que en otras instituciones por su corta edad no le han dado la oportunidad.
texts.en: CCecibel is 20 years old and is a single mother. She lives with her son and her mother in the city of Santo Domingo. Because it is difficult to have a child without receiving support from his father, she has done everything possible to get ahead. For two years she has worked selling cosmetics and clothing in the afternoons, while working in the mornings as a stay-at-home mother. She is very grateful to the people who are supporting her because she can take her 8-month-old son with her to work. She works as a mobile vendor so that she can have more time with him. Cecibel is very dedicated to her work and to her child. With this loan she will buy more clothing and a variety of cosmetics to strengthen her business. In this way she can continue growing, saving and investing in order to start visiting other regions. She is grateful to Kiva and to the organization for allowing her to obtain a loan, because other organizations would not give her this opportunity due to her age.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and cosmetics in order to strengthen her business and to grow, together with her young son.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Maria Luisa has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more fish to sell.

Maria Luisa has been in this business for 5 years now.

Maria Luisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling fish in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this line of work for four years, and earns additional money from selling food. Susanna has grown her business through hard work and with help from loans by NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Angelina

texts.es:
Sandra, de 34 años de edad, está acompañada, es madre de 4 hijos.
 
Sandra, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene mucho tiempo de realizar este negocio, pero aparte de eso, también apoya a su esposo en la agricultura.

Sandra, está solicitando un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, como gramoxone, abono y fertilizantes, para sembrar granos básicos como maíz y frijol junto a su esposo, con este cultivo tendrán granos para el consumo familiar y para que Sandra haga las tortillas.

A futuro desea ver su negocio más grande y bien establecido, para poder generar mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra, 34 years old, is in a relationship and is the mother of 4 children. She makes a living selling tortillas. She has carried out this business for a long time, but apart from that, she also supports her husband in farming.

Sandra is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as Gramoxone, manure, and fertilizers to plant staple grains such as corn and beans with her husband. With this crop, they will have grains for family consumption and for Sandra to make the tortillas.

In the future, Sandra wishes to see her business bigger and well established to be able to generate better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as Gramoxone, manure, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rocrisma

texts.en:
For 6 years, Rocrisma has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She receives tips on how to manage her variety store and rice retailing business.

Rocrisma sells from her store various commodities such as toiletries, canned goods, snack items, condiments, and many others. Simultaneously she buys sacks of rice, repacks it per kilo, then sells it as part of her store's inventory. She really works hard in order to supplement her financial resources. She is a widow but her children are no longer dependent on her.

She aims to strengthen her business further. As a widow, Rocrisma needs to save enough for the future because she has no medical insurance or retirement benefits as a self-employed worker. She wants to purchase additional dry goods, grocery items and sacks of rice for her store. She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan.

Rocrisma hopes that your help will bring positive steps towards her dream of having a successful business. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods, grocery items, and sacks of rice for her store.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 46 years old and married. Cherry works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Cherry has been in this business for 27 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cherry would like to save money to provide a good future for family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like soft-drinks, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, snack foods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 51 years old and has four children. Cristina is married and has one child who is still in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cristina has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jeje

texts.en:
Jeje is 22 years old and a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Jeje has a juice vending business in the Philippines. Jeje requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, etc. for her business.

Jeje has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Jeje would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, milk, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar solution for his juice corner as well as to increase working hours

loans.name: Señor De Coylloriti Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucy Mayin ella es conviviente y tiene 31 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cremas, lápiz labial y perfumes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the "Señor de Coylloriti" Communal Bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.

Señora Lucy Mayin is thirty-one years old, she lives with her partner, and she has one son. She works in her business selling beauty products, such as lipstick, creams, and perfume, and she wants to get ahead by means of this business. She is an enterprising and courageous woman.

She is requesting the loan to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes. The other members have businesses such as selling snacks, selling clothing, a grocery store, and a book store.

She thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to purchase creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her charcoal vending business.

Lucia has been in this business for 2 years. Lucia earns more income from buying and selling eggs.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to replace her roof and protect her children.

loans.name: Rosa Marleny

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años de edad,madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo dependiente, vive en casa familiar domiciliado en la ANEXO LA LUCUMA, centro poblado Bolivar la cual es una zona rural, de la provincia de Chiclayo, Region Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.

Rosa se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza a terceros, hace 02 años, solicita préstamo para activo fijo; mantenimiento de su herramientas de trabajo como escobas nuevas, desinfectantes, escobillas, baldes, entre otros, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, aumentar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 31, is a single mother and has one dependent son. She lives in the family home located in the Anexo La Lucuma of the Bolivar settlement center, which is a rural zone in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, of the north coast of Peru.

Rosa has been making a living for two years offering cleaning services to third parties. She is requesting a loan for fixed assets; the maintenance of her work equipment such as new brooms, disinfectants, whisks, and pails amongst other things. In this way, she will be able the offer a better service to her customers, increase her level of income and ultimately improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy equipment for work such as new brooms, disinfectants, whisks, and pails amongst other things.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE URQUILLOS, el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Huallabamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Carmen tiene 51 años de edad y tiene 04 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, cebollas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE URQUILLOS. The bank is located in the district of Huallabamba, Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

The partner Carmen, 51, has four children. She alternates her daily activities making a living through the sale of vegetables. The partner has been doing well with her business which goes well thanks to the effort she puts into the business every day. She sells carrots and onions amongst other things. She wants to be able to continue working so as in this way to continue supporting her family.

The partner is requesting a loan in order to purchase vegetables.

The partner feels grateful for the loan offered and promises to comply with her established repayments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, nails and wire to replace the roof of her home and avoid an accident.

loans.name: Mariles

texts.en: Mariles is 39 years old and married. She lives in Tagmanocan, Lazi, Siquijor. For the past nine years, Mariles has been a farmer. She earns 7,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. Mariles is requesting a 14,900 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jenith

texts.en: Jenith really proves that there is money in garbage. She buys scrap materials and makes good profits out of it. Jenith, 37 years old, is married and has school-aged children. She lives in Tagmanocan, Lazi, Siquijor. Recently, she took out a loan to buy scrap materials for her junk shop business.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials for her junk shop business

loans.name: Gladys Pilar

texts.es:
Gladys es una señora de 44 años, vive junto a su pequeña hija en el recinto San José de las Juntas, sector productivo perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo.
En ese sector cuenta con una pequeña finca que fue dada por herencia de familiares, ahí tiene  una casa de madera donde habita desde hace varios años, siempre le acompaña su pequeña hija de 6 y su hijo mayor de edad que está pendiente de ella.
Gladys cuenta en la finca con varios productos, tiene  cacao, palma, café y plátano, se encarga del mantenimiento y limpieza del terreno todos los días, ya en la cosecha cuenta con un trabajador que le ayuda. Gracias a estos ingresos ella ha podido mantenerse y darle la educación a su hijita.
Gladys es clienta fiel de la institución, este es su segundo crédito, con él podrá seguir dando mantenimiento a la finca y seguir mejorando su producción por esta razón se encuentra muy agradecida con KIVA; comprará fungicidas, abonos y plantas.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old, and she lives with her little daughter in the "San José de las Juntas" neighborhood, a productive sector that is part of the city of Santo Domingo.

She has a small farm in this sector, which she inherited from relatives. She has a wooden house there, where she has lived for several years. She is always accompanied by her little six-year-old daughter and her oldest son, who looks after her.

Gladys has various produce on the farm, such as cacao, palm, coffee, and plantains. She takes care of the maintenance and cleaning of the land every day, and she has a worker who helps her with the harvest. Thanks to this income, she has been able to support herself and give her little daughter an education.

Gladys is a faithful customer of the institution. This is her second loan, with which she will be able to continue maintaining the farm and continue improving her production. For this reason, she is very grateful to Kiva. She will purchase fungicide, compost, and plants.

loans.use: to purchase fungicide, compost, and plants for her farm, in order to continue improving her production.

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (convenience) store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Devorah was able to turn the tide when her husband died and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of this good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 52-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with three children. One of them is still attending school. Annabelle works hard to raise her children. For five years she has been buying and selling frozen goods.

Annabelle dreams to improve her business. She wants to increase their livelihood to have a better means of living in the future. With this, she is requesting a loan to buy frozen goods such as chorizo, skinless, and hotdogs. Aside from frozen goods, Annabelle also buys and sells dried fish.

loans.use: to buy chorizo, skinless, hotdogs and dried fish.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 48 years old and a mother of two adult children, ages 24 and 23 years old. Her husband is a jail guard, while she owns a meat shop. Aside from selling meat, she also runs a sari-sari store business.

Nenita has been earning with this business for five years. She hopes in the future to improve her meat shop business to have a sustainable livelihood. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy meat and sari-sari items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, candies, chips, biscuits, and toiletries. She also wants to purchase three piglets. Perhaps she is planning to have additional sources of income like raising pigs in the future.

loans.use: to buy meat, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, candies, chips, biscuits, toiletries and piglets.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 27 years old, single and lives in eastern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 2 years already. The business has helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her younger siblings.

Marife is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. She has previously taken out loans to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for another loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
The result from the pigs business gives a pleasure feeling for all the member of Kerta Jaya Amerta group. And they can make their payment on time. The Kerta Jaya Amerta group saids their greatfull for all Lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support they had during the loans period. Ni Nengah, as the head, feels happy for the group she lead. Now every member of the Kerta Jaya Amerta group has saving and they will use it for business capital. Ni Nengah has support from her husband and she decide to propose a new loan to increasing her business

As the agreement from all member of the Kerta Jaya Amerta group, they continue to receiving a new loan. The loans use for increasing the number of pigs, renovate the cages and also buy a super quality feed.
Ni Nengah use her portion of loan to purchase super quality piglets and feed. As the head of the group, Ni Nengah hopes her group keeps cohesive and is always exchanging information between other member to know the latest information about the pig business.

loans.use: to purchase super quality piglets and feed.

loans.name: Xuân

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân is 55 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture as a farmer for more than 10 years.Xuân lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region. So it is very difficult for her to maintain the desired income every month.

One of her most difficulties is not having a hygienic toilet. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, equipment... to built a new toilet.
In 2015, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, equipment... to built a new toilet.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two sons aged 17 and 12 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Wilma helps him by doing vegetable farming.

Farming has been the family's main source of income for almost three years. Wilma’s income from her vegetable farm would become a big help for their daily consumption. Thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer. In the future, Wilma dreams of having another business that would help them increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is a 51-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has four children; the oldest school-aged child is 21 while the youngest is 14 years old. Lorena dreams of increasing her earnings. She wants to improve her business to have a better means of living in the future. She is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy grocery items such as sugar, spices, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk.

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a 39-year-old, woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three children ages 11, 6 and 1 years old. Her husband is a bus conductor, while Rachel is engaged in a buying and selling business. She buys and sells fruits and frozen foods like chorizo and skinless.

Rachel and her husband work hard to earn a living and provide for the needs of their children. They want to uplift their livelihood, so that they can send their children to college. Rachel dreams for her children to finish a degree. As for now, she is in need of an amount to continue her business to buy more fruits and frozen foods like chorizo and skinless to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruits and frozen foods like chorizo and skinless to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena es una mujer trabajadora de 45 años de edad que presta sus servicios domésticos para sacar adelante a su familia, dicha actividad la realiza de forma domiciliar desde hace 20 años. María Elena vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos a los que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. María Elena desea instalar una granja de pollos en su vivienda, ya que sabe que esto le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además la demanda de este productos es bastante en su cantón, por lo que sabe que su negocio prosperará muy rápido, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado, vitaminas y tela metálica para instalar su granja de pollos.
texts.en: María Elena is a hardworking 45 year old woman who works as a domestic employee to support her family. She’s been doing this for 20 years. Maria Elena has lived with her husband and three children in her own home for several years.  Maria Elena wants to set up a chicken farm in her home and she know that this will help improve her income. Besides that, the demand for this product is great in her area and knows that the business will succeed very quickly, but she doesn’t have the liquidity she needs so she is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy chickens, feed, vitamins, and chicken wire for her farm.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Union Is Strength - N17T04Tdương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vân Anh is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children.She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 6 years.
Vân Anh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral so she can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Vân Anh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2013, Vân Anh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Vân Anh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
She is the group leader of the N17T04TDương, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Vân Anh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids and to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married, with five children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while her youngest child is 8. 

Her husband works hard as an employee while Maria raises pigs. She has been in this business for 15 years. Aside from raising pigs, Maria also engages in the pedicure/manicure business. 

She and her husband work hard to earn a living. With that, she is asking a loan to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, she wants to improve her business and build a bigger piggery.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: N01T01Xtvậnthóa Group

texts.en:
Châm is 41 years old, and she is married, with two children.  She lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  The family is a low-income household in her village. 

She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for six years.  But the income from her job is unstable because some diseases kill her cattle, leaving her nothing to sell and with money problems.

The main hardship Châm faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to buy calves to raise and sell in future.

In 2011, Châm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the N01T01XTVậnTHoá group, which consists of six members. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 With her business profit, Châm hopes to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Mạnh

texts.en:
Mrs Mạnh is 40 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Mạnh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases on poultry happen, they could be dead so she has nothing to sell and she will be in trouble with finance.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Mạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her small dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en casa propia, cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia del mismo nombre, ubicada en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

María se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, cerveza y recargas a celulares,además se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y comercio del mismo, son una familia unida, María ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos de primera necesidad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old. She lives with her daughter in her own house, which has water and electricity. She lives in the Morropon district, where the primary sources of work are in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is part of the Province with the same name, located in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

María works selling groceries, beer, and cell phone refills. She also raises and sells cattle. Her family is very close. María applied for a loan in order to buy a variety of basic staple products to offer her customers, generating greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic staple products.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Annabelle works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Annabelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a fishnet, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fishnet, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a selling ready to wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell for her selling ready to wear business.

Lucila has been in this business for 10 years. Lucila earns more income from raising pigs.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy more products from personal collection to sell for her direct selling personal collection products business.

Veneranda has been in this business for 15 years. Veneranda earns more income from raising pigs.

Veneranda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more products from personal collection to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marivic is 33 years old and has four children who are in school.

Marivic has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses, underwear etc. to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses, underwear etc. to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Helen works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Helen is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as bananas, cooking oil, sugar and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, 62 years old, is married and has twelve children. She works hard to provide for her family. Merlyn has run a general store in the Philippines for 12 years and also earns an income from fishing. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods and personal care products, to sell.

Merlyn has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods and other personal care products, to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a cement floor and plaster the walls in her home.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto de 29 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde junto a su mamá y hermana. Roberto es un hombre muy luchador y emprendedor que quiere salir adelante. Roberto labora en una institución desde hace 9 años, es así como cubre las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Además de ello Roberto tiene un pequeño negocio, en el cual distribuye agua envasada en su comunidad con vehículo propio, lo cual le permite tener ingresos extras. Roberto solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en su negocio, él quiere invertir en la compra de más garrafones de agua y reparar el vehículo con el cual distribuye el agua envasada así podrá ofrecer a más personas el producto y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Roberto is 29 years old and lives very happily in a home of his own with his mother and sister. Roberto is a striving and enterprising man who wants to get ahead. Roberto has been working for a company for nine years and this is how he earns a living and covers his basic household needs. He also has a small business where he distributes bottled water within his community in his own vehicle. This allows him to have an extra income. Roberto is asking for a loan through FUSAI so he can buy large jugs of water and repair the vehicle he uses to distribute it, so he can serve more customers and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy jugs of water.

loans.name: Edy Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Edy Roxana de 33 años de edad  es madre soltera y su negocio es una pulpería se dedica desde hace 07 años a su negocio, su negocio está ubicado en la zona sur de Honduras.
Doña Edy sus clientes la prefieren por ser un persona muy amable en su negocio ofrece a su público todo lo que es producto de la canasta básica, refrescos, granos, etc. es conocida por ser una mujer luchadora y sus clientes son todo los amigos y vecinos y personas de las diferentes colonias vecinas.
Doña Edy  está solicitando el préstamo para la compra  de frijoles. Azúcar, café, huevos, leche, pan, harina, aceite, etc. para surtir su negocio y poder ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes que le visitan, con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejorar en su negocio.
Su sueño es tener su negocio más surtido para tener una mejor condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015
texts.en:
Edy Roxana is 33 years old and a single mother. She has had a grocery store for seven years, located in the south part of Honduras. Edy’s customers like her because she is friendly in her business and offers all the basic food items, such as soft drinks, grains, etc. She is known for being a hardworking woman and her customers are her friends, neighbors, and people from the surrounding neighborhoods. Edy is asking for this loan to buy beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, milk, bread, flour, cooking oil, etc. in order to stock her store so she can offer more products to her customers. She would like to improve her business with her earnings and with help from this loan. Her dream is to have a better stocked store and improved quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2015.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia Claudia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion, la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cemento, clavos y arena.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Claudia continues working at her business selling construction materials. She is a hardworking person that has brought her family success with her business. Her dream is to expand her business.

She is requesting this loan to purchase cement, nails, and sand. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase cement, nails, and sand.

loans.name: Never Give Up - N01T6Tlýthóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huyền is 43 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has had a service business running a cafe for 7 years.
Huyền lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable.

The main hardship that Huyền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand and purchase more ingredients to prepare the drinks for her cafe shop.

This is Huyền first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could help her improve her life standard.
She is the group leader of the N01T6TLýTHóa, which consists of 3 members.
With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her children to do well in school, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to expand and purchase more ingredients to prepare the drinks for her cafe.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora is a 45 years old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with one son aged 21 years old. Her husband is a security guard while Dioscora has been engaged in sari-sari store business. Aside this, she also engaged in raising pigs. Dioscora works hard to have better means of living. With this, she is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy to grocery items such as eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee, sugar and toiletries. Other part of the loan she is requesting is to buy piglets and feeds. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, spices, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, biscuits, candies, coffee, sugar, toiletries, piglets and pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Recently, in some places in the Philippines selling fried chicken became in demand not just in exclusive food court among malls but in food stall along the street. It becomes one of those sustainable small businesses for some individuals.

Virginia, a 26 years old married woman raised her two children by doing this business. She has been doing this for more than four years. Her husband works hard also by driving “pedicab” (a cycle rickshaw, it is a vehicle with three wheels that is moved by foot pedals). Thus, she is asking a loan to buy more chicken meat for fried. In the future, she dreams to improve her business and became sustainable.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a sari-sari store owner from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is 48 years old woman with three children ages 25, 17 and 15 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Belinda is running a sari-sari store. Thus, Belinda is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as coffee, sugar, powdered milk, spices, toiletries, biscuits, chips, candies, cooking oil, noodles, can goods, soft drinks and drinking liquor. In the future, she wants to improve her sari-sari business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, powdered milk, spices, toiletries, biscuits, chips, candies, cooking oil, noodles, can goods, soft drinks and drinking liquor

loans.name: Junnalyn

texts.en:
Junnalyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 23 years old and has one child who is in school.

Junnalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Junnalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Junnalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Prezel

texts.en:
Prezel, 40 years old, is married and has seven children, five of them presently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Prezel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Prezel has been in this business for 25 years. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 33 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past two years, Josephine has operated a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is a widow with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Celia is 39 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Celia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Celia requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín, de 50 años de edad, es un agricultor, por los pocos recursos económicos de su familia nunca pudo estudiar, está  casado y su esposa se dedica a la elaboración de petates y a trabajar como empleada doméstica para obtener ingresos para suplir los gastos del hogar, en su casa solo viven sus dos hijos.

Efraín, necesita el crédito para comprar helados, este negocio lo inicio hace más de 5 años y es una fuente de ingresos extras para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Efraín, sueña con apoyar a su familia y ser distribuidor de helados.
texts.en: Efrain is 50 years old and a farmer. He was never able to attend school due to his family’s lack of resources. He is married and his wife makes kit bags and works as a domestic employee in order to supplement the household expenses. Efrain needs a loan to buy frozen treats. He started this business five years ago and it’s a source of extra income to cover the household expenses. Efrain wants so support his family and be a frozen treats distributor.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats.

loans.name: Elmer Antonio

texts.es:
Elmer, de 19 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador, estudio hasta noveno grado, pero a pesar de las circunstancias de la vida tiene el entusiasmo de seguir adelante, está soltero y no tiene hijos.

Elmer, se dedica a la venta de pan en una motocicleta desde hace más de 4 años, está labor la aprendió por consejos de un amigo y decidió continuar ejerciéndola para obtener ganancias para su sustento.

Elmer, necesita el crédito para ajustar el motor de la motocicleta donde sale a vender el pan y hacer unos cambios para mejorar su servicio.

Él sueña con tener una familia y trabajar para darles lo necesario.
texts.en: Elmer is 19 years old and is a hardworking young man. He has a ninth grade education but despite life’s circumstances he is enthusiastic about getting ahead. He is single and has no children. Elmer sells bread on his motorcycle, has done so for more than four years, and learned this from a friend and decided to start doing this in order to support himself. Elmer needs a loan so he can tune up his motorcycle engine and make some changes in order to improve his business. He dreams of having a family and working to provide them with what they need.
