loans.use: to tune up his delivery motorcycle.

loans.name: Celuk Rahayu Group

texts.en:
The Celuk Rahayu group make its payment.  During the loan periods, its members can manage their businesses well.  Most of them maintain sows, and the sows give birth to as many as 12 piglets. But not all; some have 6 to 8 piglets, depending on the sow. The superior sow has more than the ordinary sow.

Ni Wayan is very happy because her sow gave birth to 11 healthy piglets, and she sold all of them. She kept them for two months and sold them to another breeder in her village. All the profit was used as capital for her chilli garden.

Succes with her sows, Ni Wayan continuesher business as a piglets seller. Her piglets have a good quality because she keeps them well and gives them nutritious feed and vitamins. She has become a model for other breeders, not only in her group but in her village also.
 
With same loan size, she will use her loan to purchase superior quality feed and renovate her pigs' cage.

Her husband works as a security guard in a hotel in Denpasar. He fully supports his wife business. 

One member is not in picture because of an illness.

loans.use: to buy superior quality feed and renovate her pigs' cage

loans.name: Invest Money, Gain Profit - N66Ttvhà Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 37 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling pig intestines for more than 10 years.
Thanh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase and resell more intestines to increase her income.
This is Thanh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her life standard.

Thanh is the group leader of N66TTVHà, which consists of 4 members.
With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase and resell more pig intestines.

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en: Dominica is a resident in Mahaplag, Leyte. To earn a living, she is engaged in hog raising business. This business help her raised her five children. Aside from raising pigs, she is also engaged in food selling business. Dominca is a 48 years old woman and hopes to increase her livelihood. Thus, she dreams to have better lives in the future. To help her improve her livelihood, she is asking to lend money to buy piglets and feed. She also buys ingredients for her food selling business such as cooking oil, sugar and flour.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, cooking oil, sugar and flour

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en: Esmeralda is 51 years old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with four children. One of these four children is still attending school. Her other children have already raised their own families. To earn a living, Esmeralda runs a sari-sari store business. With that, she is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries and laundry soap. In the future, she wants to improve her business to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, canned goods, noodles, chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries and laundry soap

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a fisherman from Bien Unido, Bohol. He is a married man with an 11-year-old dependent. He has been engaged in fishing for more than 20 years now. This business has provided Jerry what he needs for sustenance.

Jerry is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing nets, nails and plywood. This loan will allow him to improve his fishing business, as well as his income. In the future, Jerry hopes to make his fishing venture more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, nails and plywood.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en: Felicidad is a sari-sari store owner from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and a mother of six children. Her oldest child is 22 years old while youngest child is eight years old. Felicidad has been in the business of sari-sari store for a year. With this, she is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy toiletries, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, sugar, candies, chips, bread and biscuits. In the future, she wishes to improve her business. Thus, she wants her business to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, spices, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, sugar, candies, chips, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Jose Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, de 50 años de edad, es agricultor, está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa, tiene 4 hijos y por falta de recursos económicos no pudo asistir a la escuela.

Lucio, tiene mucha experiencia en el área agrícola, porque desde muy pequeño inicio a ejercer esta labor.

Lucio, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y otros insumos agrícolas, para aplicarlos a sus cultivos, anteriormente había sembrado pero debido a la sequía por la que está pasando el país, perdido su cosecha.

Lucio, sueña con obtener una buena producción esta vez, para cubrir las necesidades de su casa y darle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en: Lucio is 50 years old and a farmer. He’s married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. He was not able to attend school due to a lack of resources. Lucio is a very experienced farmer because he began when he was very young. Lucio needs a loan to buy fertilizer and other farming supplies for his crops. He had planted earlier but he lost his crops because of the drought his country is facing. Lucio dreams of having a good production this time so that he can cover his family and household needs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 50 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines.

Anabella has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Anabella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Alma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Sơn

texts.en:
Sơn is 61 years old, and he is married.  He has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years. He lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

His family is a low-income household in his village.  Moreover, the income from his job is unstable, so it is very difficult for him to do what he wants.

One of the most critical concerns is that his latrine is not hygienic. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick. and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Sơn's first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. He hopes that this loan can help make his small dream come true.

Sơn hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to find good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una zona productiva de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 8 hijos, Este hombre alegre y motivador tiene más de 30 años de trabajar produciendo café, el cual maneja ahora bajo el proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo, está requiriendo un crédito para la compra de insumos que demanda su plantación de café para un adecuado mantenimiento. Con esta inversión, está seguro obtendrá una buena cosecha y con ello mejores ingresos para su familia.

Su sueño es heredar a sus hijos un futuro prometedor, y está seguro que el café es un rubro que tiene gran potencial para alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en:
Concepción is a small coffee producer who lives in a productive area of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and eight children. This cheerful and motivated man has more than 30 years experience producing coffee, which he now operates under the process of fair trade certification.

For this cycle, he requires a loan to purchase supplies that are required for proper maintenance on his coffee plantation. With this investment, he is sure to obtain a better harvest and thus better income for his family.

His dream is to leave his children a better future, and he is confident that coffee is a field that has great potential to realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies that are needed for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Rosely

texts.en:
Rosely is married, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosely is 34 years old and has two children still in school.

Rosely has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Rosely has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her fishing

loans.name: Bhavnaben And Group

texts.en:
Bhavnaben is the leader of a group of five women. She runs her sari business in Ahmedabad, Gujarat and currently earns Rs. 5,000 every month from it. Bhavnaben is 47 years old and lives with her family of three. She finds it hard to cover the household expenses with her current income. She therefore wants to expand her business to increase her earnings. Bhavnaben wants to sell a wider variety of saris such as zari saris, bandhani saris, etc. She expects to earn an extra Rs. 2,000 every month.

The other ambitious members of the group have joined Bhavnaben in seeking a loan to expand their existing businesses. The only thing stopping them is lack of funds. Your loan will help these women expand their businesses and earn better incomes.

loans.use: to expand her existing sari business to sell zari saris, bandhani saris, etc.

loans.name: Najmun Nisa

texts.en:
Najmun Nisa is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 18 years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Najmun Nisa's husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do the necessary maintenance. Therefore Najmun Nisa has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Najmun Nisa's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Najmun Nisa also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Najmun Nisa is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Hasinaben And Group

texts.en:
Hasinaben seeks a loan to start her ready-made clothes selling business. She is 48 years old and lives with her family of four in Dahod district in Gujarat. With her current household income, she is not able to keep up with the rising expenses of her household. She needs an additional source of income. Thus, she has decided to start her own business of ready-made clothes.

She seeks a loan for the same purpose. With the loan, she will purchase t-shirts, jeans, leggings, etc. She hopes that the new business will increase her income sufficiently.

Hasinaben has formed a group with four women who find themselves in the same situation as her. They seek a loan of INR 75,000 to expand their existing businesses. The increased income after the loan will help them contribute more to family incomes and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to start her ready-made clothes business and sell jeans, leggings, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, floor tiles and a toilet to change the bathroom and to look after the health of her household

loans.name: Farangis

texts.en: Farangis is a strong girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1993. She is single and lives with her parents. Farangis is a well-mannered, accurate and generous person. She graduated high school with excellence. She had a dream to work in banking. In order to achieve her goals, she entered university in business law and policy. She is studying at the faculty of Finance and Credit. Farangis likes to study; she is responsible and active during classes. She wants to work in banking and be helpful to the country's economy. Farangis has appealed to get a loan from IMON to pay her higher education costs. She hopes for KIVA lenders' kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Los Rosales Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania ella es soltera y tiene 40 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra café y plátanos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de ganaderia, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: These members are part of the “LOS ROSALES” communal bank, located in the Santa Ana district, La Convencion province, and Cusco department. Tania is 40 years old, single, and has two children. She works in her agricultural business and has a plot of farmland where she raises coffee and bananas and works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She’s been doing this for several years and things are going well for her. She wants to expand her farming business and is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The members whose photos are added to the group photo were not able to attend due to work commitments. The rest of the members have businesses such as animal sales, livestock, grocery stores, or restaurants. She is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is a widow and has four adult children. 

To earn a living, she is engaged in the hog-raising business. Aside from raising pigs, she owns a small sari-sari store.  

Mryna works hard to save money for the future, so that when she is old enough to stop working, she will have something to spend on her needs.  

Myrna is asking a loan to buy pig feed and grocery items, such as coffee, sugar, biscuits, bread, candies, spices, and toiletries. In the future, she wants to improve her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and coffee, sugar, biscuits, bread, candies, spices, and toiletries for her store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married, with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 56 years old and has one child who is in school.

Rebecca has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rebecca has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 61 years old and married, with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Meriam has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Meriam has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and both of her children are in school. Emelie has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell. Emelie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emelie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Hulda

texts.es:
María tiene 63 años y desde hace 4 años se dedica a la producción de café en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposo y sus 7 hijos los cuales ayudan en las actividades agrícolas para sacar adelante su pequeña finca, la cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, demostrando así su espíritu emprendedor y de responsabilidad social.

En los últimos tres años su producción de café ha venido aumentado, y confía en que continuará mejorando si logra obtener un crédito que le permita asegurar la aplicación correcta y oportunidad de insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su plantación, para lo cual está solicitando este financiamiento.

Su mayor anhelo en el futuro, es producir café de mayor calidad y alto rendimiento, y heredar a sus hijos además de sus estudios, el amor por el trabajo, lo cual está segura logrará gracias a su espíritu emprendedor.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and for the last 4 years she has earned a living producing coffee in a community in the north of Nicaragua. She lives with her husband and 7 children who help out with farming duties in order to make a success of their small coffee plantation. It operates under the criteria for Fair Trade certification, demonstrating her entrepreneurial spirit and social responsibility.

In the past three years coffee production has been increasing and she is confident that it will continue to improve if she can get a loan. A loan will ensure the correct application of fertilizers and the opportunity to buy the supplies required for her farm. This is the reason why she is applying for a loan.

Her greatest wish for the future is to produce higher quality coffee with higher yields, leave her children something to inherit, in addition to helping with their studies and to love her job. She is sure she will achieve this thanks to her enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy the supplies and fertilizers required for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and has six children. Her oldest child is 22 years old while her youngest child is 10 years old. 

Her husband works hard as a farmer while Patricia is engaged in selling snack foods such as “budbod” (a sweet, sticky rice with coconut milk wrapped in banana leaves and steamed). 

Patricia dreams of improving her livelihood to have a better means of living in the future. With that, she is asking for a loan to buy ingredients, such as assorted flour, cooking oil, sugar, coconut milk, and milled rice. Occasionally, she also sells her harvested fruit.

loans.use: to buy assorted flour, cooking oil, sugar, coconut milk, and milled rice

loans.name: Mosoq Illary -Chahuares Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal MOSOQ ILLARY-CHAHUARES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Echarate, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Josefina  tiene 50 tiene 03 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son platanos, naranjas  entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas.
Los socios en general agradecen   el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: This member belongs to the Mosoq Illary-Chahuares communal bank.  The bank is located in the Echarate district in the La Convención province and the Cusco department.  Josefina is 50 years old, has three children and is married.  She alternates between her daily activities, making a living in fruit cultivation.  She has had her business for a while, which is going well thanks to the commitment that she makes to it every day.  She sells bananas, oranges, as well as other fruit.  She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family through this means.  She is requesting the loan to buy fruit.  As a whole, the members are grateful for the loan that is granted and are committed to paying the established installments.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Shining Smiles - N01Mhùngmlộc Group

texts.en:
Mười is 42 years old, and she is married with 2 children.  Mười lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for eight years.

Her family is a low-income household in her village.  Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mười faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, and milk to resell.

In 2012, Mười joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business.  She has successfully repaid four loans to Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of the N01MHùngMLộc, which consists of three members.

With her business profit, Mười hopes to buy a motorbike; for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase more cake, sweets, suger, and milk to resell

loans.name: Marylyn

texts.en:
Marylyn is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a repair shop. Marylyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Kapilaben And Group

texts.en:
Kapilaben is a 33-year-old entrepreneur, who runs a bagsara business in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. Her business involves selling bangles, artificial jewelry, beauty items, etc. She plans to expand her business to sell more items and she needs a loan to be able to do that.

With the loan, she will purchase items such as earrings, rings, bangles, etc. She expects her monthly income to increase from INR 3,500 to INR 5,000. The increase in her income will boost her living and help her save for future needs.

Kapilaben leads a group of five women. The other members of the group also run their own businesses to sustain their respective families. Together they need a loan of INR 125,000 to expand their businesses. These women are grateful to you for your loan.

loans.use: to expand her bagsara business and sell earrings, rings, bangles, etc.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 45-year-old man and a sari-sari store owner. He is from Mahaplag, Leyte and a father of four children ages 18, 17, 14 and 13 years old. His wife takes good care of their children while he works hard to provide the needs of their children. Aside from sari-sari store business, Felipe also engaged in buying and selling vegetables. With this, he is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy grocery items such as assorted spices, vinegar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink. He also buys assorted vegetables. Felipe is a man who wants the best for her family. He wants to improve his business to have better earnings for his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted spices, vinegar, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate drink and assorted vegetables

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a resident in Baybay, Leyte. He is married and has two sons ages nine and five years old. To support them, he raises pigs and work hard as construction worker. Joel has been doing a hog raising business for three years and hoping to have better earnings. But most of the time, his daily income for being a construction worker is only enough for their consumption. With that, he is asking a loan to buy additional piglets and feed as well. In the future, he wishes to uplift his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Fercibal

texts.en: To earn a living, 25 year-old Fercibal is engaged in “habal-habal” (Visayan term of a motorcycle with extended seat to accommodate more passengers in a row) business. He is from Baybay, Leyte. He has been driving a motorcycle for two years, that was when he gets married. Fercibal is a father of two years old son. He works hard to provide the needs of his family. Thus, he is asking a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. In the future, he wishes to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica is a 44-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with three children ages 10, nine and six years old. Her husband works hard as a mechanic while she is running a sari-sari store business to earn a living. She has been running this for a year. With this, she is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice and milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles and canned goods. In the future, she wishes to expand her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice and milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles and canned goods

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 54 years old and married with one child. Mildred works very hard to provide for them.

Mildred runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mildred has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Mildred would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosefe

texts.en:
Rosefe is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosefe is 43 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Rosefe has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Rosefe requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell  like shorts, shirts, blouses, leggings, pant and etc.

Rosefe has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell  like shorts, shirts, blouses, leggings, pant and etc

loans.name: Chan Devi

texts.en:
Chand Devi is 41 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 18. In 2008, she established her tea shop business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy food materials for the business.

In the future, Chand Devi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called chiya nasals, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs for her tea shop.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 26 years old and mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a manufacturing business making boxes. Her husband is only person responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Tahira's husband needs to purchase different types of papers, raw materials and other items for his business purpose, so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase these items for his business. Therefore, Tahira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his box-making manufacturing business.

loans.name: Samsaroi

texts.en:
Samsaroi was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is married and has two children. She is an agrarian and works at collective farm nearby their house. She has many years of practice in agriculture. She does well her job and employee is satisfied of her work. She likes her activity very much.

Her son is sick. It is hard for mother to see a sick child. She worries about her son’s health. She is willing to heal him at hospital. She needs money to pay medical service and medicines there.

So, she appealed to IMON and Kiva asking financial support to pay her son’s treatment at hospital. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your compassion. The loan will help her to have healthy son.

loans.use: To pay her son’s treatment at hospital

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE URQUILLOS, el banco esta ubicado en el distrito de Huallabamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Mariluz  tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la venta de verduras, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son zanahorias, cebollas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para  de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the Communal Bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE URQUILLOS. The bank is located in the district of Huallabamba, province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. Mariluz is 34 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities and works selling vegetables. She has worked for a while in this business, and she is doing very well thanks to the hard work she puts in the business every day. She sells carrots, onions, among other things.  Mariluz wants to keep on working so that she can continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables. She is grateful for the given loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 18-years-old single lady from a village near Nablus city. her father works as an employee in the public sector. This income is barely covers all the family needs.

Malak is a student in the university where she studies science. She wants to take the B. Sc.degree and find a job in the future to support her family. Malak took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Malak will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Malak appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for her B. Sc. in Science this semester.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and mother of 3 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 9 years.

Nasreen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business

loans.name: Gabriel Climaco

texts.es:
Don Gabriel es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En los últimos tres años la producción de café en su finca ha producido hasta 900 qq de café pergamino. Don Gabriel dice que la actividad del café es gratificante “está presente en nuestros hogares y lo mejor es su aporte a la economía” señala.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, y asegurar una buena cosecha para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Se considera una persona activa y con mucha energía, la cual invierte para brindar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Don Gabriel is a small coffee producer who lives in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua. For the last three years, his farm has produced up to 9,000 Kilos of Pergamino coffee. Don Gabriel says that coffee production is a rewarding activity, "it's present in our homes and the best part of it is its contribution to the economy", he notes.

For this cycle, he is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and fertilizers for the upkeep of his farm and to ensure a good harvest and improve upon his family's living conditions. He considers himself an active individual with a lot of energy, which he invests in providing his children a better life.

loans.use: purchase supplies and fertilizers for his coffee farm

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Chand Devi is 46 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 24. she is running a grocery shop as her business since long. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy food materials for the business.

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs for her grocery store.

loans.name: Nicomedes Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  TERCER MILENIO, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Wilfredo tiene 56 años de edad es casado y tiene 02 hijos, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de materiales de construcción  socio vende lo que son ladrillos, cemento entre otros, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de ladrillos.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
He is one of the members of the Tercer Milenio communal bank, located in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco .

Wilfredo is 56 years old, married, and has two children. In addition to his daily activities, he sells construction materials, such as bricks and cement. He has had this business for quite some time now and is doing very well thanks to how hard he works every day. He wishes to continue working in order to support his family.

He is requesting this loan to buy bricks. He is grateful for this loan and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy bricks.

loans.name: Hetem

texts.en:
Hetem is 49 years old and has a 1-year-old son. In order to earn a living he works as a taxi driver while his wife is home with their child. His son has Down's Syndome and they have many expenses and they put a lot of effort into raising him well, but sometimes it is difficult for them emotionally.

She has tried to find employment, but has been unsuccessful so far and hopes that she will find a job very soon. Hetem is the main source of income then and works hard to improve their living conditions, including working mainly at night when he can make more money driving during the late hours. He also has a small greenhouse to plant different vegetables for his family to consume and to sell locally.

At this time he is requesting a loan to expand his greenhouse to be able to sell many vegetables in the neighborhood and increase their income to better care for their son and attend to his needs. He hopes that in the future he will be able to further expand his business and is very grateful to the lenders for this chance. He promises to pay on time and be responsible for the loan.

loans.use: to expand his greenhouse to be able to sell many vegetables in the neighborhood and increase their income.

loans.name: Mahran

texts.en:
Mahran is a 33-year-old, married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Mahran has a stall for selling clothes in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Mahran took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing to sell at his stall

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
O cliente é trabalhador, casado pai de 3 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundário , 2  frequentam o ensino primário, tem também 3 enteados na sua responsabilidade vive em casa própria.
 O cliente conseguiu com os empréstimos anteriores começar a sua casa tipo 3 e com este valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, ferro, cimento, porta, chapas de zinco, portas para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O cliente tem como sonhos concluir e ampliar a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, e futuramente se formar em mestrado no curso de gestão.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
He works. He is married and the father of three children; one goes to secondary school and two to primary school. He also takes care of three children her wife has from another relationship. He owns the house where he lives.

With the previous loans, he was able to start building his three-room house. With this loan, he is planning to buy iron, cement, doors, and zinc sheets to continue with the construction works.

His dreams are to finish building his house in order to offer his family a better home, and in the future, study to become an administrator. His challenges are financial in nature. He has turned to his work and is planning to apply for more loans to overcome the difficulties and achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, doors, and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
Daler was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. He is single and lives with parents. He helps his parents in household and also earning money to financial budget of a family. He is a constructor and does his work well and has regular clients who order to renovate and build houses. He likes his work and satisfied to have permanent clients.

His mother is sick and he needs to have her treated at a medical clinic. He is willing to get a loan from IMON and Kiva to pay his mother’s treatment. He hopes to be understood and supported by KIVA lenders. He wishes to see his mother healthy.

loans.use: to pay for his mother’s treatment at hospital

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María es una señora de 49 años, vive junto a su esposo y su hija en el recinto El Placer perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo.
Juntos trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia, actualmente trabajan en una finca como jornaleros pero ahí también cuentan con crianza de cerdos; siempre gracias al apoyo de sus patrones les han dado el espacio para que críen sus animales, ya se dedican a esta actividad varios años, la señora María es la encargada de cuidarlos y alimentarlos. Tienen varios chanchos pero desean incrementar porque el negocio es muy bueno, tienen bastante demanda. María es clienta fiel de la institución este es su tercer crédito, con este dinero comprará 15 cerditos y el alimento para poder criarlos, así fortalecerá su negocio y podrá incrementar para seguir creciendo.
María siempre está agradecida con Kiva y con Fundación alternativa, porque a más de dar un crédito siempre están capacitándolos y dándoles atención medica que ellos necesitan.
texts.en: Maria is a 49 year old woman. She lives with her husband and daughter in "El Placer" precinct, belonging to the city of Santo Domingo. Together they work very hard to move their family ahead. Currently, they work in a farm as daily laborers, but there they have a business raising pigs. Always and thanks to their bosses' support, they have some space to raise their animals. They have already been working in this business for many years. Maria is in charge of taking care of the animals and feeding them. They have many pigs, but they want to increase their number because the business is very good and they have much demand. Maria is a loyal client of the institution: this is her third loan. With this money she will buy 15 piglets and food to raise them. This way, she will strengthen her business and increase the quantity of animals to keep on growing. Maria is always grateful to Kiva and Fundacion Alternativa, because besides giving loans, they are always offering training and the medical attention they need.

loans.use: to buy 15 piglets in order to increase production and keep on growing in her business.

loans.name: Walter Fabricio

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre ecuatoriano de 31 años de edad, el mismo que  nació en la  ciudad de Latacunga  perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi , actualmente se encuentra  soltero  desde hace varios años , vive en casa de los padres.
Con el esfuerzo de sus padres pudo terminar la primaria, por la difícil situación económica  de su familia tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeño y así poder ser un gran apoyo para él y su familia.
Ha sentido la difícil situación de no poder encontrar trabajo por la falta de oportunidades, pero pese a esto no se ha dado por vencido y ha salido adelante con su pequeño negocio, el mismo que se trata de un pequeño local de comida típica que lo aprendió de sus padres.
Por el momento solicita un crédito el mismo que lo utilizara para comprar un congelador un enfriador y adecuaciones en su local ,  esto mejorará sus ingresos y por ende sus utilidades.
Su mayor sueño es que algún momento pueda crecer mas su negocio  y ahora Walter  quiere extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Walter is a 31 year-old Ecuadorian man.  He was born in the city of Latacunga, located in the Cotopaxi province.  Currently, he is single and has been for some years now.  He lives in his parent’s house.  

Due to his parent’s efforts, he was able to finish elementary school, though because of his family’s difficult economic situation, he had to work when he was very young to support himself and his family.  He has experienced the difficult situation of not being able to find work due to a lack of opportunities, but in spite of this, he has not given up and has moved forward with his small business: a small storefront that sells traditional food that he learned how to make from his parents.

Currently, he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy a fridge, a freezer and other upgrades for his storefront, which will improve his income, and therefore his profits.  His greatest dream is to further grow his business.  Walter wants to thank and commend Kiva for making the growth he has experienced in his work and his personal life possible.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and freezer to upgrade his storefront, which will improve his income and his profits.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Riagine is 17 years old and is the second of four children in the family. She is studying a Bachelor of Science Industrial Technology and is currently on her 2nd year of this 4-year course. When she graduates, Riagine plans to be gainfully employed.

Her mother Ma. Gina, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the 1st semester of 2015-2016.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Belaben And Group

texts.en:
Belaben leads a group of 5 women in Ahmedabad, Gujarat. She is 27 and a mother of 2 children. Her household monthly income of Rs. 12,000 is not sufficient to sustain her family. She wants to increase her income so she can save enough to fund her children’s education. Currently she saves Rs. 3000 per month. But that would not suffice to pay for the expenses of 2 growing children.

She thus wants to start her own business. To do that, she needs a loan. With the loan, she plans to buy beauty products, facial kits, etc to start her beauty products selling business. She expects her monthly income to go up by Rs. 2500. The increased income will help her save for future needs. The other members of the group also need a loan to expand their current businesses. The loan will help boost their income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and start her beauty products selling business.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio continúa con su negocio de venta de artículos varios. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la reparación del techo de su casa, para que no entre agua y sus hijos puedan dormir tranquilos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque trabajo normalmente y no tuvo problemas. En esta ocasión solicita un crédito para la ampliación del depósito en su domicilio. Este depósito es donde almacena la mercadería, está construido de adobe y la pared filtra agua, esto ocasiona que los productos se dañen y generen perdidas económicas, “estoy mejorando mi vivienda para el bienes de mi familia…” comenta. La ventaja de su casa es que la construcción es antigua y fácil de demoler, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la ampliación del depósito de su negocio. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida su familia, él desea realizar la ampliación de depósito de su casa para guardar la mercadería. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 17 años que trabaja en el comercio.
Es por estos motivos que Florencio solicita un préstamo para la ampliación del depósito de su casa para guardar la mercadería.
texts.en: Florencio continues with his business of selling diverse items. He invested the loan to repair the roof of his house, so that no water would leak and his children would sleep peacefully. He made his loan payments on time because he worked normally and had no problems. This time he is requesting a loan in order to expand his house's storage area. This is where he stores merchandise. It is built of adobe and the water filters through the walls, which causes the goods to be damaged and to generate financial losses. "I am improving my house for the well being of my family", he comments. The advantage of his house is that the building is old and easy to demolish; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to expand the storage space for his business. His dream is to improve his family's quality of life. He wants to expand his house's storage area in order to store merchandise. This is his 4th loan cycle with the institution in the 17 years he has been working in commerce. These are the reasons why Florencio is requesting a loan to expand his house's storage space in order to store merchandise.

loans.use: to expand his house's storage space in order to store merchandise.

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina de 48 años de edad que luego de la pérdida de su esposo ha logrado reponerse y salir adelante ella vive junto a su hijo mayor de edad que le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Marina se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza todos los días de forma ambulante, es así como ella se sostiene económicamente. Marina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para construir un servicio sanitario en su vivienda, ya que el que tiene es de fosa y los malos olores le están causando enfermedades respiratorias, por lo que invertirá en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, inodoro y tuberías para construir un servicio sanitario y mantener el saneamiento de su hogar y comunidad.
texts.en:
48 year old Marina, after the loss of her husband, has been able to recover and move forward with life. She lives with her adult son, who helps her with household expenses. Marina sells clothing items, which she has been doing daily as a street vendor; this is how she supports herself financially.

Marina is requesting a loan from FUSAI to build a restroom in her home, since what she presently has in an outhouse and the bad smell is causing her respiratory illnesses. For this reason, she will invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, a toilet and pipes to build a restroom and maintain her home and community sanitized.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, a toilet and pipes to build a restroom and maintain her home and community sanitized.

loans.name: Paul David

texts.es:
La ciudad de Santo Domingo es caracterizada por ser el puente que une a la sierra de la costa, además es muy conocida en el país porque habita la etnia Tsáchila. Aquí vive Paul un joven microempresario de 21 años, dedicado mucho a sus estudios y su negocio.
Desde hace dos años atrás él comenzó a vender ropa de manera ambulante,  recorría todos los días; luego tuvo la oportunidad de ponerse un local en una de las ferias de ropa más importantes de la ciudad, gracias a la ayuda de un familiar ahora él ya tiene su negocio fijo donde atiende solamente los días sábados de 4 de la mañana a 2 de la tarde; ya entre semana se dedica a sus estudios universitarios, por eso trabaja duro para poder seguir con su educación a pesar de que sus padres también le apoyan.
Paul es cliente nuevo para la institución, con este crédito él podrá surtir más mercadería, comprará blusas y faldas, se siente muy agradecido con KIVA, ya que gracias a este impulso seguirá incrementando y fortaleciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
The city of Santo Domingo is known for being the link between the mountains and the coast. It is also known all over the country for being the home of the Tsáchila people. This is where Paul, a young entrepreneur, lives. He is 21 years old and works and studies hard.

Two years ago, he started to sell clothes as a street vendor. He worked walked the streets every day until he had the opportunity to open an establishment at one of the most important clothing markets in the city. Thanks to a relative, he now has a place where to sell his products. He opens it on Saturdays, from 4 am until 2 pm. During the week, he goes to the university. He works hard in order to be able to continue studying, although his parents also help him.

Paul is a new client of the institution. With this loan, he will buy more products, such as blouses and skirts. He is grateful to Kiva; this push will help him to strengthen and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new products, expand his business, and continue paying for his studies.

loans.name: Pheary's Group

texts.en:
Pheary lives in a rural village of Battambang province, is 26-year-old and she has two children, one of whom is in school and another one is under age of school. Selling grocery items is the primary source of her income for five years. Moreover, she works as paid worker to earn the supplemental income.
Due to lacking of working capital to support her current business, she is now leading a group of two members to take a Kiva’s loan, which will be her first loan cycle with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion in order to buy more kind of grocery items to attract more customers and increase the number of sales. She hopes to earn more income through this loan so that she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to attract more customers and increase the number of sales and income to keep supporting her child at school

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is married and she is a business women. Now she is 28 years old. She has a very small business, so she has an idea to request a loan from the Tuba Rai Metin. Because she wants to open her kiosk into a bigger store, so she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 to add with her capital. She will used this loan to buy more items aqua,eggs,salts,coffee,candle,tea,sardines,including soft drinks and other things to sell. She started her business a few year ago, with her own working capital. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy aqua,eggs, salt, coffee, candles, tea, sardines, including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.pt:
Senhora Lídia tem 49 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 2 filhas estão na sua responsabilidade frequentando o ensino secundário, e costureira, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, chapas, azulejos, para dar continuidade a construção da sua boutique.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua boutique e começar a prestar serviços de fabrico, venda de roupas e acessórios em lugar seguro e convidativo visto que agora presta serviços a céu aberto.
O seu desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Lydia is 49 years old and is married with five children, two of whom still live with her and are in high school. She works as a seamstress and she and her family live in their own home.

Lydia plans to use the money from this loan to buy cement, sand, metal plates, and tiles in order to finish construction of her boutique. Her main plans for the future are to finish this construction project and then to begin to offer services like dressmaking and sales of clothing and accessories in a place that is safe and inviting. Currently she offers her dressmaking services in an open air market.

Lydia also plans to pay off this loan on time and as indicated so that she will have the possibility of taking out further loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, metal plates and tiles in order to continue with construction of her boutique.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 62 years old and married with six children. With one child still in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, detergent soap, seasonings, beers, diapers, etc. 

Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc.for her food vending business.

Tessie has been in this business for 16 years. Tessie earns more income from general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: No Confusion Group

texts.en:
Wara is a member of “No Confusion” solidarity group. She sells slippers. Wara has been in slippers business for the past two years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her child’s education and to provide livelihood for hers family. See Wara (is in the middle of the group picture).
Wara and other group members of No Confusion solidarity are requesting for their first loan of 5,000,000SLL. Of this amount, Wara will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more 20 dozen pairs of slippers for her business.
Wara is thirty-one year, single and has a cheerful family with one child.

Wara hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to build a house and also prepare for her old age. Wara hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family
Wara and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase more 20 dozen pairs of slippers for her business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 42 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Zenaida has a general store business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Madelena

texts.pt:
Senhora Madalena tem 52 anos de idade, separada, mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 não estão na sua responsabilidade e uma frequentando o ensino secundário, é avicultora e vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de pintos, rações, vacinas, para a criação de frangos.
No futuro pretende gostaria de comprar camioneta para o transporte de mercadorias e construir dependências para o arrendamento.
O seu desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
Madalena is 52 years old and is separated with three children, two of whom still depend on her financially and one of whom is in high school. Madalena works raising chickens and she and her family live in their own home.

Madalena plans to use the money from this loan to buy chicks, feed, and vaccines to raise chickens. In the future she would like to buy a truck to transport her merchandise and also build houses on her property that she can rent out. She plans to pay back this loan on time so that she can take out other loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and vaccines in order to raise chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: galvanized steel sheets, wood and nails, to replace the roof of her home and avoid an accident due to its deterioration.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in women's, men's and children's clothing, as well as beauty products, to improve her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
A cliente Alice tem 48 anos de idade é comerciante, casada mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino secundárioe outro o ensino primário em Quelimane, e vive em casa própria.
 O cliente conseguiu com os empréstimos anteriores comprar mercadoria para o seu negocio e com este pretende comprar, cerveja diversa, frozy, fizz, fosforo, velas, tomate cebola, para reforçar o seu negocio.
O cliente tem como sonhos ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes, construir casas para arrendar de modo a aumentar a renda familiar.
Tem como desafios financeiros  e tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos
texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in high school and one of whom is in elementary school. She lives in Quelimane in her own home and works running a store.

Alice has used previous loans to buy merchandise for her store and with this loan she would like to buy a variety of beers and soft drinks as well as candles, matches, tomatoes and onions, in order to restock.

Alice's plans for the future are to expand her business to respond to the needs of her customers and to build houses on her property that she can rent out to increase the family's income. The main difficulties that she has had to overcome have been financial ones but she has been working and plans to take out more loans in the future in order to overcome obstacles and make her plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beers, soft drinks, candles, matches, tomatoes, and onions in order to restock her store.

loans.name: Lidia Ester

texts.es: Lidia es una mujer de 44 años de edad que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, es por ello que hace 12  años decidió dedicarse a la siembra de yuca, pepino, elote y frijol lo cual le ha permitido generar ingresos y llevar el sustento a su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 5 años de edad que son su mayor alegría. Lidia desea obtener mejores ingresos es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: abono y semillas para el cultivo de hortalizas y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 44 year old woman who is always looking for a way to get ahead. For this reason twelve years ago she decided to work growing yucca, cucumber, corn and beans. This has allowed her to generate income and provide sustenance for her family.

She lives in her own house together with her husband and three children aged 10, 7 and 5 years old who are her greatest source of happiness. Lidia wants to obtain greater income so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in manure and seeds for her vegetable crops and in this way improve her income.

loans.use: to invest in manure and seeds for her vegetable crops and in this way improve her income.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 39 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines.

Cherry has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for five years now. Cherry would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal, wood, nails, and wire to change the roof and avoid an accident.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a 40-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and a mother of three children ages 18, 16 and 7 years old. Her husband is a driver, while Glenda buys and sells gasoline. She has been doing this for two years. Aside from buying and selling, Glenda is engaged in sari-sari store business.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and dry goods for her sari-sari store such as laundry soap, cooking oil, spices, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, biscuits, candies and chips. In the future, Glenda wants to uplift her income to have a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, laundry soap, cooking oil, spices, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, biscuits, candies and chips.

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is 37 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 2 and 8. She helps her husband in farming rice, bananas and vegetables. She also raise hogs, native chickens and sells slightly used clothing, known as Ukay-ukay.

Meraluna hopes for her family to have a comfortable life; the reason she works hard for them. She is asking for a loan to buy chicks, piglets and more clothes to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for school fees and healthy meals for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks, piglets and more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with four children. Her husband works hard as an employee while Paulita helps her husband by running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this for two years and hoping that their livelihood will take an upturn. Aside from her sari-sari store business, Paulita is also engaged in raising pigs.

With this, she is asking for a loan to buy food and dry goods for her sari-sari business, such as sugar, spices, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk. In the future, Paulita wishes to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk.

loans.name: Janine

texts.en:
Janine  is 26 years old and married with one children. Janine  works very hard to provide for them.

Janine  runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Janine  has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cereals, coffee, juice, milk, candies, etc. 

In the future, Janine  would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. Lorna is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Lorna requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business.

Lorna has been in this business for 17 years now.

Lorna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer que lucha día a día para salir adelante junto a su familia, actualmente vive con su esposo e hijo y ella solo estudio hasta segundo grado. 

Sara, se dedica actualmente a la comprar y venta de mariscos desde hace aproximadamente 5 años, atravez de este negocio genera los recuros necesarios para llevar el sustento para su familia.

Sara, necesita el crédito para comprar más mariscos y hacer crecer su negocio, porque la afluencia de clientes es mucho mayor y ha visualizado que necesita más mercadería para cubrir la demanda; es por ese motivo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito. 

Sus sueños a futuros son, seguir en trabajando con su negocio y darle una educación adecuada a su hijo.
texts.en:
42-year-old Sara is a woman who works hard every day to get ahead in life with her family. She currently lives with her husband and son. She only went to school until the second grade. 

Sara has worked for approximately 5 years buying and selling seafood. This business generates the necessary income to support her family. 

Sara needs this loan to buy more seafood and grow her business, as demand from customers is high and she needs more products to cover it. This is why she decided to request a loan. 

Her dreams are to continue with her business and provide a good education to her son.

loans.use: to buy more seafood.

loans.name: Iria

texts.pt:
A cliente e comerciante, casada mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 já são maiores e independentes, 1 vive com ela mas também é trabalhadora, vive em casa própria.
 O cliente conseguiu com os empréstimos anteriores começar a sua casa tipo 2 e com este valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, ferro, cimento, porta, chapas de zinco, pagar a mao-de-obra e o transporte para dar continuidade da sua obra.
O cliente tem como sonhos concluir e ampliar a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, e futuramente e comprar um carro para lhe facilitar no dia-a-dia.
Tem como desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus
texts.en:
She is a businesswoman. She is married and has three children; two of them are independent adults, and one lives with her, but also works. She owns the house where they live.

With the previous loans, she was able to start building a two-bedroom house. With this one, she is planning to buy iron, cement, a door, and zinc sheets, and pay for the transport and labor needed to continue with the construction works.

Her dreams are to finish building and enlarging her house in order to offer her family a better home. In the future, she would like to buy a car, which would make her everyday life easier.

Her challenges are financial in nature. She has continued working and is planning to apply for more loans to overcome the difficulties and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, doors, and zinc sheets, and to pay for the labor and transport needed to continue with the construction works.

loans.name: Susanne

texts.en:
Susanne began doing bookkeeping when she was living in Germany. There, she attended a vocational school where she studied bookkeeping and accounting and upon completion, received a professional certificate. She then worked as a bookkeeper in Germany for ten years until 1993, when she and her now ex-husband moved to the United States. She worked in bookkeeping in the U.S., and then began her own business in 2000.

This was a home-based business for ten years until five years ago, when she moved to an office space. Having the new space made a big difference for the business and led to a large increase in the amount of business she was able to handle.

Susanne had some health issues, so she had to stop operating the business. However, she began operations anew in 2013 and has been working hard at increasing her client base. She felt re-energized and able to accept more clients and work at a faster pace. After this struggle, Susanne is now determined to continue to run and grow her business to provide for herself.

Susanne will use the Kiva loan to hire a part-time accountant to assist with the increase in clients. She is currently working full time to service the current clients she has, and continues to have additional clients come to her for services.

loans.use: to hire a part-time accountant.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 3 y 8 años. Y su negocio es el tejido artesanal de mantas. 
Ella es paciente, amable, y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘virgen de Copacabana’ situado al sur de la ciudad de clima templado y frio con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-21 grados centígrados. 
Veronica  es de piel morena como la tierra, cabello negro como la noche, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), y su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza juanto a su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuanta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración de mantas de forma artesanal, completamente hechas a mano. Ella no cuenta con un taller el trabajo lo realiza en su casa y  no tiene espacio, “no tengo espacio en mi casa donde trabajar y quiero construís un taller de tejido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja en su, la desventaja es la falta de espacio donde poder trabajar. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de tejidos, ella desea construir un cuarto para utilizarlo como taller de tejido. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que lleva realizando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Veronica solicita un préstamo para construir un cuarto para utilizarlo como taller de tejido.
texts.en:
Verónica is a 33 year old woman, married with two sons of 3 and 8 years of age. She works making handcrafted blankets. She is patient, kind and very hardworking. She works in the "Virgin of Copacabana" zone, in the south side of the city, which has a temperate-to-cold climate, with temperatures that varies during the day between 4 and 21 degrees Celsius.

Verónica is of dark complexion, like the soil, black hair like the night, her attire is traditional (hat, shawl and skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives with her husband, who works, and their children, who attend school. They live in a brick and cement, tin-roof, wooden-floor house that belongs to their family. It has drinking water services, electricity and sewerage.

Her business is the production of handcraft blankets, completely made by hand. She does not have a shop, all her work is done at home, but she lacks the room. "I do not have space in my home where i can work and I want to build a weaving workshop..." she tells us.
The advantage of her trade is that she works from home, the disadvantage is the lack of space where to work.

Her dream is to open up a weaving store, she wants to build a room to utilize as a weaving workshop. This is the first loan cycle with this partner in the 4 years that she's been working independently. These are the reasons Verónica is requesting a loan, to build a room to utilize as her weaving workshop.

loans.use: to build a room to utilize as her weaving workshop

loans.name: Meldred

texts.en:
Meldred is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 41 years old and blessed with a two-month-old daughter. To earn a living, she is engaged in buying and selling imported used clothes known as “ukay-ukay” in Visayas Region. Some Filipinos prefer to buy “ukay-ukay” more than new clothes in department stores; maybe because “ukay-ukay” is more affordable and durable.

It is in demand in some places in the Philippines. Thus, Meldred needs to have additional capital to buy more “ukay-ukay” to sell. In the future, she hopes to have a permanent location of her business, which will enable her to gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy ukay-ukay (imported used clothes).

loans.name: Nelly Maria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Nelly, una señora muy trabajadora y responsable, habitan en casa propia junto con su esposo y su hijo adoptivo.
Nelly es clienta de Fundación Alternativa, desde hace varios años, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos, a pesar de que su esposo no se encuentra bien de salud ella siempre ha trabajado muy duro para salir adelante porque anteriormente tenía el apoyo incondicional de él. Nelly comienza su rutina de trabajo por la mañana, tanto ella como su hijo pelan las papas, aliñan el pollo y ya por las tardes se dirigen al local llevando todo lo necesario para empezar atender, ellos venden unas deliciosas salchipapas y papipollo, cuentan con mucha clientela por la atención y la buena preparación de los alimentos; es una microempresaria muy feliz porque su negocio marcha bien.
Nelly con este crédito podrá comprar la materia prima para su negocio como papas, pollo, salchichas y varios, para seguir fortaleciéndose; se siente muy agradecida ya que siempre la institución ha estado presta a ayudarla, además se siente feliz por que continuamente se los visita para ver si todo marcha bien. Nelly asegura seguir trabajando con una institución que le ha abierto las puertas por lo que agradece a KIVA por permitirle salir adelante y apoyar a su esposo.
texts.en:
In the city of Santo Domingo lives Nelly, a very hardworking and responsible woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband and her adopted son.

Nelly has been a client of the Alternative Foundation for several years. She has always been characterized as being very punctual in her payments. In spite of her husband being unwell, she has always worked very hard to get ahead, because previously she had his unconditional support.

Nelly starts her work routine in the morning. Both she and her son peel the potatoes and season the chicken. In the afternoons they walk to the shop, carrying everything necessary to start attending to it. They sell delicious salchipapas (pan fried sausages and potatoes) and papipollo (pan fried chicken and potatoes.) They count on many customers because of the attention and good preparation of the foods; it is a very happy microbusiness because her business does well.

With this loan Nelly will be able to purchase staple items for her business, like potatoes, chicken, sausages, and other things, to continue getting stronger. She feels very grateful since the institution has always helped her. In addition, she feels happy that they continuously visit her to see if everything is going well. Nelly guarantees to continue working with an institution that has opened doors to her, and so she expresses thanks to Kiva for allowing her to succeed and support her husband.

loans.use: to purchase staple items for her food business, and to support her in her income to care for her sick husband.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery continúa con su negocio de venta de desayuno y sándwiches. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de una congeladora para almacenar alimentos. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo dificultades. En esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos de cocina, como; jamón, carne, huevos, aceite, pan, etc., para abastecer su negocio, “cerca de mi casa existen 2 paradas de buses que son clientes continuos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
