Rosmery continues with her business of selling breakfast and sandwiches. She invested the previous loan in the purchase of a freezer where she could store food. The payment of her dues was on time because she experienced no difficulties.

This time around, Rosmery requests a loan for the purchase of kitchen supplies, such as: ham, meat, eggs, oil, bread, etc., so she can stock her business.

"Close to my house there are 2 bus stops, where I have returning customers," she says. The advantage her business has is that she has daily sales; the disadvantage is the lack of working capital to stock her business. Her dream is to expand her business. It is for these reasons that Rosmery requests a loan.

This is the 3rd loan sequence she is going through with this institution in the 4 years that she has been working in this business.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies to stock her business.

loans.name: Blanca Vilma

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 53 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo desde hace muchos años. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de mangoneadas (fresco de fruta congelado), chocobananos, entre otros, además vende verduras obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. Blanca desea en su negocio, ya que cada día son más las personas que solicitan sus productos y siente que no cumple con los pedidos solicitados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: verduras, frutas, azúcar, salsas, entre otros para mejorar su negocio y sus ventas.
texts.en: Blanca is a woman of 53 who has lived in her own home with her husband for many years. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living with her small business selling mangoneadas (frozen fruit drink), chocobananos (bananas dipped in chocolate), and other treats. In addition she sells vegetables, obtaining more income. Blanco has hopes for her business, as every day more and more people ask for her products and she feel she is not fulfilling the orders requested so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that she can purchase vegetables, fruit, sugar, sauces, and other ingredients for improving her business and her sales.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, fruit, sugar, sauces and other ingredients for improving her business and her sales.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is a 45-year-old woman who dreams of having a stable business in the future, a business that can help her raise her two children. The ages of her children are 21 and 9 years old.

Rosario is from Baybay, Leyte and is engaged in buying and selling frozen goods. She has been doing this for three years. Her husband is a factory worker and work hard to provide for the needs of their family.

To uplift their livelihood, Rosario is asking a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy frozen products such as hotdogs, chorizo, and ham. She hopes that in this way she could help her husband in their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy hotdogs, chorizo, and ham.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is a sari-sari store owner from Baybay, Leyte. He has been doing this business for five years to earn a living. He is married and has a four-year-old daughter.

Ronaldo wants to have a stable business that would help them sustained their day to day living. This sari-sari store is their main source of income.

Thus, he wants to borrow money to buy additional stocks such as soft drinks and goods like noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice and milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered juice and milk, candies, chips, biscuits, laundry soap, noodles, and canned goods.

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
Fredelyn is 32 years old, single, and lives in Tagmanocan, Lazi, Siquijor. She is living with her parents and she wants to meet their needs.

She has signed up for membership and is availing her first loan to head start her chosen business. The amount that she borrows will be used to purchase bags of animal feeds for her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds for her hog fattening business.

loans.name: Laila Fe

texts.en:
Laila Fe is in the farming business. Unable to pursue her studies in college due to financial constraints, she stood on her own feet and decided to venture into something that would give her a good income. 

She asked her neighbor to let her cultivate their land and started her vegetable production business. She turned to Paglaum MPC for financial support.

 She successfully repaid her previous loans with the coop and this time is asking for another loan to purchase bags of fertilizers as a head start for another cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is a strong willed man who will do anything to fulfill his dreams. He is 33 years old, single, and lives in Napo, San Juan, Siquijor.

He operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives him a quarterly income of approximately PHP 10,000 that is sufficient to provides for his needs.

He is also saving an amount in preparation for rainy days. Recently, he avails another loan to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador  es un pequeño productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive en su pequeña finca con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en edades de 8 a 15 años. Toda su vida ha estado relacionado con la actividad cafetalera, y desde hace unos 20 años se dedica a la producción de este rubro como principal actividad económica para su familia.

Para este ciclo, este emprendedor está solicitando un crédito para la compra y aplicación de insumos que le permita garantizar las actividades de mantenimiento y continuar mejorando la productividad de su finca.

Su sueño es que su familia viva dignamente con los ingresos de su finca, y darles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades para que puedan formarse.
texts.en:
Salvador is a small coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. He lives on his small farm with his wife and their 3 children, who are between 8 to 15 years old. His whole life has been related to the coffee industry, and for 20 years he has dedicated himself to his production in this sector as the principal economic activity for his family.

For this loan cycle, this entrepreneur is requesting a loan for the purchase and application of farming supplies, which will enable him to ensure he completes maintenance activities and to continue improving the productivity of his farm.

His dream is that his family will live in dignity with their farming income, and to give their children better opportunities for them to shape their own lives.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies required for his coffee plantation and to improve the productivity of his farm.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. 

Lilibeth is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Nirina

texts.fr:
Nirina est un homme âgé de 44 ans. Il vit avec sa femme et ses trois garçons dans un quartier près du grand marché d’Antsirabe. Il est vendeur de fruits depuis 12 ans. Son savoir-faire et ses expériences lui ont permis d’avoir beaucoup de clients fidèles. 
Nirina est parmi les premiers emprunteurs de Vahatra, cela fait 12 ans qu’il bénéficie successivement des prêts. Avec les bénéfices, il a pu envoyer un de ses fils dans une université privée et construire une maison. 
Pour ce prêt, il compte acheter  600 Kg de tamarins et de jujube et 1000 pièces d’ananas. Il arrivera à écouler ces produits très vite car il a des clients venant de tous les provinces de Madagascar. 
Il espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices afin que ses enfants puissent poursuivre des études supérieures. Il veut aussi constituer de l’épargne pour la construction d’une autre maison.
texts.en:
Nirina is forty-four years old and lives with his wife and their three sons in a district near the main market in Antsirabe. He has been selling fruit for twelve years and his knowledge and experience have attracted many loyal customers.

Nirina was one of the first people to work with the field partner, Vahatra, twelve years ago. He has used his earnings over these years to send one of his sons to private university and build a house.

This loan will enable Nirina to buy six hundred kilos of tamarinds and jujubes, and one thousand pineapples. His customers come from all over Madagascar so he will be able to sell this stock very quickly. The resulting profits will help his children with their higher education studies. Nirina would also like to save some of his profits so he can build another house in the future.

loans.use: to buy 600 kilos of tamarinds and jujubes, and 1000 pineapples to sell at the main market in Antsirabe.

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married with a five-year-old daughter.

To earn a living, Nelsa and her husband are engaged in the fishing business. They have been doing this for six years to sustain their daily needs.

Nelsa wants to improve their livelihood. Thus, she is asking a loan of PHP 5,000, hoping that she could buy materials for boat repair such as plywood and paint. In the future, she is planning to invest in another business that would help them increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy plywood and paint

loans.name: Novelyn

texts.en:
Novelyn is a strong willed woman who will do anything for her family. She is 42 years old, married, and lives in Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. 

She operates a hog raising business which is primarily financed by Paglaum MPC that gives her a quarterly income of approximately PHP 20,000 that is sufficient to provide for the needs of her family. 

Recently, she availed another loan to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy piglets and purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Zigamibanga Group

texts.fr:
J. Caritas fait partie du groupe  Zigamibanga et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 44 ans et est marié a Déo un cultivateur .Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants  âgés de 11  à 23 ans, tous étudient. 
 
Elle fait le commerce de choux et de l’amarante depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de choux et de l’amarante   à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait   voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Caritas is a member of the Zigamibanga Group and lives in Gitega. She is forty-four years old and married to Déo who is a farmer. Together they have six children aged between eleven and twenty-three years old. All of their children are studying.

J. Caritas has been selling cabbages and amaranth for seven years. This will be her sixth loan with the field partner, Turame. It will increase her working capital and allow her to buy a large quantity of cabbages and amaranth.

In the coming years, J. Caritas would like to see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of cabbages and amaranth.

loans.name: Afi Enyonam

texts.fr: Mariée, âgée de 32 ans et mère d’un enfant,  Afi vit à Adidogomé et vend  des gingembres et des oignons. Afi  s’approvisionne  deux fois par mois puis les revendent au marché. Vue les besoins de sa clientèle, Afi sollicite un crédit pour satisfaire aux demandes de ses clients et gagner plus de profit ; ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux épargner en vue d’aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer puis soutenir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is thirty-two years old, married and has one child. She lives in Adidogomé and sells ginger and onions. Twice a month, she buys new stock which she sells at the market.

Afi has requested this loan to respond to the demands of her customers and increase her profits. This will allow her to save more and help her husband provide for the expenses of their household. In the future, she will also pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of onions and 1 sack of ginger for sale.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
To earn a living, Monaliza is engaged in the hog raising business. She is a 33-year-old woman and has three children aged 11, 10, and 6 years old.

Monaliza has been engaged in this business of raising pigs for two years. In the future, she wants to improve her business so she could build her own big piggery.

As for now, Monaliza is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy additional piglets. Aside from that, she also runs a vegetable farm which also gives them an extra income.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: Mère de trois enfants, Mathilde est une femme mariée âgée de 49 ans résidant à Agoè. Mathilde est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile pour gagner ses revenus. Mathilde désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de maïs et de riz. Avec le résultat positif escompté, Mathilde va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mathilde is forty-nine years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Agoè and sells food products.

Twice a month, she buys new supplies from the market and then sells it from home to earn her living. This loan will buy sacks of maize and rice.

Mathilde plans to use her earnings to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family and pay for a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of maize and 4 sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Facilia

texts.fr: Facilia, 36 ans, habite à Delmas avec son compagnon et leur enfant. Elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits alimentaires depuis 7 ans. Grace au microcrédit, elle a beaucoup développe son commerce. Elle continue à solliciter du crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Facilia is thirty-six years old and lives in Delmas with her partner and their child. She began selling food products seven years ago and has developed her business thanks to the various loans she has received.

Facilia will use this loan to increase her stock levels.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Yawa est une femme âgée de 31 ans résidant à Agoè. Yawa est une commerçante de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Yawa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de détergents afin d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit en vue d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes  éprouvées.
texts.en:
Yawa is thirty-one years old, married and mother to four children. She lives in Agoè and sells general food products. Twice a month she buys her stock from the market and then sells it from her home or on foot in neighbouring districts.

Yawa has requested this loan to buy boxes of detergent to increase her stock levels and improve her profits. Her earnings will help her husband pay for the education of their children and their day-to-day costs.

loans.use: to buy 11 boxes of detergent.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of four children. Her eldest is 12 and the youngest is 1. She and her family lives in Ormoc, Leyte. She started a buy and sell of rice for a business a year ago. Since rice is a staple food, she never run out of customers. She is asking a loan to expand her business and buy more rice to sell. Her income will be primarily for the education of her children. In the future, she hope to expand her business, acquire more stocks to offer on credit to increase customer base. Mary Jane dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda  is a married woman from Ormoc, Leyte. She has three children ages 12, 13 and 17. 

She is raising hogs for an income so she can help the needs of her family. She plans to use her loan to buy hog feed to fatten her hogs and more piglets to raise. Imelda hopes that she would be able to produce healthy hogs that will attract buyers from the wet market at a good price. 

She plans to improve and increase the hogs that she is raising in the future so her business will be more stable.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora lives in Ormoc, Leyte together with her husband and three children ages 3, 5 and 8. She is in the business of hog raising for three years now. 
Melchora gives her best to earn a living in order to provide support for the needs of the family. Her business provides her the income that she needs.
However, Melchora wants to renovate her house at the moment to give her family a decent shelter while keeping her business. She is asking a loan to buy nipa shingles, hard wood, gravel and cement. 
Melchora's income from hog raising will be used for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy ipa shingles, hard wood, gravel and cement.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.en: Gualberto is 38 years old and from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in a transportation business using his tricycle. This vehicle transport passengers from her place to the next village or as requested. This has been his business for two years. He also farm rice for a living. He earned PHP5000 per month. He is asking a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer, seedlings and  pay for the renewal of his driver’s license. It is his dream to continue expanding so he can secure the needs of his four children ages 2-14.

loans.use: to buytwo sacks of fertilizer, seedlings and  pay for the renewal of his driver’s license

loans.name: Hermogena

texts.en: Hermogena is from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with two dependents ages 16 and 19. She operates a fish pond for 11 years now. This type entails diligence, hard work and perseverance. She is asking for a loan to buy chemicals to clean her fish pond because this needs to be done so that the fish will thrive and remain healthy. It will pave way to a better production and higher sales from her fish pond. She plans to make her business more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to clean her fish pond

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
As a married parent of twelve children, Felomina works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Felomina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, woods, etc. for her business.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like bamboo, nails, woods, etc. for her business

loans.name: Iren

texts.en:
Iren is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a raising pigs business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Iren has been in this business for 2 years. Iren earns more income from general store.

Iren has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is from Bien Unido, Bohol.  She is married with one dependent aged seven years old. She is a hardworking woman that she engaged in two businesses, running a Sari-sari store business and hog raising business. Mercedita is asking for a loan of PHP7000 PHP to buy additional stocks of merchandise for her store such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, snack food, vegetables, spices, fish, condiments, piglets and feed. She will continue to work hard so she can provide for her family and provide for their basic needs like food and education for her child.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, rice, chips, snack food, vegetables, spices, fish, condiments, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en: Rossel is 34-year-old married woman and a mother of a eleven-year-old daughter. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods like chips, candies, shampoo, canned food, diaper, biscuits and bath soap. Rossel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, shampoo, cigarettes, biscuits and candies. With this, Rossel will be able to increase her stock and attract more buyers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Rossel has hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family like food and to pay the school expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to  buy canned goods, coffee, sugar, salt, shampoo, cigarettes, biscuits and candies

loans.name: Erna

texts.en: Francisca is a 41 year old woman from the community of Alicia, Bohol.  She is married with three children ages 7, 13 and 15. Francisca is engaged in rice farming and bamboo matting for 7 years now. This is her main livelihood to support the needs of her family. She also raise hogs for a living. She is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo, rice and feed for her animals. She hopes that she can continue sending her children to school and make a success out of her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo, rice and feed for her animals.

loans.name: Welina

texts.en: Welina is a 53-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her "Painitan" business. Painitan literally translates to "to warm the stomach with". This kind of business offers food in the early morning and in the afternoon, as snacks. Just like other Painitan business, Welina serves hot chocolate, biko (rice cake made from sticky rice, with sugar and coconut milk), steamed rice, suman (made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk, and often steamed wrapped in buli or buri palm, usually sprinkled with sugar) and bread. Welina has been in the business for 12 years now. This is the source of her income. Welina is asking to take a loan to buy more ingredients like sticky rice, sugar and coconut. With this, Welina will be able to cook and sell more to her customers. Her income will provide healthy food for him and her husband and pay for household bills. In the future, she hope to offer other type of food to increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy sticky rice, sugar and coconut

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina, 64, is a Sari-sari (general) store owner from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a widow and has eight adult children. Sabina has operated her retail store for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Sabina is asking to take a loan to buy more stocks of goods to sell like rice, ground corn, soft drinks, gasoline, liquor, toiletries, seasoning and condiments. A loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more customers to her store. In the future, Sabina hopes to introduce more merchandise that she does not previously carry to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, soft drinks, gasoline, liquor, toiletries, seasoning and condiments

loans.name: Anna Therese Aloha

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anna Therese Aloha works hard to support her family.

She has a repair shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling personal collection products. Anna Therese Aloha is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional tools and other equipment for her repair shop business.

Anna Therese Aloha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 55 years old and married with six children. 

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Adelaida has been in pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Clarita is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Clarita has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella works hard to support her family. Estrella is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Estrella requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, spices, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Estrella has been in this business for 15 years now.

Estrella would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, cooking oil, spices, meat, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 37 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Eva has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, soft-drinks, fabric conditioners, etc. 

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. Melanie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Melanie has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Melanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas works hard to support her family. Necitas is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Necitas requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more items of ready to wear to sell.

Necitas has been in this business for 7 years now.

Necitas would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Emelina requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emelina has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Emelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Alba Cecilia

texts.en:
Alba is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello, north of Medellín. She lives there with her partner. Since she was a little girl, she has had many dreams. One of them was to have her own business someday, since she’s always been an independent woman. Unfortunately, she hasn’t been able to do that.

This can change, because she’s determined to start her business now. She has always been talented in the kitchen, and loves cooking, so she wants to start there. She’s asking for a loan so she can start her food business and buy some refrigerators and tables for her place. 

She believes that her business can be successful, can have many customers and can have great sales. In the future she dreams of having her own house, so she’s going to work hard to achieve that. You can help Alba to start her business on the right foot and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to start her food business and buy some refrigerators and tables

loans.name: Abaticumugambi Sub Group B

texts.en:
Abaticumugambi is a group led by Jacqueline, who is 24 years old. The group name means “important people” in English. 

Jacqueline is married and has 2 children, aged 2 and 5. She is a tailor and has been in a business for the past 2 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more clothes for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living, and will also go to her savings. The other group members sell different items and they have the same idea of changing their lives.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring.

loans.name: The Most Beautiful Flowers - 16-03-04P6Đcương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chinh is 50 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture planting flowers for more than 10 years. Chinh lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income house hold in village, moreover the income from this job is unstable because the output over each year is not fixed, it belongs to many factors such as weather conditions, seeds.

The main hardship that Chinh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more types of flowers to plant and sell in the future.
This is Chinh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could help her improve her life standard.

Chinh is the group leader of 16-03-04P6ĐCương, which consists of 7 members.
With her business profit, Chinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more types of flowers to plant and sell in the future.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
SARAN is a 43-year-old woman from a remote area of Kompong Speu Province. She is a mother of four children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice for sale. She is able to make an income USD 1.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for around ten years.

She would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen less smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en: Remelita is a 31-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is married and a mother seven young childsren. Remelita and her husband raise their seven children by doing the hog raising business. Which is a quite difficult for their daily consumption because raising hogs takes few months before it will turn into cash. With that, Remelita is looking forward to start other business like doing the sari-sari store in order to have stable income each week. As for now, Remelita is requesting a loan to buy piglet and feed as well. In the future, she dreams to have sustainable business to increase their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy piglet and feed

loans.name: Jeslyn

texts.en:
Jeslyn is a married woman with one children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeslyn is 20 years old and has one child who is in school.

Jeslyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jeslyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Jeslyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Jeslyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezel is 24 years old and has one child who is in school.

Liezel has a manicure business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment.

Liezel has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new manicure tools and equipment.

loans.name: Cheoun's Group

texts.en:
Cheoun, 22, is a young farmer living in Kampong Cham province and she has two dependent children who are all in school. Growing cassava and rice farming are the primary sources of her family’s income for four years. She is able to earn around 11USD per day. Recently, the price of crop is decreasing, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family’s living.

Due to lack of money to upgrade her family’s living, she decides to take a Kiva’s loan in order to buy a decent latrine for her family’s uses to improve the health and protect her children from illness. This is Cheoun’s first time with VisionFund. She hopes that this loan will help her to reduce the cost of health care service, which able her to save more money to future needs and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a decent latrine to improve the health and protect her children from illness

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy purlins, wood and metal sheeting to improve the roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.name: Luceros De Lucma Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LUCEROS DE LUCMA, el banco está ubicado en el sector de Lucma, distrito de Vilcambamba, provincia de la Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Severina continúa  dedicándose a la ganadería y a la agricultura, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de  fertilizantes y abono.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, venta de alimentos, restaurante, cultivo de café, venta de bebidas.
El socio que sale en la foto adjunto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en: She is a member of the LUCEROS DE LUCMA communal bank located in the Lucma sector, Vilcambamba district of the Convención province and Cusco department. Severina continues to farm and raise livestock and she is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her payments on time. She has been doing this for a long time and it brings her personal satisfaction. She is a responsible person and supports her family in this manner. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and compost. The other members raise livestock, sell food, have restaurants, raise coffee, and sell beverages. The gentleman whose picture is added on arrived late due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost.

loans.name: Yadira Ester

texts.es: Yadira en su microempresa de trapos industriales cuenta con una amplia trayectoria, actividad  que inició hace diez años luego de haber laborado como operaria realizando esta misma labor en la que vio la oportunidad de iniciar su propio negocio.  Su proceso productivo consiste en armar retazos de telas que le venden por kilos y luego los une en su máquina de coser hasta lograr el producto final, limpiones o trapos industriales que son muy comercializados en almacenes ferreteros. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una maquina industrial y tener un mejor desempeño en su microempresa.  Yadira es madre de cinco hijos quienes se han beneficiado gracias a su trabajo con el que ha logrado abarcar gastos en el hogar y en compañía de su cónyuge salir adelante. Su meta a futuro es realizarle adecuaciones a su lugar de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yadira has had her industrial mop micro-business for some time now, having started the business ten years ago. She previously worked as a labourer in the same job but saw an opportunity to start her own business.

The production process consists of gathering together bits of material that she buys by the kilo, and then putting them together on a sewing machine. She thereby creates the final product: industrial cleaners or mops that sell very well in large ironmonger shops.

Yadira is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy an industrial sewing machine and to be more productive at her business.

Yadira is a mother to five children who have benefited from her work. She has been able to cover household costs and move forward with her partner.

Yadira's future goal is to make improvements to her workplace.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Catalina se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Catalina espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Catalina is 38 years old and lives with her husband and children in a rustic home located in the Pucará district of the Jaen province, within the Cajamarca region of the northern mountains of Peru. Life here is peaceful and the residents are farmers, merchants, and raise livestock.
Catalina raises coffee, has 10 years’ experience, and comes with good personal and professional references in the area. She will use the money from this loan to buy compost and fertilizer in order to maintain her coffee crop and also to pay for labor during the harvest. Catalina expects to offer a better quality coffee to her customers and positively impact her income and quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace her roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Las Leonas De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO.
La socia María Carmen continua dedicándose a su negocio de  restaurant, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando  diferentes tipos de platos a la carta entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para cocinar.
Los socios en general  agraden   el préstamo y se comprometen  a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo
texts.en:
She is a member of the LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO communal bank. Maria Carmen continues her restaurant business and is a responsible and enterprising lady. She makes different types of dishes for her customers and has been doing this for many years, which brings her personal satisfaction because she supports her family in this manner.

She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients. The members in general are grateful for the loan and she is committed to making her payments on time. Those added to the photo were late due to work commitments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
La señora Iris de 30  años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene 02  hijos  que dependen de ambos y vive en casa propia, su casa está ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Iris se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas, sus clientes son los amigos y personas que transitan por su casa y los vecinos que a diario la visitan, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, cal con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos,  es un cliente que solicita su tercer crédito, uno de sus sueños es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Iris is 30 years old, lives with her husband, and has two children who depend on them for support. They all live in a home of their own, located in San Lorenzo, in southern Honduras. Iris has been making tortillas for three years and her customers include her friends, neighbors, and others who pass by her house. She is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead. She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn, firewood, and lime. She expects to increase her income with the help of this [third] loan. One of her dreams is to make improvements to her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – July 2015

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores De Tiobamba Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS TRIUNFADORES DE TIOBAMBA, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Santa Ana , provincia de La Convención  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Francisca  tiene 65  años de edad tiene 04 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al cultivo de frutas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
Las personas mayores de 65 años de edad están excluidas del sistema financiero formal y gracias a los inversionistas de Kiva pueden lograr su financiamiento de tal manera la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: She is a member of the LOS TRIUNFADORES DE TIOBAMBA communal bank, located in the Santa Ana district, La Convencion province, within the Cusco department. Francisca is 65 years old, has four children, and lives with her husband. She raises fruits and has been doing this for a long time. Things are going well, thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She would like to continue working to support her family. Persons over 65 are excluded from the formal credit system, but she is able to obtain a loan thanks to the Kiva lenders. She is committed to making her payments on time and will use the money to buy seeds, compost, and other things. The members are grateful in general.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a cement floor in her home.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, de 39 años de edad, es agricultor, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a lavar ropa ajena, de esa manera genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de su hogar; en su casa solo vive su pareja y su hija de 5 años de edad.

Manuel, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos, en esta segunda temporada del año, porque por motivos del cambio climático, su primer cosecha se perdió.

El sueña con ver su plantación prospera y nutrida.
texts.en: Manuel is 39 years old, a farmer, and has a fifth grade education. He is married and his wife washes clothing. In this way she generates the income necessary to pay the household expenses. Only their five year old daughter lives with them. Manuel needs a loan to buy farming supplies to plant basic grains in the second season because he lost his first harvest due to climate change. He dreams of owning his own successful and fertile plantation.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and to pay labor to cement the floor of the hallway because it becomes very slippery in the rain.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
María, de 42 años de edad, no estudio y no saber leer, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, ha trabajado de esta manera toda la vida, tuvo 2 hijos pero solo una hija vive con ella y su pareja.  

María, se dedica a sembrar plátano, este cultivo hasta el momento les ha dado buenos resultados, ellos tienen la posibilidad de mantener el cultivo con riego por canaletas en el verano y tienen cinco años de cultivar de esta manera.- Antes, se dedicaban a sembrar maíz y el lugar donde trabaja está a dos cuadras de su casa, eso le ayuda a estar pendiente todos los días de su cultivo, porque de lo contrario el plátano es delicado.

María, el dinero del crédito será para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes triple 15, para sembrar 10,500 metros cuadrados de plátano y cultivar 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, porque la sequía ha afectado la zona oriental y el maíz está a un alto precio.

El sueño más grande de María, es que en el futuro pueda tener los recursos económicos para construir su vivienda un poco más digna.- Y también quiere que su hija estudie bachillerato, porque les han prometido que el próximo año la escuela tendrá bachillerato en la comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old. She did not go to school and she does not know how to read. She is married and her husband makes a living in agriculture. He has done this job all of his life. She has two children but only one daughter lives with her and her husband.

María works planting banana trees. Until now, this crop has given her good results. They have the ability to keep growing plants using irrigation channels in the summer, and have been doing it this way for 5 years. Before, she worked planting corn and her area of work is two blocks from her house. That helps her to be watching out for her crops every day, because on the contrary, the banana plant is delicate.

The loan money will be used to buy 12 bags of Triple 15 fertilizer, and plant 10,500 square meters of bananas and grow 3,500 square meters of corn. The drought has affected the western area and the corn is expensive.

María's biggest dream is that she can have the funds to build a more respectable home in the future. She also wants her daughter to go to high school because they have been promised that there will be a high school in the community next year.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of Triple 15 fertilizer, and plant 10,500 square meters of bananas and grow 3,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Fanny Olivia

texts.es: Fanny de 64 años es una emprendedora mujer residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad, inició su proyecto de negocio al considerar el déficit de centros educativos en esta localidad; lo cual la motivó a iniciar su escuela de enseñanza básica primaria, jardín y pre jardín hace ocho años.  Inicialmente ofrecía el servicio a los niños de la vecindad, sin embargo su vocación y esmero le permitieron salir adelante con su proyecto.  Alterno a esta a actividad confecciona prendas de vestir desde su taller de modistería ubicado en su residencia. Esta polifacética mujer posee un gran espíritu de superación y desea que los niños de su barrio se eduquen en valores, buenas conductas y modales, que les permitan construir una sociedad basada en el trabajo en equipo y el respeto por las diferencias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para cancelar el canon de arrendamiento del colegio y realizarle adecuaciones locativas.  Esta inversión permitirá tener una mejor seguridad y un ambiente propicio de estudio.  La meta de negocio es continuar mejorando las instalaciones locativas y continuar ayudando a sus hijas.
texts.en: Fanny, 64, is an entrepreneurial woman who is a resident of a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad. She began her business project when considering the lack of educational centers in this town which motivated her to start a school teaching basic primary education and kindergarten eight years ago. Initially, she would offer the service to the neighborhood kids but her dedication and hard work allowed her to progress with her project. She alternates this work with making clothing from her fashion workshop located in her house. This multifaceted woman possesses a great spirit of overcoming and she wishes that the children in her neighborhood are educated in values, good conduct and manners which will allow them to build a society based on teamwork and respect for differences. Currently, she is applying for a CrediKiva, the first loan made with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to repay the fees for renting the school and to make location changes. This investment will allow her to have better security and a clean environment for study. The goal of the business is to continue improving the facilities and to continue helping her children.

loans.use: pay back the school rental fees and make facility changes.

loans.name: Juan Alexis

texts.es:
Juan Alexis, tiene 19 años de edad, estudia la carrera técnica de edificaciones.
Eligió ésta carrera ya que está relacionada a la Ingeniería Civil y la Arquitectura que sería su próxima visión de estudios superiores.
Juan Alexis desde que terminó el colegio tenía en mente estudiar Ingeniería Civil, le llamaba mucho la atención la construcción de grandes edificios que empezaban a poblar nuestra ciudad, ingresó a la universidad de Huacho pero por motivos económicos y por estudiar específicamente lo que es edificaciones se traslado a un instituto que en nuestra capital es reconocida por la rama de edificaciones.
Le faltan aún dos años para terminar la carrera, pero se le presentan muchos inconvenientes pero el más difícil de superar es el aspecto económico ya que si no paga las pensiones no puede dar sus exámenes.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en el pago de una pensión atrasada y las actuales. Gracias al apoyo que recibirá el podrá dedicarse a estudiar sin preocupaciones por lo que está muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Juan Alexis is 19 years old. He is studying in the field of Technical Building Inspection. He chose this degree because it is related to Civil Engineering and Architecture which would be his next vision for higher education. From the time he finished high school, he had it in mind to study Civil Engineering. The construction of big buildings that began to go up in his city caught his attention. He entered the University of Huacho but because of economic reasons and because he is specifically studying buildings, he transferred to a school that is known in the city for its Building courses.

He still has two years to finish his degree, and he has had many drawbacks but the most difficult one is the economic aspect because if he does not pay his fees, he can not take his exams.

The loan will be used to pay one late fee and the other remaining fees. Thanks to the support that he will get, he can dedicate himself to studying without worries and he is very thankful for that.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
CARLOS ALBERTO, tiene 23 años de edad. Él es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Eléctrica, eligió ésta carrera debido a que vio  que son afines a él y gustos.
Lleva cinco años estudiando, tuvo problemas económicos para poder cumplir con los pagos de la mensualidad por lo que en algunas ocasiones tuvo que dejar de estudiar por lo que se prolonga el tiempo para poder culminar su carrera.
Uno de sus propósito es trabajar en el área de distribución y generación de energía eléctrica.
Gracias al préstamo recibido podrá pagar las mensualidades de un ciclo de estudios y esta muy agradecido con las personas que lo apoyan en lograr su mas grande objetivo que es ser un profesional.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 23 years old. He is a student in the field of Electrical Engineering. He chose this degree because he saw that it is related to him and his tastes. He has been studying for five years. He had financial problems being able to pay his monthly fees, so he had to stop studying on several occasions which prolonged the time of completing his degree.

One of his intentions is to work in the area of Distribution and Generation of Electricity. Thanks to the loan, he will be able to pay the monthly fees of a study cycle and he is very thankful to the people who support him on achieving his biggest goal which is to be a professional.

loans.use: to pay for this study cycle in his Electrical Engineering degree.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo de 60 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humilde junto a su esposa, sus dos hijos de 9 y 17 años y su hija de 6 años. Rodrigo es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable con su familia pues quiere darle lo mejor. Rodrigo se dedica a la venta de diversos productos en los alrededores de su comunidad es así como el lleva el sustento diario a su familia y su compañera de vida se dedica al cuido de sus hijos en casa. Rodrigo solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para mejorar la cocina y tener un lugar adecuado para preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 60 years old. He lives very happily in his own humble home with his wife, two sons who are 9 and 17, and his 6 year old daughter. Rodrigo is a very hard-working and responsible man with his family because he wants to give them the best.

Rodrigo works selling different products around his community and that is how he provides for his family. His wife takes care of the children at home.

Rodrigo is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to improve the kitchen and to have a proper place to prepare his food.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to improve the kitchen and to have a proper place to prepare his food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 fishing nets.

loans.name: Padaeteng

texts.fr: Mariée, Padaeteng est femme de 52 ans qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge à Agoè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Padaeteng  prépare et vend de la boisson locale à son domicile et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Padaeteng réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce et désire ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de mil afin de tirer profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi donc leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Padaeteng is a married 52-year old woman who lives with and takes care of four children in Agoè. In order to survive and help meet the children's needs, Padaeteng makes and sells a local beverage at home, and gets her supplies twice per month at the market. Padaeteng makes a good profit margin thanks to this trade. She would like this loan in order to purchase bags of millet so as to make a profit and help her husband to take good care of their children, and hence promote their schooling.

loans.use: to buy two bags of millet.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, de 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, por dedicarse a la agricultura y es ese trabajo que le ha servido para sacar adelante a su familia, junto a su esposa tuvo 9 hijos pero solo 4 viven en casa con él.

Rigoberto, se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, actualmente solo se dedica a la agricultura y al mantenimiento de una finca, el dueño de la finca le tiene mucha confianza, es por eso que lo ha dejado como administrador de la finca y la agricultura la realiza con sus hijos, en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 11:00 a.m.

Rigoberto, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para la milpa, porque junto a sus hijos están sembrando 7,500 metros cuadrados de terreno y de igual manera está sembrando frijol, para eso le servirá mucho el préstamo y con esa ayuda  prepara mucho el cultivo y así obtendrá ganancias para su familia.

Los sueños de Rigoberto son, sacar adelante a sus hijos y seguir cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 55 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school because he worked in agriculture. That work has served him to get his family ahead with his wife. He has 9 children, but only 4 live at home with him.

Rigoberto has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old. Right now he only works in agriculture and maintaining a farm. The owner of the farm has a lot of trust in him, and that is why he left him as the manager and he does the farming with his children, from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

Rigoberto needs a loan to buy agricultural materials to grow corn. He and his children are planting 7,500 square metros of land. He is also planting beans. The loan will be very useful for him and this way he will obtain earnings for his family.

Rigoberto's dream is to get his children ahead and continue cultivating the land.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to grow corn.

loans.name: Leonor Del Carmen

texts.es:
Leonor, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y presta servicio de seguridad en una Institución, tiene 3 hijos con su pareja, los cuales están estudiando y viven en su casa.

Leonor, realiza los oficios del hogar, pero también es agricultora, ella es la mano derecha de su esposo, en el cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo; se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde que se casó, aunque ella aprendió esa actividad desde que era muy joven.- Decidió dedicar a esta actividad porque es la única forma de  ayudar a su esposo y sacar a delante a su familia, su horario de trabajo es de aproximadamente 5 horas al día.  

Leonor, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, abono y herbicidas para aplicarlo a sus cultivos, también ella quiere aprovechar los residuos de cosecha para dárselo como alimento para una vaca que tiene.

Los sueños de Leonor son, seguir trabajando de la mano con su esposo para sacar adelante a sus hijos, además sueña con tener un negocio de venta de leche y queso.
texts.en:
Leonor is 35 years old. She went to school until the 6th grade. She is married and her husband works in agriculture and as a security guard in an institution. They have 3 children who are in school and live in their house.

Leonor does the house work but she is also a farmer. She is the right hand for her husband for growing corn, beans and sorghum. She has been doing this work since she got married, although she learned how to do it when she was very young. She decided to do this work because it is the only way she can help her husband and support her family. Her work schedule is approximately 5 hours a day.

Leonor needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to apply to her crops. She also wants to use crop leftovers as food for a cow that she has. Her dreams are to keep working alongside her husband to support her children, and to have a business selling milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and herbicides to apply to her crops.

loans.name: Jose Oscar

texts.es: José tiene 62 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia y humildad junto con su esposa y 2 hijos de 18 y 20 años edad. José siempre se ha destacado por ser un hombre muy trabajador y responsable para poder sacar adelante a su familia, se dedica a distribuir diversos productos en los alrededores de su comunidad y además de ello realiza viajes es, así como da lo necesario a su familia. José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar las láminas de la cocina que se encuentran deterioradas.
texts.en:
José is 62 years old. He lives very happily in his own humble house with his wife and 2 children, who are 18 and 20 years old. José has always been known for being a hard-working and responsible man who supports his family. He works distributing different products around his community as well as making trips, and this is how he gives his family what they need.

José is asking for a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to change the sheets in the kitchen that are deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood and nails to change the sheets in the kitchen that are deteriorated.

loans.name: Tchilalo

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Tchilalo est une femme âgée de 35 ans résidante à Agoè. Tchilalo  est une commerçante de pagnes qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Tchilalo  désire ce crédit pour commander plus de pagnes et de qualités afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients en vue de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married and mother to three children, Tchilalo is a 35-year old woman living in Agoè. She is a pagne cloth seller who gets her supplies twice per month at the market and sells in surrounding neighbourhoods.
Tchilalo would like this loan so that she can order more pagne cloths of different grades to respond to her client's needs. This will help her to earn an income to help her husband with the family expenses and ensure that her children have a good education.

loans.use: to buy twenty-six pieces of pagne (traditional cloth).

loans.name: Jesumene

texts.fr: Jesumene est âgée de 61 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle revend des ustensiles ménagers pour pouvoir prendre soin de sa famille. Elle vit avec son mari et leur dernier fils dans la ville de Delmas. Elle utilise le crédit pour éviter des ruptures de stock.
texts.en: Jesumene is 61 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. She sells kitchen utensils in order to take care of her family. She lives with her husband and their youngest son in the town of Delmas. She is using this loan to avoid being out of stock.

loans.use: to buy dish covers and colanders.

loans.name: Maria Conchita

texts.es: Maria Conchita es una muchacha esforzada y trabajadora que poco a poco ha salido adelante, tiene un negocio de venta de productos varios en su pequeña pulpería. Prácticamente es una mujer sola que cuenta solo con el apoyo de su abuelita. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita y esta vez para comprar un freezer que le servirá para mantener más bebidas y obtener mayores ventas y con estas mayores ganancias. Su mayor sueño es terminar sus estudios  y obtener su título como profesional para tener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Maria Conchita is a courageous and hard-working girl, who, little-by-little, has gotten ahead. She has a business selling various products in her small grocery store. She is practically a single woman who only has the support of her grandmother.

This is the second loan that she is asking for and this time it is to buy a freezer that she will use to keep more drinks and get better sales and more earnings. Her biggest dream is to finish her studies and get her title as a professional to have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Maria Jovani

texts.es:
MARIA TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA NO TIENE CON HJOS DEPENDIENTES, VIVE CON SUS PADRES,VIVE EN EL DISTRITO DE PUCARA, PROVINCIA DE JAEN, REGION CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERU. EN DICHO DISTRITO LA POBLACION SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA SIENDO EL CULTIVO DE ARROZ SIENDO ESTE EL DE MAYOR PRODUCCION, ASI COMO AL COMERCIO EN GENERAL.

MARIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ARTICULOS DE DECORACION PARA EL HOGAR COMO SON CUADROS , RELOJES, ESPEJOS, FLOREROS, CORTINAS, ETC, ADEMAS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE RECARGAS DE CELULARES, CUENTA CON MAS DE 02 AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO CUENTA CON MUY BUENAS REFRENCIAS PERSONALES, SOLVENCIA MORAL Y ECONOMICA, NEGOCIO ESTABLE. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO, COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA AUMENTAR EL STOCK Y PODER ADQUIRIR UNA UTILIDAD ACEPTALE PARA QUE MEJORE SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Maria is 27 years old. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her parents in the district of Pucara, in the province of Jaen, Cajamarca region, on the northern highlands of Peru. In this district, the people work in agriculture, with rice being the biggest production, as well as in business in general.

Maria works selling decoration items for the home, such as picture frames, clocks, mirrors, vases, curtains, etc. She also sells cell phone lines. She has been doing this work for more than 2 years. She has very good personal references, good moral and financial standing and a stable business.

She is asking for the loan to keep investing in her business. She will buy merchandise to increase her stock and be able to get a reasonable profit to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her stock.

loans.name: Taylor Xavier

texts.es:
Taylor es un joven  de  20 años, vive en casa propia junto a sus padres en el Recinto Las Delicias, un sector muy cálido y caracterizado por ser productivo, aquí se da mucho el plátano para exportación.
Taylor cuenta con su negocio propio, desde hace más de un año se dedica a la venta de batidos, tostadas y hamburguesas, está ubicado en un buen sitio justo a las afueras de un centro educativo donde por las tardes las ventas son muy buenas, él trabaja hasta horas de la noche ya que tiene bastante afluencia de clientes por ser un negocio único en el sector.
Taylor es cliente fiel de la institución, con el crédito anterior pudo comprar activos para su negocio, incrementó congeladores y licuadoras muy necesarias para su trabajo diario; ahora con este crédito va a dar una mejor  imagen a su kiosko, va a pintarlo a comprar más mesas y sillas y además a invertir en la materia prima que es leche y frutas.
Se siente agradecido con KIVA por el crédito ya que él puede fortalecer su negocio y seguir creciendo como microempresario.
texts.en:
Taylor is a 20-year-old young man. He lives in his own house with his parents in the Las Delicias precinct, a very warm sector characterized by being productive. Here they produce a lot of plantains for exportation.

Taylor has his own business; for over a year he has worked selling smoothies, tostadas and hamburgers. He is located in a good spot just outside a school where, in the afternoon, the sales are very good. He works until the night since it has a lot of flow of customers due to being a unique business in the sector.

Taylor is a loyal client to the institution. With the previous loan, he was able to purchase assets for his business, he increased his freezers and blenders which are very necessary for his daily work. Now, with this loan, he will improve the image of his stand, he will paint it and purchase more tables and chairs and in addition will invest in raw materials which are milk and fruit.

He is grateful to Kiva for the loan since with it he can strengthen his business and continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to improve the image of his smoothie stand and purchase raw materials to continue producing; in this way to continue growing as a businessman.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is a married woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. Richie has four children, ages 12, 9, 7 and 2 years old. She works to provide the needs of her children.

She engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been doing this business more than 10 years. She is asking a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy piglets and feed.

Richie is 30 years old and dreams to have a better life in the future. She dreams to improve her business and make it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Francisco Tomas

texts.es:
Francisco es un señor de 33 años, vive solo en su propia casa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad caracteriza por el comercio y la producción.
Francisco hace varios años se dedica al negocio de compra, crianza y venta de chanchos, los cría para luego faenarlos y vender la carne a clientes del sector; gracias a esto él ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos quienes viven con su madre; además de esta actividad que la realiza dos veces por semana también hace de albañil, ya que por sus buenos trabajos lo refieren mucho.
Francisco es cliente fidelizado con la institución, con su primer crédito pudo construir una pequeña chanchera para criar a sus animales ya que anteriormente las tenía en casa de vecinos, gracias a  los ingresos del negocio también pudo hacer mejoras en su vivienda; se siente muy agradecido por el crecimiento que ha visto.
Ahora este crédito lo invertirá en la ampliación y construcción de chancheras y para compra de tres animales más para incrementar sus ventas.  Está feliz por el apoyo que KIVA brinda al pequeño microempresario.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 33-year-old man, he lives in his own house in the city of Santo Domingo, a city characterized by business and production.

For some years, Francisco has worked in the business of purchasing, raising and selling pigs. He raises them to later butcher them and sell the meat to customers in the sector. Thanks to this, he has been able to support his three children who live with their mother. In addition to this work that he does two times per week, he also works as a bricklayer, since due to his good work, many people refer him.

Francisco is a client who is loyal to the institution. With his first loan he was able to build a small pig sty to raise his animals since before he had them at his neighbors' house. Thanks to the income from his business, he was also able to make improvements to his house. He is very grateful for the growth that he has seen.

Now, he will invest this loan in the expansion and construction of pig sties and to purchase three animals more to increase his sales. He is happy for the support that Kiva offers the small micro-entrepreneur.

loans.use: to expand and build more pig sties and to purchase three additional animals, and to be able to increase his sales.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Speaking with Penina, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Kapsowar, along with a handsome husband and their angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education.

She is a rural farmer from an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Penina works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she also often engages in small personal business to make extra money.

Penina is seeking a loan to buy a sheep and is planning in the near future to become a full-fledged sheep farmer. Through the loan, she will be able to sell mutton and wool to her neighbours and to the local market, which has a ready demand. With this loan, Penina is going to grow into a very successful sheep farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, with good health and a good livelihood.

Help out this humble smallholder farmer from the land of Kenya with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of sheep.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 55 years old and a widow with nine children, one of whom is in school. Arsenia works very hard to provide for them.

Arsenia has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Arsenia has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Arsenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Almost all the farmers in Africa struggle to make their way in this world because of unemployment and lack of financing from established financial institutions. This is true for Recho, 53, who is based in the Siongiroi area of Kenya and is a loving mother.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking her cow. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 8 and 12 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Recho is very ambitious. In the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marife has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

Marife is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Agatha

texts.en:
Ma. Agatha is 47 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Agatha has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Ma. Agatha would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Noe Antonio

texts.es:
Noé es un hombre honesto y de buen corazón, él se dedica a ser agricultor, sembrando y cosechando plátano desde hace un par de años. Es un hombre de familia, ha procreado tres hijos, que le ayudan a diario para sacar adelante las plantaciones.  
En estos momentos, ha recurrido a un financiamiento, que ocupara esta vez, para comprar una parcela de tierra, para sembrar más y crecer como agricultor. En un futuro quiere abrir una tienda de productos agrícolas, además de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa de habitación. Noé es un hombre que está dispuesto a trabajar duro para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noé is an honest and kind-hearted man, he makes a living as a farmer, planting and harvesting plantains for a couple of years now. He is a family man and has fathered three children who help him daily to keep the plantations ahead of the curve.

Currently Noé has turned to a loan, which he will use this time to buy a plot of land to plant more and grow as a farmer. In the future he wants to open a shop of agricultural products as well as to improve the infrastructure his house. Noé is a man who is willing to work hard for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a wood lamination business in the Philippines. Evelyn requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her business.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her wood lamination business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilla is a married woman with eight children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business and earns additional income raising pigs. Lilia is borrowing 10,000 through PHP from NWTF to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Lilia has sustained her business through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla is a 36-year-old local farmer living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has 2 school-aged children.

She has grown cassava and rice to earn an income and support her family for 18 years. The price of cassava decreased and her income is lower than in previous years.

She leads a group of five to apply for a Kiva loan with VisionFund. As a group leader, Phalla will use her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that this loan will help her to have better living conditions and save more money by reducing the cost of health care service.s

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has a pig raising business in Mahaplag, Leyte in the Philippines. She is married with five children, aged between 12 and 21 years old. Rosita has been raising pigs for one year now.
