This business requires a little patience because it takes a few months before it starts to make money. As a result, Rosita is in need of financial support so she can buy more feed. In the future, she wants to increase her livelihood by raising more pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Marieles Esther

texts.es: Marieles es una microempresaria que promueve en su taller una variada gama de calzado, ofreciendo a sus clientes opciones de compra y manteniendo aspectos significativos como la seguridad, el confort y estilos innovadores.  Una amiga le propuso realizar un curso en este arte en una academia y para perfeccionarse se capacitó en el SENA, gracias a ello hoy en día esta actividad es el principal sustento para su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos menores de edad. Esta polifuncional mujer adicional a su microempresa comercializa productos por catálogo a sus clientes y tiene muy buenas ganancias.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en encargos del catálogo. Con esta inversión su capital de trabajo se fortalecerá y podrá responder oportunamente a los requerimientos de los clientes.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su cobertura de clientes y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Marieles is a micro-entrepreneur who sells a broad range of shoes in her shop. She offers her customers different purchase options and pays attention to such important factors as safety as well as comfort and innovative styles.

A friend of hers suggested that she attend a course at an academy to perfect her art, so she trained at SENA. Thanks to that training, this occupation is the main source of income for her family which is composed of her life partner and their four young children.

In addition to her small business, this multi-functional woman sells products by catalog to her clients, and she makes a good income from this. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in catalog orders. This investment will strengthen her working capital and she will be able to respond to her customers' needs in a timely manner.

Her goal for the future is to broaden her customer base and to have her own home.

loans.use: to invest in catalog orders.

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
Jose Alvaro tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Jose Alvaro se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, además se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Jose ALvaro espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Alvaro is 30 years old, has a domestic partner with whom he lives together with their son. They live in Cayaltí which is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Life there is peaceful and the people engage mainly in trade and raising small livestock.

Jose Alvaro provides transportation services to passengers in his vehicle (motorcycle taxi) which he has been doing for several years. He also raises small animals. He has experience in this sector and has very good personal and business references in the region.

The loan will be used to make repairs and to perform maintenance on his vehicle because it is in poor condition. This will allow Jose Alvaro to offer better service to his customers, leading to more income and a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to perform repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal roofing, wood, and nails to fix up her kitchen, and tomatoes, meat and vegetables for the meals she sells.

loans.name: Nosotras Y El Group

texts.es:
La banca de emprendimiento continúa trabajando para mejorar sus negocios. El crédito anterior benefició a todas en gran medida, ya que pudieron comprar mercadería, realizar ofertas, producir mayor cantidad de pan, etc. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvieron problemas en sus negocios. En esta ocasión la banca es liderada por Karin; que es una mujer de 39 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 4 hijos de 9 meses, y de 12, 19 y 20 años, ella se dedica a la venta de pan y de salteñas (empanada tradicional), su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ’15 de agosto’ situado al sur de la ciudad y caracterizado por su extrema pobreza.
Francisca es morena, cabello largo y negro, físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (sentada a la derecha viste chompa verde y carga un bebé). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la panadería y venta de salteñas; por la mañana se dedica al horneado de salteñas que se acostumbran comer a media mañana y por las tardes hornea pan para lo hora del té, “horneo 2 veces al día, y vendo de forma ambulante hasta terminar todo lo horneado…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que la ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de harina por quintal y otros insumos como aceite, leche huevos, etc. Su sueño es consolidar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de harina por quintal. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esas razones que Karin solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harina por quintal.
texts.en:
The community bank continues working to improve their businesses. The previous loan benefited all the members to a large extent, as they were able to buy merchandise, make offers, produce larger quantities of bread etc. Their repayments were punctual because they did not have any trouble in their businesses. On this occasion the community bank is led by Karin; a 39-year-old woman who lives with her partner. She has 4 children aged 12, 19, 20, and 9 months. She earns her living through selling bread and "salteñas" (traditional meat pies). Her business is located in the 15 de Agosto neighbourhood which is in the south of the city and is known for its extreme poverty.

Francisca has a dark complexion, long, black hair and a robust physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. (She is the one sitting on the right with the green sweater and holding a baby). She shares her life with her partner and their children who go to school. They live in their own home made of bricks and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and earthen floor. It has drinking water, electricity and sewage disposal.

Her business is baking bread and selling salteñas; in the morning she bakes the salteñas as they are usually eaten mid-morning, and in the afternoon she bakes bread for tea time. "I bake twice a day, and I sell on foot until everything baked is finished..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she makes daily sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy flour by the quintal (hundredweight), and other ingredients such as oil, milk, eggs etc.

Her dream is to consolidate her business, she hopes to buy various flours by the quintal. This is the 7th sequence of loans with this institution in 3 years that helps with this. It is for these reasons that Karin is asking for a loan to buy various flours by the quintal.

loans.use: to buy different flours by the quintal.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en:
Jennefer is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennefer has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Jennefer requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Absolutely Succeed - N08K5Bdinhbsơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan is 52 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall selling snacks for five years.

Lan lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase and resell more types of food for her food stall.

In 2014, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of N08K5BDinhBSơn, which consists of six members.

Along with her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase and resell more types of food for her food stall.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is from Baybay, Leyte. She is 38 years old, married and has two children. Her oldest child is 18 years old while the youngest is 16 years old.

Her husband works hard as a construction worker while Rowena sells food (snacks) in the community just to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Rowena is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as milled rice, coconut milk, and sugar.

In the future, she wishes to become successful in her business and that they would have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy milled rice, coconut milk, and sugar

loans.name: Mey's Group

texts.en:
Mey is a single woman who is 23 years old and living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. These days, Mey grows cassava and rice as the main sources of her income. These businesses have been with her for five years.

She can earn income of only about 44,000 KHR per day, as the crop is unhealthy and it cannot produce good outputs for her. After expenses, she can save around $5 USD each day for emergency needs.

Mey has never been with VisionFund before, and this is the first time for her to apply for a Kiva loan. She is a leader of the group, which consists of five members, and she will use her loan portion in order to buy a decent latrine to improve her lifestyle and health.

She hopes that this first loan will help her to save more money by reducing the cost of health-care services in order to save for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to improve her lifestyle and save more money by reducing the cost of health-care services in order to save for future needs.

loans.name: Ma. Agnes

texts.en:
Ma. Agnes works hard to support herself. She is single and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Agnes requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ma. Agnes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jona is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jona has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Jona requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Jona has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 42 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Elizabeth has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in: wheat flour, sugar, milk, eggs, yeast, and other things, thus enabling her and her life partner to generate more income.

loans.name: Roun's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Roun is a young, single man of 21 years. To make a living, he has grown cassava and farmed rice as the primary sources of income for three years.

The main challenge for him is that the crop has been destroyed by insect pests so that he has earned a lower income than before. He is able to save about $3.50 USD each day after offsetting expenses.

This is the first time for Roun to request a Kiva loan with VisionFund. As the group leader of a six-member-group, he is going to spend his entire loan portion on buying a decent latrine to improve his health and prevent his family members from getting infectious diseases. He hopes to have better living conditions and save more money for future needs by reducing the cost of health-care services.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine to improve his health and prevent his family members from getting infectious diseases.

loans.name: Make Life Sweeter - N04Tlộchlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhân is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for two years.

Nhân lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Nhân faces is a lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

In 2012, Nhân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid three loans to Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is the group leader of the 04TlộcHLộc group, which consists of six members.

Along with her business profit, Nhân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell.

loans.name: Cesar Yovany

texts.es:
Cesar Yovany tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Cesar se dedica a dar servicios como jornalero agrícola, además Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales de corral patos, pollos y cuyes en la zona rural de su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus animales así como para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como peón agrícola, y así tener una mejor producción para ofrece a sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos lo que mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar Yovany is 39 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, whose population works in agriculture, trade, and cattle. Oyotún is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Peru. 

Cesar works as a day laborer, in addition to raising and selling farm animals such as ducks, chickens, and guinea pigs along with his wife, in the rural area of his district. He is applying for a loan in order to buy balanced feed to fatten their animals, as well as tools for his job as an agricultural laborer. He will thus be able to offer better production to their customers and increase their income, which will improve their quality of life.

loans.use: buy balanced feed to fatten their animals, as well as tools for his job as an agricultural laborer.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 32 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha operates an animal feeds business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Editha requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy different sacks of feed such as starter mass, grower mass, lactating, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a 51-year-old man who is engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years.

Rufino is from Baybay, Leyte. He is married with nine children. Four of these nine children are still dependent on him. That is why Rufino needs to work hard to provide for their needs.

With that in mind, he is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed to support them.

In the future, Rufino dreams to start a new business to increase their livelihood. He plans to have a sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Dayssi Nohemy

texts.es: Dayssi es una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de superación de 47 años de edad, habita en vivienda propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad. Dayssi desea incrementar sus ingresos para mejorar la economía de su hogar, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para caballeros, damas y niños desde hace 14 años y en todo ese tiempo ha ido creciendo su clientela por la buena calidad de prendas que distribuye, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la inversión de: blusas, pantalones, camisas, shorts, faldas, vestidos, etc. Ella espera contar con esa ayuda y de esa forma obtener mayores ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dayssi is an enterprising woman with a desire to improve herself. She is 47 years old, and lives in her own home with her life partner and two children ages 19 and 17.

Dayssi wants to increase her income to improve the economy of her home. She has worked for 14 years buying and selling clothes for men, women, and children, and throughout all of this time has been growing her customer-base due to the good quality of garments that she distributes.

For this reason she is seeking a FUSAI loan for investment in blouses, pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, etc. She hopes to count on this help and in this way obtain a better income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in blouses, pants, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, etc. to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 27 years old and has one child. Aiza is married and has one child still in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Aiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Aiza has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Justo Angel

texts.es:
Justo tiene 54 años y vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua, junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos con edades entre 15 y 24 años; los que asisten a la escuela de su comunidad.

Este  emprendedor se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace más de 20 años, y actualmente lo manejo bajo la certificación de Comercio Justo. Señala que la producción de su café en los últimos 3 años ha pasado de 16 a 27 quintales, y que para este ciclo su meta es continuar incrementando su producción, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le permita adquirir los fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal.

El sueño de este productor es que sus hijos puedan continuar estudiando, y que si él no logró estudiar ni la primaria, sus hijos puedan tener mejores oportunidades para tener una profesión o mayores conocimientos para aplicar en su finca.
texts.en:
Justo is 54 years old and lives in a community to the north of Nicaragua along with his wife and their three children who are between the ages of 15 and 24 and who attend school in their community.

He is an entrepreneur who has been dedicated to coffee farming for more than 20 years and currently manages it under the Fair Trade certification. He says that his coffee production in the last three years has gone from 16 to 27 quintals and for this season his goal is to keep improving production for which he is requesting a loan that allows him to acquire the fertilizers that his coffee crop needs.

This producer's dream is that his children can continue their education and since he failed to finish primary school, that his children can have better opportunities to have a profession or greater knowledge to use on the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers that his coffee crop requires.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En los últimos 3 años su producción de café ha pasado de 80 a 200 quintales de café.

Para este ciclo su meta es continuar incrementando su producción y por tanto los ingresos para su familia. Para ello, está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal para un adecuado mantenimiento.

En el futuro este pequeño productor se ve produciendo, como mínimo 500 quintales de café de buena calidad. Para ello, uno de sus principales desafíos es aumentar el área de café y darle un buen manejo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a small producer of coffee who lives in a rural community to the north of Nicaragua. In the last three years, his coffee production has gone from 80 to 200 quintals of coffee.

For this season, his goal is to keep increasing his production and thus his family's income. For this, he is requesting a loan that allows him to buy the inputs and fertilizers that his coffee crop needs for adequate maintenance.

In the future, this small producer imagines producing, at a minimum, 500 quintals of good quality coffee. For this, one of his main challenges is expanding the area of coffee and managing it well.

loans.use: to buy the inputs and fertilizers that he applies to his coffee crop to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en: Lea, 38, is a married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lea has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy supplies for her business such as fish bait, gasoline for her boat, bamboo, and other materials. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her fishing business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna, 52, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna has had a fish vending business in the Philippines for 10 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her stall. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Cristita is from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is a 52-year-old woman, married and has four children. Her youngest child is 19 years old. Her husband works hard to provide for their needs.

Cristita helps her husband by selling banana cue to the community. With that, she is asking for a loan to buy banana fruit, cooking oil, and sugar.

In the future, she wishes to increase her livelihood by doing other business to add to her earnings.

loans.use: to buy banana fruit, cooking oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Reah

texts.en:
Reah is 24 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Reah has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Reah has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Lucia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Milagros Carmela

texts.en:
Milagros Carmela is 46 years old and married with three school age children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

Carmela has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has run her general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Milagros Carmela aspires to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en: Ronita, 41, is married with two children, who attend school. Ronita has raised pigs in the Philippines for 10 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs. Ronita has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie is 34 years old, married and has one child who attends school.

Marvie raises pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marvie has raised pigs for three years and has borrowed three times in the past, from NWTF to sustain her business

In the future, Marvie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ansole

texts.en:
Ansole is 54 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ansole is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Ansole has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 53 years old, married with four children.

Letecia raises pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Letecia has raised pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Letecia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 50 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, diapers, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie is 33 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school.

Vergie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Vergie has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Vergie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 37, is a woman with four children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has a food processing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like oil, salt, sugar, and other supplies to use in her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like oil, salt, sugar and other supplies to use in her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Gemma has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, roll-on, etc.

Gemma has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Gemma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, roll-on, etc.

loans.name: Srey Tol's Group

texts.en:
Srey Tol, who is 35, is a farmer living in a rural area of Kratie province’s Snoul District and a married mother of five dependent children, two of whom are in school.

Growing cassava has been the main source of Srey Tol's income for ten years. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn additional income to support her family’s living. Her crop has not grown well because she has not had enough pesticides and fertilizer to use on her farm. This is a problem for her in earning income to support her family.

Srey Tol has never been with VisionFund before; this is the first time for her to get a Kiva loan. In a group of six, Srey Tol is the group leader. She is willing to manage her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yields and use the rest of money to buy pesticides to protect her crop from being destroyed by insects.

Srey Tol hopes her crops grow healthily and allow her to sell them at a higher price to get more income so that she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yields so that she can earn more income to keep her children in school.

loans.name: Guilhermina

texts.en:
Guilhermina has a kiosk in her house and has been in business since 2000, She started with her own working capital of $600.

Guilhermina is taking the loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy supplies including detergents, cooking oils, sardines, biscuits, coffee, sugar, candies, shampoo, noodles, rice, wheat, soft drinks and other things to sell.

Guilhermina is very happy that Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan because she can use it to improve her business. She hopes with this loan can help improve her management.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Jlg-018-Elunootrumangalam Group

texts.en:
The sanitation crisis in India is a result of poor infrastructure and lack of education. Alagammal belongs to Kulithalai, in rural Tamil Nadu. She is a 40-year-old lady who works as a daily wage labourer in the agricultural sector. She has five members in her family, including three children. Her monthly savings are only INR 1,150, and the monthly medical expense is around INR 800. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Alagammal’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Joining hands with Mahalakshmi and Rajeshwari, whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, she has formed a group of three members and is hoping to address this issue. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Alagammal, Mhalakshmi, and Rajeshwari and their families. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. So, together, they seek a loan of INR 42,000 to build a toilet at home.

As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses. Your loan will provide all three families access with improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 57 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Perfecta has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Perfecta has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
A 36-year-old widowed woman living in Kampong Cham province, Oeun is the mother of a schoolchild. To support her living, she grows rice and has worked as a tailor for 18 years. She can earn income of around 6 USD per day, and she is able to save about 3 USD each day after expenses. Her crop has been destroyed by insect pests and causes her to get a very much lower income than before.

Now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, and this is the first time for her with VisionFund. With the loan, she will buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide to produce a good yield. She hopes that this first loan will help her to get more income so that she can upgrade her living lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase productivity of her crop yield and generate more income to support her child's studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak, 28, is a farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Sak is a mother of two young children; one attends school.

Because her crop was destroyed by insect and weeds, Sak did not have not enough working capital to farm this season.

Nowadays, Sak raises pigs and grows cassava and rice to support her family. She can get additional income by working for others for a fee. Sak has been involved in her businesses for ten years and her daily income is about $17 per day.

Sak has been with VisionFund for three loans cycle and she repaid her previous loan completely.

Now, Sak has decides to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund of 1,500,000KHR to buy fertilizer and seeds to increase her crop yield and buy more pig feed to support her pig raising business.

She hopes get more income so she can send her children to school.

loans.use: to spend on fertilizer and seeds to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Jlg-008(A)-K.pettai Group

texts.en:
Nageshwari is a 54 year old lady who works as a daily wage laborer in the agricultural sector. She has three adult members in her family.

Her monthly savings is Rs.1,750 only and monthly medical expense are around Rs.350.

She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Her family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family is forced to walk a kilometer just to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Family members, especially their women and daughters are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Joining hands with Karuppayi & Krishnaveni, whose families face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Nageshwari has formed a group of three members and is hoping to address this issue.

So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 42,000 to build a toilet at home. This loan will cover the cost of raw materials and labor. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses.

Your loan will provide three families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: to fund the construction of a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of smoked herring.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 19 years-old single lady from a village near Nablus city.

She is a student in the university where she studies health management. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Her father works as an employee in the public sector. His income is barely covers all the family needs.

Samah took a loan from FATEN to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Samah will be able to register at the university and pay part of her expenses.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is 36 years old. She is married and has two children. Agriculture is her family occupation. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ranjana

texts.en:
Ranjana is 30 years old. She is married and has two children aged 12 and eight.

Ranjana established a poultry farming business seven years ago. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid seven previous loans from Patan BPW.

Ranjana used her recent loan to purchase chicks and grains for their food.

In the future, Ranjana plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed for her poultry farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
To make a living, Chosie operates a tailoring shop. For more than four years, Chosie has done well.

She has successfully repaid her previous loans. To gain more Chosie decided to took a new loan to repair and buy an additional sewing machine.

Chosie's plans for the future is to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business.

loans.use: to repair and buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 28 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To earn a living, she engages in selling goods in order to provide for the needs of her customers.

She aims to have a greater income, so she decided to avail herself of a loan to buy more goods such as canned goods, coffee, sugar, and noodles.

Jenilyn's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase addtional goods to sell.

loans.name: Mirojiddin

texts.en:
Mirojiddin is a strong man. He was born in a southern part of Tajikistan in 1988. He is living in remote district with his family and is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper. He is a master of renovation and construction. He is many years of experience working serving people.

His mother is sick. She needs permanent medical service. He appealed to IMON asking financial support to treat his mother at a medical clinic. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lender’s compassion.

loans.use: to have his mother treated at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Marfe

texts.en:
Marfe is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marfe is 45 years old and has five children who attend school.

Marfe has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy corn, sugar, margarine, cheese and coconut fruit for her business.

Marfe has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marfe would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, margarine, cheese for her business.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu, age 40, is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marichu has three children who attend school.

Marichu has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell.

Marichu has been in this business for four years. In the future se would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with eight children. With one child in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as condiments, peanuts, home care products, and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as condiments, peanuts, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old, single and works very hard.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Susan has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, 23, is a rural villager and a married mother of a small child who is under school age. She is living in Mondulkiri province. Growing cassava has been the main source of her family’s income for two years, and working as a paid worker is an additional source of her family’s income to complement her family’s needs.

Recently, her cassava has not grown well because it was destroyed by insects, which is the main challenge for her.

This is the first Kiva loan for her group, which consist of four members with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy pesticide to protect her farm from destruction by insects pest. She hopes that her crop will grow well and gain her more yield than the previous season.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her farm from destruction by insect pests and enable her to earn more income to send her children to school.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from Baybay, Leyte. She is a 46-year-old married woman and has three children. One of these children, aged 15 years, is still attending school.

Teresita's husband is a construction worker while she is engaged in a food (snacks) selling business in their place. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Teresita is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as cassava, banana fruit, flour, cooking oil, sugar and coconut milk. In the future, she is aiming to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava, banana fruit, flour, cooking oil, sugar and coconut milk.

loans.name: Gjyste

texts.en: Gjyste wants to build a toilet because her family does not have one. 'Our hygiene and sanitation must be improved and we would very much appreciate the lenders' help," said Gjyste to the branch assistant who interviewed her.

loans.use: to build a toilet for her family, which hasn't had one

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. He is 54 years old. He lives in a wooden pile house with his wife, who is also a weaver and her son, who is still studying. His has 3 other children are already working and/or married. His family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field.

In 2013, he was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Phoeun makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. He uses his weaving income to pay for his family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field and to develop his business. Thanks to the loan, he will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support him so he can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees .

loans.name: Argentine

texts.fr: Argentine, 29 ans, est divorcée. Elle a un enfant dont elle s’occupe seule. Ne pouvant pas trouver d’emploi, elle a décidé de monter sa propre activité. Elle revend des sous-vêtements et des produits cosmétiques. Le crédit lui permet de renouveler ses stocks et d’être toujours en mesure de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Argentine, age 29, is the divorced mother of one child whom she is raising alone. Unable to find employment, she decided to launch her own activity selling undergarments and cosmetic products. These loans allow her to replenish her stock and to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy men's undergarments.

loans.name: Sreyneat

texts.en:
Sreyneat is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 18 years old. Her family owns 7 hectares of rice fields and 1 hectare of cassava field.

In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Sreyneat makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for fertilizer and diesel for the field.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hassan is an 18-year-old, single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp.

He lives with his family in a small, old house, and he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Hassan has a stall in the city for selling cosmetics. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of conflict.

Hassan took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him buy a new collection of cosmetics to sell at his stall.

He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Al Amale Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is the featured borrower for al amale Group. She joined other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. Each member is working hard to develop their businesses.

Shahnaz is a 41-year-old married mother of three. She started, three years ago, preparing and selling "Mouneh" from her house to help her husband in cover family expenses.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy raw materials (yogurt, groats, thymes, etc.) to increase her production. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who hopes to stay capable of satisfying her family's needs. Shahnaz is the second lady on the right.

With respect to the other group members, Zainab is the first lady on the right, Hawraa is the second lady on the left, and Khouloud is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to increase her production.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 30 years old, single, and has one child. She operates a retail shop, which she has been doing five years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Caroline requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy sodas, sugar, milk, soap, clothes, bags, gas cylinders, etc. for her shop. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to have a happy family

loans.use: to purchase sodas, sugar, milk, soap, clothes, bags, gas cylinders, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and a dairy cow

loans.name: Tomorrow Must Be Nicer - N03Ttâyhlộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huận is 40 years old, and she is married with four children. Huận lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of the 03TTâyHLộc, which consists of five members.

She has operated a food stall, selling fish for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low-income household in their village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, there are many people who also sell fish in this area, so the income is not high enough because she has to offer very competitive prices.

The main hardship that Huận faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to resell.

In 2012, Huận joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huận has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Huận hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: We Are Happy - N14Tthắngqlợi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An is 31 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for five years.

An lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. In addition, the income from this job is unstable because when some diseases of poultry happen, the poultry could die so she has nothing to sell and will be in trouble with finances.

The main hardship that An faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, An joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. An has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. An is the group leader of N14Tthắngqlợi, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, An hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is 64 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marisol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Marisol has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Marisol would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.
